loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
This is Ana, 39, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Arnulfo, a driver, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while also operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Ana oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has a one-unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, for which she is paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 every day. To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, as well as for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ana dreams to have her own house and lot and hopes to give her children a good quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and it is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

Footnote: Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn and modified the jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, which is open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy enough for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives with her family in the village of Samburu. She has sold fruits and vegetables for three years.

The greatest challenge that has arisen is the increase in product prices due to inflation. She is very thankful to Kiva and Yehu for the support she is receiving. Their support continues to help her improve her business inventory, so that she has working capital at her disposal to continue investing during the rest of the year. With this loan she will be able to buy tomatoes, cabbages, kale, potatoes, mangoes, bananas, etc.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbages, kale, potatoes, mangoes, bananas, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Griselda Maricela

texts.es:
Griselda, desea continuar invirtiendo en el negocio de pupusas, frutas y verduras, con esto es como se mantiene ella y su hogar, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder comprarse materiales de cocina como quesillo, maíz, aceite, verduras, frutas, que le permita sostener un buen nivel de inventario para realizar sus ventas.
Ella nos comenta que su experiencia con el préstamo anterior fue favorable, mejorando su negocio, en esa ocasión solo tenía el negocio de frutas y verduras, hoy en día está realizando la venta de pupusas por las mañanas y tardes, esto ha incrementado su fuente de ingreso, mejorado su condición de vida, en su casa ha comprado algunos electrodomésticos y un juego de comedor.
texts.en: Griselda would like to continue investing in her business selling pupusas, fruit and vegetables.  This is how she supports herself and her household.  She is requesting a new loan so that she can buy some cooking supplies such as soft cheese, corn, oil, vegetables and fruit.  This will allow her to maintain good stock levels for making her sales.  She says that her experience with her previous loan was favorable and she managed to improve her business.  Back then, she only had her fruit and veg business.  Now she is also selling pupusas in the mornings and afternoons.  This has increased her source of income and improved her living conditions.  She has bought some electrical appliances and a dining room set for her house.

loans.use: to buy soft cheese, corn, oil, vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Olmer De Jesus

texts.es:
Olmer tiene una tienda general desde hace 15 años, y gracias a su esfuerzo hace unos 3 años logró pasarse a vivir a una casa más grande donde tiene un local muy amplio, y aprovechando el espacio decidió incluir productos de panadería. Ahora que tiene mayor diversidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, Olmer ha podido ver como sus ventas aumentan considerablemente, por lo que su esposa y sus 7 hijos de 14, 12, 10, 8, 7, 6 y 5 años de edad pueden tener una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para salir adelante. Actualmente Olmer busca un préstamo para comprar una vitrina donde pueda exhibir los panes de mejor manera y pueda ofrecer mayor calidad a sus clientes.

Su sueño es sacar este negocio adelante y que le permita continuar progresando junto a su familia. Además aspira a terminar de pagar su casa y a ofrecerle a sus 7 hijos una educación escolar de buena calidad.
texts.en:
Olmer has had a general products store for 15 years, and thanks to his efforts, 3 years ago he was able to move into a bigger house where he has a very spacious establishment. In order to make the most out of this space, he decided to include bakery products. He has now a wider variety of products to offer to his customers.

Olmer has seen his sales increase considerably, thanks to which his wife and his seven children (14, 12, 10, 8, 7, 6 and 5 years old) can have a better quality of life and better economic opportunities to progress. Olmer is now requesting a loan in order to buy a counter in which he can display his breads in a better way and offer a better quality to his customers.

His dream is to get on with his business in order to be able to progress together with his family. He also aspires to finish paying his house and to offer his 7 children a good quality academic education.

loans.use: to buy a counter where he can display the bread in a better way and that allows him to offer a better quality to his customers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 25, is a business lady. She is married to Nason, a businessman. They are blessed with one child. She has been running a retail shop for the past year, with a monthly income of KES 6,000.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Elizabeth will use the loan to buy a larger stock of sugar, rice and maize flour for sale.

 With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of sugar, rice and maize meal for her shop.

loans.name: Awad

texts.en:
Awad is from Iraq. He is 69 years old and married with two children. His children work and contribute to the family's income. 

Awad owns a small grocery store where he sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2008. He now has a lot of experience in this field and has established a good reputation in his local community.

Awad is requesting a $2,400 loan to buy a generator. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda, 22, is a married woman with two children aged two and five. She lives with her husband in Fort Portal, Uganda. For two years, she has been operating a retail shop. She supports the family with the help of her husband, who is in the transport sector. Since she is the only one in the neighborhood with a retail shop, she is enjoying the benefits of monopoly. She has a dream of educating her children and building a good home, despite the burden of price fluctuations due to inflation. Brenda is requesting the loan facility to buy sugar, maize flour and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour and soda to sell

loans.name: Henda

texts.en: Hend, a 35-year-old married woman from Aqaba Jordan, is requesting a loan of 600 JD to buy materials to make pastry to sell. In the future she would like to open a shop to show her products and develop her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy materials for making pastry to sell

loans.name: Nana Ekua

texts.en:
Nana Ekua lives with her husband and two children in Abura. Ekua operates a grocery store, which she has done for four years. The items in her grocery store include rice, cooking oil, canned fish, canned tomatoes, drinks, biscuits, milk and soap.

Ekua uses her income to help her husband in paying their children's school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries such as rice, cooking oil, canned fish, canned tomatoes, drinks, biscuits, milk and soap to sell. With the profits she earns, Ekua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries such as rice, cooking oil, canned fish, canned tomatoes, drinks, biscuits, milk and soap to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 52-year-old poultry farmer in Mariakani. She is married and has been doing this business for the last four years with success. 

This is Ruth's fourth business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase chicks for rearing and selling.

Ruth sells chickens and eggs to her customers. The proceeds from the business will be used to expand her business and repay her loan. She hopes to excel in this business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks for rearing and selling.

loans.name: Jorge Albeiro

texts.es:
Jorge siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy carismática y esto le ha permitido que en su negocio sus clientes cada vez aumenten, pues siempre los atiende de la mejor manera y buscando ofrecerles el mejor servicio. En su restaurante, ha podido ir poco a poco superando la dificultad de capital que tenía cuando lo inició, y así su familia conformada por su esposa y su hijo de 5 años han podido ir gozando de mejores ingresos que les permite tener una mejor calidad de vida en el hogar. Actualmente Jorge requiere un préstamo para comprar insumos que necesita en su restaurante para seguir atendiendo la gran demanda de sus clientes.

Su sueño es seguir creciendo con este negocio y en un futuro abrir uno más grande, para generar otro empleo y también para mejorar los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Jorge has always been characterized as a very charismatic person, which has allowed him to increase more and more the clients in his business, because he takes good care of them always and tries to offer them the best service.

In his restaurant, he has slowly managed to overcome the difficulties with capital he experienced when he started it. In this way, his family, composed of his wife and his 5-year-old son, have been able to enjoy a better income, which allows them to have a better quality of life at home. Jorge is now requesting a loan to buy supplies that he needs in his restaurant in order to keep serving his clients' high demand.

His dream is to continue expanding this business and to open a larger one in the future, to be able to create another job position and also to improve his family's income.

loans.use: to buy supplies needed in his restaurant in order to cope with his clients' high demand.

loans.name: Ansaf

texts.en: For cultural reasons, Ansaf prefers that her photo not appear on the Internet.  Thus the above photo is of her husband. Ansaf, 39, is a married woman who supports 6 family members in Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to pay for her home improvements, She would like to buy new furniture and some household items. She hopes to improve her socio-economic status in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly operates a clothing sales business. Her husband is a retired employee of one of the private companies in the city. They have seven children, two of whom are in college. Nelly is applying for a loan she will use to buy wholesale supplies of new clothing. She says that buying in bulk is less expensive than buying clothing by the piece and gives her a wider selection. In the future, she wants to open a boutique.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies of new clothing.

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
From Kvareli district, East Georgia, Vazha is 38 years old and lives with his wife, two children and father. His father works as a teacher at the local school and gets a small monthly salary. Vazha runs a small dairy business and produces cheese which is sold locally. He is a very hard-working young man, with a great desire to get ahead.

Vazha has requested a loan to purchase calves which he plans to raise, fatten and sell at a good price. This will significantly increase the income of the family. Vazha will reinvest his profits in his agricultural activities. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Marie Christelle's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé le 13 décembre 2008 lors de l'ouverture du Banc Villageois dont il appartient. Il est composée de femmes catholiques qui de par leur entente et solidarité ont accepté d'ouvrir à d'autres femmes le Banc Villageois.
Marie Christelle debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants, elle à aussi en charge 3 autres enfants.
Avec le prêt reçu elle envisage de faire de la transformation de produits naturelle (pain de singe, oseille, du sucre et d'autres ingrédients) 

Les bénéfices générés lui permettent d'assurer et participer à la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle compte d'ailleurs acheter un ordinateur pour son fils qui est à l'université. Elle prend aussi en charge les frais médicaux de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 13th, 2008, as part of a village bank. It is made up of an association of Catholic women who, by their by their agreement and solidarity, have accepted to open the village bank to other women. 

Marie Christelle, pictured first on the right and raising her hand, is 46 years old.  She is married and the mother of 5 children and takes care of 3 other children.  

With the loan, she plans to buy sorrel, pain de singe (fruit of the Baobab tree), sugar and other ingredients and process these into juice.  The profits enable her to provide and participate in the education of their children.  She also has to buy a computer for her son who is in college as well as support the medical expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy sorrel, baobab fruit and sugar to make juice

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva, 42, is from Capellan in Isabela Province. She has raised pigs for four years. She is requesting a loan of Php 11,000 to buy new piglets and feed, in order to raise them and sell them for additional income in the future. Eva hopes that her business will expand, so that she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Jamieleh

texts.en: Jamieleh is a 45-year-old married woman who has six family members from Al Bayader,Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to buy clothes to resell for her friends and neighbors in the same area. She hopes in the future to open a shop to increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
To earn an income to support her family needs, Janet has a general store where she offers different products needed by her co-villagers. With these activities, Janet usually generates 4,000 PHP, which she uses as rolling capital for the business and for financing her family's daily food intake. 

Currently, Janet is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy products to sell such as biscuits, canned goods, coffee, sugar and soap. Janet hopes that her business will continuously prosper.

loans.use: to buy products to sell such as biscuits, canned goods, coffee, sugar and soap.

loans.name: Sokeng's Group

texts.en:
Sokeng is a 25-year-old mother of three children. Her family lives in a rural area of the Bakan district of Pursat province, Cambodia. To earn a living, she has farmed rice on three-hectare of farmland for several years while supplementing that income by selling fish in the local area. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR and allows her to save about 5,000 KHR each day after daily expenses for future needs. Low crop yield resulting from flood is the main challenge for her paddy-field business. 

Sokeng’s group consists of three members who have just joined VisonFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying fish to resell. She hopes this loan will help her to increase her income from rice-paddy so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Estefania

texts.en:
Estefania is from the village of Capellan in the province of Isabela. She is 55 years old, married, and has adult children. 

Estefania owns and operates a store, selling a variety of products in the local community. She earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. Estefania borrowed money to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, drinks, noodles and spices for her store.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is 40 years old married with two grown children. She lives in the mountainous region of Isabela.

For four years, she has been engaged in selling a variety of products in the community. She is a very hardworking person and a loving mother. She makes sure that she can meet the needs of her children.  

She needs a loan to buy snack food, spices, canned goods and drinks for her store. She hopes that her business will expand so that she can sustain the school allowances of her children.

loans.use: to buy snack food, spices, canned goods and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Yet's Group

texts.en:
Yet is a 39-year-old married mother of eight children. Six of her children still need her support as some are still in school while others are working as paid workers with low salaries. 

To deal with daily basic needs, she grows rice on five hectares of farmland with her husband. From the current businesss, which she has been with for several years, she is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day and to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Yet has been with VisionFund for one cycle and fully repaid the past loan. The other members are just with VisionFund this cycle. In a smart manner, she has used her first loan to relieve her family’s burdens and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan of 100,000 KHR each. Yet will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice more healthfully and fruitfully so as to gain more income in order to fulfill her dream to build a proper house and to buy a decent motorbike for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima, a 42-year-old married woman from Jarash Jordan, is requesting a loan of 400 JD to buy clothes and accessories to resell. She would like to develop her enterprise by increasing product selection. In the future, Fatima would like to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy clothes and accessories to resell.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora, a 40-year-old married woman with six children, works in crop farming and animal-raising, her family's main sources of income. Aurora started her business in 2000 with PHP 4000 in capital, and thanks to persistent hard work, today she has two pigs and their offspring on her farm. Her monthly profit is around PHP 5,000. Additionally, from June to November Aurora cultivates corn crops on one hectare of rented land, thereby earning a seasonal profit.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 8000 to buy additional pigs for her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feeds for her business.

loans.name: Maharram

texts.en: Maharram is 58 years old, married, and has four children. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli, but he and his family currently live in the greater Baku region. For the past six years, Maharram has been in the taxi business. Now he needs a loan of 1,700 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) in order to buy spare parts to repair his taxi for his clients. Maharram loves his job and enjoys spending his time thinking of ways to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his taxi.

loans.name: El Progreso (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El Señor Genaro tiene la edad de 55 años, es soltero y no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, él dice que desde muy pequeño aprendió a trabajar en el campo pero el siempre habia querido iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio porque se gana un poco mas, Don Genaro desde hace un poco mas 13 años inicio  a trabajr en la cria de borregos, el realiza su actividad desde su hogar, ahi el construyo un pequeño corral el cual tiene sus borregos y todos los dias los saca a pastorear(comer pasto), el dice "mi trabajo es bonito hay que saber cuidar estos animalitos porque son delicados si se te enferma un o se enferman todos hay que vacunarlos y darle atencion", Don Genaro dice que cuando ve sus ganancias es en tiempos festivos ya que es cuando mas vende sus borregos tambien representan ganancias para el cuando una borrega tiene borregitos. El invertira este credito en la compra de alimentos y vacunas para continuar realizando su actividad. El espera a futuro sus ganacias invertirla en la compra de material de construccion porque quiere hacer un local e iniciar un nuevo negocio

Los demas integrantes del grupo son:

Herminia club de nutricion
Patricia venta de abarrotes
Rosario venta de calzado
Alicia club de nutricion 
Dora Luz venta de comida
Donaciano compra y venta de fierro viejo
texts.en:
Genaro is 55 years old and single.  He did not attend school.  He says that he learned to farm when he was very young but he had always wanted to work in his own business in order to earn a little more money.  A little over 13 years ago, Genaro started raising lambs.  He works from home where he built a small pen for his lambs.  Every day he takes them out to graze.  He says "my work is lovely but you have to know how to care for these little animals because they are delicate.  If one of them becomes ill or all of them become ill, you have to vaccinate them and give them a lot of care".  Genaro says that he makes most profits during holiday times because that is when he sells most lambs.  They also make him profits when they have babies.  Genaro will invest this loan in buying feed and vaccines so that he can continue working in his business.  He hopes, in the future, to invest his profits in buying construction supplies because he would like to build premises and start a new business.

The other members of this group are:

Herminia - who runs a nutrition club.
Patricia - who sells groceries.
Rosario - who sells footwear.
Alicia - who runs a nutrition club.
Dor Luz - who sells food.
Donaciano - who buys and sells scrap metal.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines

loans.name: Myra

texts.en: Myra is very diligent person. She is 44 years old, married with three grown-up children. Myra has been engaged in selling recycled products for three years. Myra is requesting a loan of Php 11,000 to buy used materials in the community. She hopes that her business will expand to be able to provide the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials to sell

loans.name: Falilatou

texts.fr: Revendeuse des produits d’alimentation générale dans une boutique, madame Falilatou âgée de 30ans est mère de 04 enfants. Tous sur les bancs d’école.  C’est en 2007 qu’elle démarré cette activité et elle s’y plait bien car cela lui procure des revenus lui permettant de se prendre en charge. Elle sollicite de WAGES un second crédit. Avec ce montant, elle va s’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle veut augmenter son stock et assurer le bien – être de la famille.
texts.en:
Falilatou is 30 years old and mother of four children, all of whom go to school. She has a shop where she sells general foodstuffs.

She started this business in 2007 and is very pleased with it as it provides her with enough revenue to support herself.

She is seeking a second loan from WAGES, which she plans to use to buy general foodstuffs. Looking ahead, she wants to increase her stock and ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy general foodstuffs

loans.name: Nkasidi

texts.en: Nkasidi is a woman of high integrity, a mother to six children who are in school. She is a hardworking person who is admirable for the efforts and devotion to work. Nkasidi helps her spouse who is a farmer in selling cereals at the market. She has been in this business for three years, and she is grateful to the profits she is getting from this business. She wants to continue selling and earn income to cater for her children's education but she lacks enough capital to invest in this business. Nkasidi wants to buy sacks of beans and maize.

loans.use: to buy sacks of beans and maize.

loans.name: Sern's Group

texts.en:
Sern is a 58-year-old mother of six children. Her family lives in a rural area of the Mongkoul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. 

To support her family, she has been engaging in rice growing on seven hectares of farmland. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR and she  manages her to save approximately 5,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

The shortage of water is the main challenge for her business.  

Her group consists of five female members, and Sern is the group leader. She and three fellow group members are first-time borrowers, while the remaining co-member is a second-time borrower.

Now Sern is leading her group of five members to apply for a loan with VisionFund. Sern will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice timely and fruitfully in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri is from a small village in the Telavi district. She is 61 years old and lives with her son, daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren. She works as a cook at a restaurant and earns a monthly salary. In addition, she owns a vineyard and picks the grapes in the late summer. She does all relevant agricultural works to ensure a good harvest. Meri works hard to do her best for her family.

She requested a loan to change the doors and windows in her house. The rest of the loan will be used to supply wood for the winter season. The wood oven is the most popular heating system in the region. After the wood is provided, the family will be able to spend their winter days in a warm environment. She awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: to change the doors and windows in her house and supply wood for the winter season.

loans.name: Sean's Group

texts.en:
Sean, a 27-year-old resident of Sampov Meas district located in Pursat province of Cambodia, is married and has one little daughter who is too young for school. 

To support her family, she farms rice on a three-hectare farmland and raises two pigs. Having been in this business for four years, Sean earns around 13,000 KHR per day. 

Due to the lack of water to support her rice field, Sean is now leading a group of two to seek for a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. Sean’s fellow group member has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles already, whereas the group leader, Sean, is just a first-time borrower with VisionFund. 

With her loan portion, Sean is going to buy fertilizers for her farmland. In the future, she dreams of raising more pigs so that she can expand her business as well as increase her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to apply in her farmland.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en: Marianita, a 34-year-old from the forest region of Isabela, is married with two kids. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her pig business. She has been engaged in raising pigs for one year. She hopes that her business will expand so that she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pig business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: A very responsible person, Elsa lives in the forest region of Isabela and she has been engaged in raising animals for ten years. She is requesting a loan of Php 5000 to buy feed and additional pigs to raise in able to cover the needs of her family. She hopes that her business expands so that she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feed for her business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda, 46 years old, is married with five grown-up children. She manages a store in the community and sell a variety of products. She is requesting a loan amounting to Php 10,000 to buy additional products to offer in their community. Imelda hopes that her business will grow so that she can give the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, drinks and spices for her store

loans.name: Xirdaxanim

texts.en:
Xirdaxanim is married and has four children. She is 58 years old. Xirdaxanim needs a 2000 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) to buy seeds for planting to improve her business. She has been in the farming business for the last seven years. 

Xirdaxanim tries all the time to improve her monthly income in order to support her family. She lives in the Baku region with her children. Xirdaxanim is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Mcheng'ombe

texts.en: For nearly 15 years now, Mcheng'ombe has had her business. She sells milk at the market and door to door. She is loved by many of her clients because she offers quality milk, unlike other milk sellers in her region who at times add water to increase the quantity of their milk. This has enabled her to attract many clients. With the requested loan, she will buy more milk to supply to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more milk to supply to her customers.

loans.name: Mary-Anne

texts.en: Mary-Anne is 22 years old and has two school-aged children. She is involved in the selling of different personal products. She strives so well to sustain the needs of her family, and she wishes that her business could expand. Mary Anne is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (Php) to buy additional products.

loans.use: to buy Tupperware, glass and umbrellas for her business

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta T. is from the village of Capellan, province of Isabela. She is 52 years old, married, and has two adult children. 

Aniceta owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. She earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

Aniceta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. 

Aniceta is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Meoun's Group

texts.en:
Meoun, 58, is a villager in a rural area of Pursat province’s Bakan district, Cambodia. She is married and blessed with seven children. One daughter and one son are in school and still dependent on her. 

Meoun supports her family through rice farming, while her husband complements the income by catching fish for sale. Meoun has more than 30 years of experience in her business, earning approximately 13,000 KHR per day and saving around 5,000 KHR after deducting her daily expenses. 

Meoun is leading a group to request a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 KHR in total. Meoun’s group consists of three female members, all of whom are first-time borrowers with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. With her requested loan portion, which is 1,000,000 KHR, Meoun will cover the cost of plowing her rice field and buying some petrol. She hopes to see growth in her business so as to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing her rice field.

loans.name: Rosadilla

texts.en: Rosadilla is 45 years old and from the forest region of Isabela. She is engaged in raising pigs in the community to sell in the future. Rosadilla is a very responsible person. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy pigs and feed for her business. Rosadilla hopes that her business will expand so that she can provide for all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for her business

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena, 48 years old, comes from the forest region of Isabela. Elena doing food production and she sells house to house. Her pancake is well known in the community. She is requesting a loan of Php 12,000 to buy sugar, flour and coconut for her store. Elena hopes that her business will expand so that she can seek the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and coconut for her food production

loans.name: Rakhim

texts.en: Rakhim is married and has two children. He is 34  years old. He needs 1,700 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) to buy food products (tea, candy, oil, rice, flour, etc.) to improve his business. He has had this shop selling food products for the last four years. He tries all the time to improve his monthly income in order to support his family. Rakhim lives in the Baku region with his wife and children. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli.

loans.use: to buy products to sell

loans.name: Eteri

texts.en:
Eteri is from a small village of the Akhmeta district. She is 60 years old and lives with her husband and two grown sons. Eteri is a pensioner. Her elder son takes wood from the forest and sells it in his village and nearby villages. The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they run a small dairy farm of four milk cows, whose milk is used for dairy production. Eteri produces cheese products and sells them at the local open market. In addition, the family owns a vineyard and agricultural land where maize is grown. They do all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The harvested production is sold locally.

She requested a loan to purchase food for the cattle. With this credit, she will purchase hay, which will be used for feeding the cattle during the fall and winter seasons. Since the cows will be fed properly in winter, Eteri will be able to receive a planned amount of milk and produce dairy products. This will increase the income of the family. The increased income will be reinvested in the family's agricultural activities.

loans.use: to purchase food (hay) for the cattle for the fall and winter seasons.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a 55-year-old retail shop proprietor in Kilifi. She is a single mother of one child aged 9. She has been operating her shop for the last 20 years with great success.

This is her second business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase salt, sugar, washing detergents, cooking oil and rice. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child and repay her loan. She hopes to have a happy life.

loans.use: to purchase salt, sugar, washing detergents, cooking oil and rice.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth is 45 years old and from the forest region of Isabela. She has been raising pigs for 16 years.  To expand her business, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy feed and pigs to sell in the future; this will bring in additional income, allowing her to sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and pigs for her store

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 31-year-old single woman. She has three children and they live in Kikuyu on the outskirts of Kawangware. She operates a grocery store in the same area and has been doing so for five years now. She gets a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

This will be her first loan from KADET Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to buy groceries like vegetables, tomatoes, etc.

In the future she wants to be a successful business lady and also provide for her children's basic needs.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: El Aserradero Group

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer de 39 años con una educación secundaria. Ella está casada con Martiniano, quien trabaja como agricultor. Tienen 3 hijos: Guadalupe, Martin y Alejandro. Hace un año, Isabel decidió empezar a vender antojitos mexicanos para ganar algo de dinero extra. Ella vende sus bocadillos los viernes, sábados y domingos, por la mañana se despierta muy temprano y comienza la preparacion de la comida y durante la tarde, pone su venta en un pequeño corredor que tiene en el patio de su casa.

Con el préstamo solicitado, Isabel va a comprar chiles, tomates, cebollas, ajo, masa de maíz, tortillas, carne, aceite, queso, crema , la col, el gas y platos de plástico. 

Ella desea que su negocio continue prosperando ya que quier que su hijos tengan la oportunidad de estudiar la universida y darles una mejor calidad de vida

Los demas integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de:

Maria Felix  Comida
Maurlia muebles de madera
Adela abarrotes
Ricarda ropa
Isadora Calzado 
Maria del Socorro pollo
Berenice ropa
Eugenio caña
Cruz venta de ropa
Nancy Alicia frutas y verduras
Obdulia calzado 
Marcela antojitos 
Demecia caña
Obdulia perfumeria
Florencia ropa
texts.en:
Isabel is a 39-year-old woman who has a high school level of education.  She is married to Martiniano who works as a farmer.  The couple have three children: Guadalupe, Martin and Alejandro.  One year ago, Isabel decided to start selling Mexican snacks to earn a little extra money.  She sells her snacks on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays.  She gets up very early in the morning and starts preparing her food.  In the afternoon she sets up her stall on a small porch that she has on her patio. 

Isabel will use the loan that she has requested to buy chilis, tomatoes, onions, garlic, corn dough, tortillas, meat, oil, cheese, cream, cabbage, gas and plastic plates.  She wants her business to continue thriving as she would like her children to have the opportunity to study at university and would like to offer them a better quality of life.

The other members of this group are:

Maria Felix - who sells food.
Maurlia - who sells wooden furniture.
Adela - who sells groceries.
Ricarda - who sells clothing
Isadora - who sells footwear
Maria del Socorro - who sells chicken.
Berenice - who sells clothing.
Eugenio - who sells sugarcane.
Cruz - who sells clothing.
Nancy Alicia - who sells fruit and vegetables.
Obdulia - who sells footwear.
Marcela - who sells snacks.
Demecia - who sells sugarcane.
Obdulia - who sells perfume.
Florencia - who sells clothing.

loans.use: to buy chilis, tomatoes, onions, garlic, corn dough, tortillas, meat, oil, cheese, cream, cabbage, gas and plastic plates

location.town: Aserradero, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is married with two sons and he has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from his young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. 

Elchin has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. With a small starting capital, thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise five years ago. Over time he expanded his business and today his business has become domestic as his family is also engaged in it. 

Today, Elchin needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of his goods. For this purpose he requested a loan of 1500 Azerbaijanian Manat (AZN). He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Bartolo

texts.es:
Bartolo, tiene 43 años de edad, es casado y tiene 6 hijos con su pareja, y vive en el municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. El es un hombre muy emprendedor, realiza varias actividades para generar ingresos para su familia. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cuenta con su terreno donde siembra arroz, maíz y ganadería. 
Hace 8 años con el fin de obtener más ingresos decidió dedicarse a vender todo tipo de libros de lectura, libros cristianos, enciclopedias y otros. Este negocio de libros lo realiza de manera ambulante y por pedidos, utiliza su propio medio de transporte que es una motocicleta para movilizarse con la venta de libros. Es un negocio rentable también al cual le dedica su tiempo libre. 
El ha solicitado un préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar para la siembra de dos manzanas de terreno de arroz, comprara la semilla, fertilizantes y pago de limpieza del mismo. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. 
Tiene como meta establecer una librería en un local fijo.
texts.en:
Bartolo, age 43, is married and has six children.  He lives in the Arizona municipality in Atlántida.  He is an very enterprising man who engages in various business activities to generate income for his family.

He has been farming since he was very young.  He has land where he grows rice and corn and works with livestock.

In order to get more income, eight years ago he decided to sell all types of books like Christian books, encyclopedias, and others.  He conducts his book business in an itinerant manner and by order.  He uses his own means of transportation, which is a motorcycle, to move around selling books.  It is a profitable business, and he sells during his free time.

He has requested a loan for 20,000 lempiras to plant two “manzanas” [a land measurement unit equivalent to 7000 square meter] of rice.  He will buy seeds, fertilizer, and pay to clear the land.  He will sell this production at the local market.

His goal is to establish a bookstore in a fixed location.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and to pay to clear the land.

loans.name: Pelesia

texts.en:
Pelesia, 58 years old, is married to Isaiah and they have one child. She sells sacks and empty bags to traders and farmers in the market place in Nakuru. 

Pelesia plans to use this loan to buy more sack bags to be able to meet her clients' demands since she has many supply orders from her various customers. 

She hopes to purchase land where she can build her family a home.

loans.use: To buy sack bags for sale.

loans.name: Luka

texts.en:
Luka is a 39-year-old businessman, he is married to Mary, who is a farmer. They are blessed with five children aged thirteen, nine, seven, six and five  respectively. He has been making and selling ice cream for the past six years with a monthly income of 19,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan from KADET Ltd. after repaying the previous loan successfully. Luka will use the loan to buy a refrigerator for storage. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open another ice cream selling business.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for storage

loans.name: Mutindi

texts.en:
Mutindi is a resident of Malindi of Coast province, Kenya. She is a mother of four grown-up children; only one attends school. Mutindi runs a food cafe, a business that she has been in operating for 10 years. She sells rice, beans, potatoes, etc. Besides this, she also owns a dressmaking shop.

She learned about Milango through an employee with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is some customers not paying on time and a seasonal business climate.

Mutindi is applying for a loan of 36,650 Kenya shillings to purchase some flour, sugar, cereals, cooking oil and other equipment for the cafe. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her living standards. She aspires to open a big restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, cereals, cooking oil and other equipment for the cafe.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has one child. She owns a green grocery, which she has been operating for three years. In this business, Celestina sells greens, fruits, vegetables, etc. She also runs a transport business, owning a motorcycle which transports people around the area.

Celestina learned about Milango through a friend with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuations and inflation, purchasing stock and a seasonal business climate.

Celestina is applying for a loan of 85,900 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables on a wholesale basis and tomatoes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business. Her plans for the future are to start other businesses.

loans.use: To buy vegetables on a wholesale basis and tomatoes.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a mother of three children. She is married and lives in Gardnersville. Her children are between the ages of 9 and 22 and are in school. Her husband is a driver.  

For the past five years, she has been selling coal. She started this business with 30 bags of coal. She is proud of her business because she makes a profit every day when she sells. With the profit, she buys more goods and helps her husband with the expenses in the home. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more coals bags for resale. Her plan for the future is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more coals bags for resale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 46-year-old food stall owner in Kilifi. She is a single mother of four children. She has been operating the food stall for the past five years with great success.

This is Mariam’s fourth business loan from KADET Ltd. She plans to purchase assorted foodstuffs and plates. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her business further and pay her children’s school fees. 

She hopes to excel in business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase assorted foodstuffs and plates.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha is a resident of Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has two children attending school. Furaha owns a charcoal business which has been in operation for the past two years. 

Furaha learned about Milango through a friend and joined the organization with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is the cost of transportation.

Furaha is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase additional stock of charcoal and to repair the store. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standards of her family. She aspires to be a wholesaler of charcoal.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of charcoal and to repair the store.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MARIA AUXILIADORA, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de granos secos como chuño, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería en uno de los mercados del Cusco, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de más mercadería para su negocio como granos secos.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: This member belongs to the 'Maria Auxiliadora' community bank.  She continues in her business selling dried grains such as 'chuño' (freeze-dried potato).  She has been in this business for years and it is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts in every day.  She sells her merchandise in one of the markets in Cusco.  The member is a responsible, hard-working person and this is how she provides for her family.  She is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise for her business such as dried grains.  She feels grateful for the loan she has been given and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business such as dried grains

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha, 49, is married and lives in Gardnersville. She has four children, ages 10 to 25. Three of them stay with her and are in school, while the fourth child lives outside the home and is independent. 

Oretha has been involved in the fish selling business for the past 13 years. She finds it very difficult to dry the fish because of the rainy season. She makes a profit when she sells. And with the profit, she buys more goods to increase her sales and help her husband with the household expenses.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more cartons of raw fish in order to dry it for resale. Her plan is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of raw fish in order to dry it for resale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 35 years old and married with four children, ages 4 to 7 years old. He runs a bar in Moriba town, in the southern part of Freetown, Sierra Leone. He was working in an office and then decided to start up a business with the money he earned from his job.

Patrick has been in this business for three years and sells assorted drinks, like Heineken, stout, and soft drinks, in his house. His business is the only income he has. He describes his main problem as insufficient capital to operate his business.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more assorted drinks such as Heineken, stout, and soft drinks. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him increase his business and educate his children. In the future, he would like to open a big bar in town. He is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more assorted drinks such as Heineken, stout, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie 31, is a single parent, who lives at Gardnersville with her children who are currently in school. Mamie has been selling mineral water and juice at the nearby school in her community for the past three years. She loves to do this business, because she is the only source of income to her children. 

Her favorite part of her business is during the dry season, when she makes more profit. With the profit she buys more goods for the business, and attends to her children's needs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of mineral water and juice for the business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of mineral water and juice for the business.

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
Kou, 29, is living together with her friend and two children at Gardnesville. Her children, 8 and 12, are in school. She has had a table for the past six years in the market where she sells rice, pepper, palm oil, cooking oil, vita, salt, and many other items. 

Kou started her business first by selling coal, and learned to sell from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cooking oil, palm oil, rice and vita (sauces) for the business. She plan to give her children a better education, and build house.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, palm oil, rice, vita for the business.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Zainab from Kandeh town Southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 1 year and 8 years. She got married after her junior secondary school level. She began this business mainly to improve herself.   

Zainab runs a clothes and textile store. She sells needles, thread, and buttons and clothes. She has been running this business for 9 years. She works at the business 9 hours a day, 7 days per week. Her husband is also a trader, but his income is not enough to support the home. She says that the main challenge to her business is price fluctuation.

Zainab has requested a loan in order to buy more needles, thread, buttons and clothes.  The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and to educate her children. In the future, she plans to open another outlet. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more needles, thread, buttons and clothes.

loans.name: Mguta

texts.en:
Mguta is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. He owns an electronic and electrical sales and service shop which has been operating for two years. In this shop, he sells radios, televisions and other electronic gadgets. He is married and has one young child.

Among the challenges his business faces, he has high taxation and the long process of procuring the stock. Mguta is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenya shillings to purchase more electronics, e.g. radios, plugs, cables, bulbs. He also intends to save the extra income obtained from this loan and use it to improve the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics e.g. radios, plugs, cables, bulbs.

loans.name: Sanita

texts.en:
Sanita lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has four children, three of whom are in school. She owns a retail shop for selling juice, bottled water, sweets, etc., and the business has been operating for two years. Sanita started the business with her personal savings.

Sanita learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation.

Sanita is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to buy retail stock of items like flour, sugar, salt, and water, etc. The extra income she earns as as result of the loan will be added to her savings to help her pay back the loan. Her future plan is to expand to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy retail stock of items like flour, sugar, salt, and water, etc.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 48-year-old Raymond from Kandeh town. He is married and has three children between the ages of 6 and 12 years old. His children are currently attending school. 

Raymond runs a bar and restaurant at his house. He sells assorted drinks, pure water, roasted meat, and snack foods. He has been running this business for 20 years. He works at the business from 8:00 am until 1:00 pm, 7 days a week, and has one relative that assists him in running the business. His business provides the only income he has.  His business is doing well, and more customers are coming to have fun. 

Raymond has requested a loan in order to buy a fan, a generator, and assorted soft drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow him to expand his business and educate his children. In the future, he plans to have a big business structure on his own. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy a fan, a generator, and assorted drinks.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has five children. She owns a retail shop for selling juice, bottled water, sweets, etc., and the business has been operating for five years. Rosemary started the business with her personal savings.

Rosemary learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation.

Rosemary is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to buy stocks of items like flour, sugar, salt, and water. The extra income as a result of the loan will be added to her savings and used to help her repay the loan. Her future plan is to expand to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy stock of items like flour, sugar, salt, and water, etc.

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus lives in the Coastal town of Likoni, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He is a shoe seller, a trade he has carried out for two years. He started off with a little stock of shoes. He learned about Milango from an employee, and joined in order to access funds for business expansion. 

Onesmus is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase new shoes. His ambition is to grow the business and employ more staff and own other shops.

loans.use: to purchase new shoes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has one school going child. She owns a clothes business which she has been operating for five years. She also owns a shoe shop.

Mary learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is inconsistency of her stock supply.
 
Mary is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of second hand clothes and shoes. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to increase the stock and improve the living standards of the family. Her dream is to open a larger whole sale shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of second hand clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a resident of Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. She is is single and operates a cosmetics business, a business that has been in operating for two years. Apart from this she also runs a mobile money transfer shop.

Catherine learned about Milango through a friend. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are seasonal business climate and bad debts.

Catherine is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy additional stock of cosmetics. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to increase her income and improve her living standards. She aspires to open other branches in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a thirty seven year old hardworking woman. She has three children, aged 12, 15 and 17. They are all living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

Regina has been operating a retail shop for three years and she also sells fire wood to earn extra income, since she is the sole bread winner of the family. Her dream is to educate her children up to university level and to buy land for farming, despite hardships of price fluctuation and inflation. Regina needs the loan facility to buy fire wood, sugar, and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy fire wood, sugar, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Manuel Ascencio Padilla Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MANUEL ASENCIO PADILLA”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por Ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Manuela es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de chompas, venta de comida, venta de fruta, pollerería, tienda de barrio, taller de cerrajería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Manuela es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por sus amigas que eran socias de la institución.  En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida, da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace años con un poco capital, con el pasar del tiempo y el apoyo del crédito lo agrando y en la actualidad genera muchos dividendos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, aceite, etc.) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Manuel Asencio Padilla" will start the second cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Centro Focal de los Andes [Andes' regional office]. It is composed of eight members and it is managed by a board where Mrs. Manuela is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them: sweater knitting, food sales, fruit sales, typical-skirts businesses, groceries stores, locksmith's shops.

The requested loan will benefit small entrepreneurs where Mrs. Manuela is a member. She mentions that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for ten years, invited by her friends, who were members of the institution. She has now a food business. She mentions that she undertook this business some years ago with little capital. As time passed, and with the loan's support she expanded it and it is currently generating a lot of profit.

The loan she is requesting is intended for increasing the capital (to buy rice, oil, etc.) which she will buy from wholesale stores and after preparing them, she will sell them in her establishment. This kind of job allows her to generate resources for supporting, as much as possible his family, since she is married and has six children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training programs in health issues.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: La Alegría Group

texts.es:
La Alegría es un grupo integrado por 16 personas ellas son:
Carolina venta de abarrotes, Rosa venta de abarrotes, Teresa venta de abarrotes, Reyna venta de pollo, Andrea venta de abarrotes, Idiana venta de abarrotes, Juliana venta de pan, Cecilia venta de ropa, María del Carmen venta de abarrotes, Vanesa venta de antojitos, Teodora venta de tacos, Mariana estética, Margarita venta de postres, Martina venta de comida, Luis cultivo de caña, Yolanda venta de antojitos. Este grupo esta ubicado en Corrales cuya principal fuente de trabajo es en el cultivo y siembra de caña de azucar.

Doña Carolina tiene la edad de 35 años, solo estudio la primaria y esta casada con el señor Jorge que trabaja como jornalero ellos tienen un hijo, ella nos platica que hace mas de 20 años con el apoyo de su esposo abrio una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su ogar en la cual a trabajado durante es te tiempo, ella a ganado mucos clientes ya que siempre le gust tener surtido de productos y darles un buen trato para  que la recomienden y vuelvan acerle el gasto, lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es que lo atiende toda la familia  y estan enseñando a su hijo a ganarse la vida desde pequeño, ella piensa invertir su credito en la  compra de arroz, frijol, azúcar, sal, aceite, dulces, refrescos, productos enlatados, arina, papel higiénico, pasta dental, para resurtir su negocio y continuar con sus ventas.
ella  espera que su negocio continue creciendo y asi poder dar a su hijo mas estudios poder  darle la oportunidad de estudiar un carrera.
texts.en:
“La Alegría” [Happiness] group is comprised of 16 people.  They are:

Carolina:  Sells groceries
Rosa:  Sells groceries
Teresa:  Sells groceries
Reyna:  Sells chicken
Andrea:  Sells groceries
Idiana:  Sells groceries
Juliana:  Sells bread
Cecilia:  Sells clothes
María del Carmen:  Sells groceries
Vanesa:  Sells snacks
Teodoro:  Sells tacos
Mariana:  Beautician
Margarita:  Sells desserts
Martina:  Sells food
Luis:  Grows sugarcane
Yolanda:  Sells snacks

This group is located in Corrales, whose main source of work is in growing sugarcane.

Carolina, age 35, only attended elementary school.  She is married to Jorge, a day worker, and they have one child.  She tells us that over 20 years ago, with her husband’s support, she opened a small grocery store in her home.  During that time she has worked hard in the store.  She has won over many customers because she always likes to be stocked with products.  She also likes to treat her customers well so that they recommend her and return to make purchases in her store.  

What she likes the best about her business is that the whole family tends to it.  They are teaching their son, since he was little, to earn a living.  She plans to use the loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, salt, cooking oil, sweets, soft drinks, canned goods, flour, toilet paper, and toothpaste.  She wants to restock her business and continue with her sales.  She hopes that her business continues growing.  That way she will be able to give her son more education, and she will be able to give him the opportunity to study for a career.

loans.use: to buy grocery store items to stock her store.

loans.name: Scott

texts.en:
Support a NY born and raised film entreprenuer! Scott was born and raised in Queens and moved to the Bronx when he began his business. He has always been passionate about the film and cinema industry. He's always been creative and decided to take his love of a hobby and turn it into a serious business. He started his business two years ago. He has however over seven years of experience working on film projects. 

His business, Dream Dept. Media, does production work for visual content for artists and marketing companies. In the last two years, Scott has done work for Pepsi, Foot Locker, and Tommy Hilfiger. Scott has been able to build a strong clientele due to the quality of his product and his kind demeanor. He is likable. 

Scott's work leans towards the urban/hip hop market. You can showcase his work by visiting his website: http://thedreamdept.com/. Scott gets most of his clients through word of mouth, social media, and marketing. Sometimes his clients tell him what their budget is and this determines the price while sometimes he provides the price based on what they are requesting. 

His clients are currently a mix of marketing companies and recording artists who need music videos or promotional videos to present their new clothing lines, product, or market their talent. Help support Scott and his business! He needs a loan to be able to purchase a new high end lens camera.

loans.use: to pay for a new high end resolution camera

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a thirty two year old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a vision of educating his children, building a permanent home and upgrading in his studies. 

Denia has been a farmer for four years and he bought land with his salary savings as a civil servant. He faces hardships of price fluctuation, inadequate capital to buy modern farming equipment and unpredictable seasonal weather changes. He has a vision of hiring employees to help expand his farming activities and of buying more land. Denis needs the loan facility to buy seeds and modern farming equipment.

loans.use: to buy seeds and modern farming equipment.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Nancy from Kandeh town in the Southern area of Bo, Sierra Leone. She is a single parent with one child aged three years. She has three additional dependents from the village.

Nancy runs a jewelry business within a busy market area. She sells necklaces, earrings, and bracelets. She has been running this business for fiveyears. She works at the business every day, 12 hours per day, and she also has more sales on occasion. This business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and financial constraints, but she thanks God that she is still in business. 

Nancy has requested a loan in order to buy more necklaces, earrings, and bracelets. The extra income from this loan will allow her to start her savings account and educate her child. In the future, she plans to become a supplier in the next five years. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more necklaces, earrings, and bracelets.

loans.name: Shamimu

texts.en: Shamimu is a hardworking married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. For eight months now she has been operating a retail shop after she got startup capital from her husband. With the income earned she has been able to pay school fees for her children and re-invest in the business. Her dream is to have a wholesale shop despite challenges of inadequate capital. Shamimu is requesting a loan to buy general merchadise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchadise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Afua

texts.en: Afua sells fabrics and African-print cloth in Brasi near Abura. She has been in this business for 7 years. Afua is married with 5 children. She uses her income to help her husband feed, clothe and pay expenses of their children. She will use her loan to purchase fabrics and African-print cloth to sell. With the new profit, Afua will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and African-print cloth to sell.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 40 years old and a high school drop out who lives at Gardnesville with her husband.  She has three children between the ages of 9 and 22, and they are currently in school.

She sells sugar, sardines, milk, candy, biscuits, bath soap, and washing soap for the past four years.  She makes a profit when she sells because she is the only one selling this type of business in the community. 

She has requested a loan to purchase more milk, candy, biscuits, sugar, and sardines for the business.  Her plans for the future are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more milk, candy, biscuits, sugar, and sardines for her business.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua bakes and sells doughnuts in Brasi near Abura, which she has done for some time now. She is married to a farmer and uses her income to help her husband pay their accommodation and utility bills. Efua needs this loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar, and cooking oil to bake and sell doughnuts. With the new profit, she will save to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar, and cooking oil to bake and sell doughnuts.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells vegetables like pepper and tomatoes at Jukwa market near Abura. She has been selling vegetables for 5 years now. She is married and uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Ekua will use her loan to purchase a variety of vegetables like tomatoes, garden eggs, pepper, etc. for sale. With the new profit, she wants to mount a stall for the sale of her vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables like tomatoes, garden eggs, and pepper to sell.

loans.name: Nicolasita

texts.en:
Nicolasita is married and has four children. She is 54 years old, and lives in Nailon, Tudela.  Nicolasita owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale, to earn a living.  She's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 doing this type of business.  She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizer. 

Recently, Nicolasita joined GDMPC. In the future, Nicolasita wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
This is Anita, who is 57 years old and a resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is married to Rolando, a driver, and mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Anita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Anita hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of thier work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Yesenia Paulina

texts.es:
LLa socia pertenece al banco comunal MARIA AUXILIADORA, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas, pefumes, colonias, entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería a todas sus amistades y clientes que le solicitan,  la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de más mercadería para su negocio como perfumes y colonias.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Yesenia belongs to the María Auxiliadora communal bank.  She continues with her business of selling beauty products like creams, perfume, and cologne, among others.  She has been in this business for years, and it is going well for her thanks to the daily effort she puts into the business.

She sells merchandise to all of her friends and to customers who request her products.  She is a responsible and diligent person, as this is the way that she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy more merchandise, like perfume and cologne, for her business.  

She is grateful for the loan that was granted, and she pledges to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, like perfume and cologne, for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making barbeque.

loans.name: Mirna Antonia

texts.es:
Mirna  tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dos son mujeres y dos hombres, dos de ellos estudian en la universidad, uno estudia bachillerato y otro sexto grado. Ella tiene cinco meses de participar en un festival gastronomito, vendiendo pupusas, atoles, nuegados, yuca frita, canoas, entre otros. Para comprar los insumos que necesita para la elaboración de su venta, viaja una vez al mes a una ciudad que esta a treinta kilómetros. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar un Canopi y el resto para comprar insumos para elaborar su venta.  Con la inversión, podrá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, los protegerá de la lluvia y el sol. Su objetivo, es instalar un puesto de venta de estos alimentos cerca de su casa, ya que por el momento solo participa en el festival gastronomito para generar mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Mirnia is forty-six years old, and is married with four children, two girls and two boys.  Two of her children study at the university, one is in high school, and the other is in middle school.  She has participated in a food festival for five months, selling stuffed corn tortillas, corn paste drinks, fried dumplings, fried cassava, and ripe stuffed plantains, among other items.  To buy the ingredients that she needs to prepare her foods for sale, she travels once a month to the city, which is thirty kilometers away.

The loan that she is requesting from Fundacion Campo is to buy a canopy, and to use the remaining funds to buy ingredients to make the foods she sells.  With this investment, she will be able to offer a better service to her customers, since the canopy will protect them from the rain and sun.  Her goal is to set up a food stall close to her house.  At the moment, she only participates in the food festival to generate a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a canopy and to buy ingredients to make the foods that she sells.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 38-year-old Marie from Moriba town in the Southern area of Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with two children between the ages of 13 years and 18 years old. Both of her children attend school. She began this business because her parents were in this business; she decided to carry on with the same type of business.

Marie runs a jewelry business; she sells nail polish, lipstick, bracelets, baby lotion, and necklaces. She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business 11 hours per day, 7 days per week. Her younger sister she took from the village also assists with her business. Her business is the only income she has. Marie says that the main challenges to her business are cost of transportation and competition in the market.
 
Marie has requested a loan in order to buy more jewelry, nail polish, lipstick, bracelets, baby lotion and necklaces. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her children. In the future, she plans to see her business expand. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more jewelry, nail polish, lipstick, bracelets, baby lotion, and necklaces.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos de 58 años convive con Rosa, su pareja. Por ahora viven con Lourdes de 15 años, ya que sus otros hijos ya salieron del hogar. Su vivienda es propia y se ubica en un anexo agrícola. Marcos es un hombre inteligente y participativo. Desde joven empezó con las actividades agrícolas. “Tengo como 30 años en la agricultura, he pasado muchas cosas buenas y malas, pero todo te enseña”, menciona.
Él cultiva arvejas, papas y flores de gladiolos mayormente, porque también siembra maíz y cebada, pero en pocas cantidades. Dice que para una siembra sea rentable, se debe arriesgar en invertir. Esa era una de sus dificultades, la falta de capital, que gracias a la ayuda de ustedes y MFP, logró sobrellevar.
Su meta más cercana es abrir una tienda de artículos para instalar sistemas de irrigación al lado de su hijo. Por ahora se enfoca en sembrar más arvejas y maíz, y así continuar con sus ahorros. El requiere de se apoyo para lograr estos objetivos. Éste es su préstamo número 15 con MFP. Está muy agradecido por tanta confianza. Él es el secretario de su banco comunal “Santa Cruz de Patay” y se siente cómodo con socios puntuales.
