Con el dinero podrá adquirir varias bolsas de abonos orgánicos y guano de corral e isla, para garantizar el crecimiento de sus futuros sembríos de maíz y arvejas.
texts.en:
Marcos is 58 years old and lives with his wife, Rosa.  Now only 15 year old Lourdes lives with them, since the other children have left home.  Their home is unique and is located on a farm.  Marcos is an intelligent working man.  He began farming when he was very young.  “I’ve been farming for 30 years and a lot of good and bad things have happened, but I learn from all of it,” he says.

He mostly grows peas, potatoes, and gladiolas, and small amounts of corn and barley.  He says that a crop is very profitable and he should take a risk and invest.  One of his difficulties is his lack of capital, but that he was able to overcome it thanks to MFP and your help.

His next goal is to open a shop with his son, so that they can specialize in installing irrigation systems.  For now he is focused on planting peas and corn so that he can continue making money.  He needs this support to achieve these objectives.  This will be his 15th loan through MFP and he is very grateful for so much confidence.  He serves as the secretary for the “Santa Cruz de Patay” communal bank and feels comfortable with all his fellow members.

The money from this loan will allow him to acquire some sacks of organic fertilizer and guano to guarantee his future corn and pea crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and guano.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
This is Elsa. She previously accessed a 14,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stock of decorative plastic flowers and plants. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan for her to again buy additional stock of decorative plastic flower and plants. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Elsa hopes to expand soon. She dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She also dreams of having her own house and lot someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. At these meetings, she can also draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay back microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of decorative plastic flowers and plants needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan.  She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used buy more stocks of fruits. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to purchase more fruits needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Susan dreams of growing her business in the coming years and hopes to give a good life to her children. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of fruit needed in her business.

loans.name: Gulgaz

texts.en:
Gulgaz is 47 years old and lives with her husband and daughters. A responsible mother whose objective is to provide her family with a better quality of life through her efforts and hard work, Gulgaz operates a store where her neighbors buy products. Her daughters also contribute to the family's income.

Gulgaz has requested a loan of 1000 AZN to supply her store with more inventory in order to meet the needs of her clients and in turn to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to supply her store with more inventory.

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MARIA AUXILIADORA, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de repuestos de vehículos pesados, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio,  la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank María Auxiliadora. She continues selling spare parts for heavy vehicles, and has been in this business for years. She does well thanks to the commitment she puts every day into her business. She is a very responsible and committed woman, and it is in this way that she helps her family to get ahead.

This member is requesting a credit to buy tires for her business.

This member feels grateful for the granted loan and promises to pay the established payments in time.

loans.use: to buy tires for her business.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Vistamos a Doña Felipa en su negocio de ropa. Ella es una persona muy amable, desde que llegamos a su negocio comenzó a platicar que tiene 46 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora es mama de 3 jóvenes que se encuentran estudiando es una mujer separada de su esposo nos platica que siempre ha vivido en su comunidad desde que nació hasta ahora en la actualidad. Esta vez ha solicitado un crédito personal que le servirá para comprar juegos pirotécnicos, pero además de este negocio también se dedica a vender ropa para niña y niños, cuando la visitamos para tomarle la foto aun no tenia su mercancía de juegos pirotécnicos es por eso que no sale con su mercancía y sale en su puesto de ropa, Su pedido le llega en días posteriores para empezar a trabajar en ellos a inicios del mes de noviembre, nos platica que desde hace 18 años trabaja en los juegos pirotécnicos ya que su comadre la madrina de mis hijos ella fue quien me enseño pero desafortunadamente ya falleció, ella fue quien me dio la idea ella era mayorista, Doña Felipa solo compra los juegos pirotécnicos y los vende  nos comenta que invierte una parte y sus ganancias llegan hacer el doble entones no presenta gran dificultad siempre le va muy bien, solo por el momento presenta un gran problema familiar que es la desaparición de sus dos hijos que se fueron a EU y desde hace 2 años que no los ve esta muy triste por esto y desesperada le gustaría volverlos a ver algún día solo le pide a Dios que los tenga con bien a pesar de todo esto ella sigue echándole ganas por su tres hijos que los tiene estudiando quiere que todos ellos sigan estudiando se siente muy orgullosa  porque doña Felipa no pudo asistir a la escuela pero le gustaría que sus hijos se superaran y comenta que mientras que ella pueda darles estudios lo hara.
texts.en:
We are visiting Felipa at her clothing business.  She is a very amiable person.  When we arrived at her business, she began by telling us that she is 46 years old.  She is a very hard-working woman, and she has three children who are in school.  She is separated from her husband.  She tells us that she has always lived in her community, since she was born and to this day.

This time she has requested a personal loan to buy fireworks.  In addition to this business, she also sells children’s clothes.  When we visited her to take the photo, she still did not have the fireworks merchandise.  That is why it is not in the photo with her merchandise and that the photo is of her clothing stand.  Her order arrives days later in order to start working with them at the start of November.

She tells us that she has been working with fireworks for 18 years.  Her friend and Godmother of her children taught her this work, but unfortunately, she died.  She was the one who gave her the idea; she was a wholesaler.

Felipa buys the fireworks and sells them by herself.  She tells us that she invests part and her income doubles.  Therefore, she has no large problems, and it always goes very well for her.  

It is only at this time that there is a big family problem.  Two of her children went to the United State two years ago, and she does not see them.  She is very sad and in despair about this.  She would like to see them again one day.  She only asks God to keep them well.  

In spite of all of this, she continues to be motivated by her three children who go to school.  She wants all of them to continue studying.  Felipa is very proud because she was not able to go to school.  However, she would like her children to be successful.  She says that as long as she is able to give them an education, she will do so.

loans.use: to buy fireworks.

loans.name: Tunari Fab Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TUNARI FAB”  iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Tania es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de chompas, tejido de mantas, venta de mantas, tejido en telar, venta de ropa de cholita, venta de EVON.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Tania es integrante, ella indica que hace tres ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por recomendación de su profesora de tejido que recomendó a la institución.  En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de chompas, da a conocer que esta técnica lo aprendió en una institución técnica y posteriormente inicio su propio emprendimiento.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “Tunari Fab” communal bank will start its 8th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center; it has 8 members led by a governing board presided by Tania.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are sweater weaving, blanket weaving, loom work, traditional clothing sales and Avon product sales.

The loan they will take out will benefit small micro businesswomen.  Tania is one of them.  She indicates that she’s been in Pro Mujer for three cycles having joined thanks to an invitation from her weaving teacher who recommended her to the institution.  She currently has a business weaving sweaters.  She relates that she learned this skill at a technical institution and later on started her own business.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase working capital.  She will buy wool in various supply centers and once she makes her items will sell them to order.  This way of working allows her to earn income needed to support her family the best way possible since she has a spouse and a son.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health training and the credit.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MARIA AUXILIADORA, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de granos secos, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia compra semillas de papa, quinua entre otros para venderlos en su local,la socia cuenta con una tienda donde vende toda su mercadería a quienes le solicitan como sus clientes,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia sale adelante.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas de papa y quinua para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
She’s a member of the “María Auxiliadora” communal bank and continues with her business selling dry grains.  She’s been in this business for years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.  She buys potato and quinoa seeds, among others, to sell in her locale.  She has a store where she sells all the merchandise her customers request from her.  She’s a responsible, dedicated person who moves forward this way.  

She’s requesting the loan to buy potato and quinoa seeds for her business.  She feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy potato and quinoa seeds.

loans.name: Idimoh

texts.ru: Идимох 34 года. Она не замужем и живет с мамой. Она планирует организовать свой бизнес. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей  детской одежды. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Idimoh is 34 years old, single, and lives with her mother. She is planning to establish her own business. For that reason, she took a course entitled "Get Ahead" that was organized by the Association of Businesswomen, and for which she earned a certificate. Now she is fully able to set up her own business and become successful at it. Idimoh wants to sell children's clothing and is seeking a loan in the amount of 7,500 Tajikistan Somoni to buy inventory for her new business. She is waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy children’s clothes to set up a new business

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is 46 years old and married to Emily, who contributes to the family income. He has been running his retail shop for a period of about four years with an income of about 15,000 KES per month. 

He is taking his third loan from KADET Ltd. He wants to use the loan to buy sugar, rice, and flour for his retail shop. 

He hopes to expand his business to wholesale and also give his children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and flour as additional stock for his retail shop.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en: Felecia, 32, is married and lives in Gardnersville with her three children who are between the ages of 7 and 16 and are currently in school. She stopped her education in the 10th grade. She is a hard-working mother that has been involved in used clothing sales for the past five years. She sells both boys and girls clothing. She learned to sell from her mother, and because of the way she interacts with her customers, she generates more income each day. With the profits she buys more goods to increase her sales, and to expend her children's education. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for the business. Her plan for the future is to give her children a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for the business.

loans.name: Khmeb

texts.en:
Khmeb is 45 years old. He is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has been running a taxi service for more than five years, earning approximately $5 per day. His wife runs a grocery store. She earns about $3 daily. One of his children is a garment worker who earns about $3 each day. 

In order to improve his family’s finances, Khmeb is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase musical instruments to form a band for hire at wedding ceremonies and other parties. By doing so, he would earn additional income to support the family. 

In the future, he would like to expand the business and help his children earn higher education. Moreover, he hopes build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase musical instruments to form a band for hire at wedding ceremonies and other parties.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MARIA AUXILIADORA, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de ferretería, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende lo que son materiales de construcción como clavos,cemento,pinturas entre otros,  la socia cuenta con una tienda donde vende toda su mercadería a quienes le solicitan como sus clientes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia sale adelante.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cemento para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
She’s a member of the “María Auxiliadora” communal bank and continues with her business selling hardware.  She’s been in this business for years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She sells construction supplies like nails, cement and paint, among others.  She has a store where she sells all the merchandise her customers request from her.   She’s a responsible, dedicated person who moves forward this way.  

She’s requesting the loan to buy cement for her business.  She feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy cement.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de llantas y mantenimiento de carros,la socia trabaja junto con su esposo y le va muy bien y saca adelante a sus hijo,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de llantas.La socia solicita le credito para comprar llantas y repuestos para carros.

La socia esta contenta con el credito otorgado y se compromete a pagra las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member keeps selling tires and car maintenance, she works together with her husband. She does very well and helps her son to progress.

She has been in this business for years. Her dream is to expand the business for selling tires. She is requesting a loan to buy tires and spare parts for cars.

This member is happy with the granted loan and promises to pay the installments.

loans.use: to buy tires and spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim operates an agro-vet store in Olkalou, where he sells veterinary products as well as farm supplies such as fertilizer, farm chemicals, and seeds. He is 46 years old and married to Nancy. They have five children.

This will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to purchase a motorcycle to assist him in transporting the commodities from his agro-vet store to the farmers.

He hopes to have a fully stocked  agro-vet shop.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to assist him in transporting the commodities from his agro-vet store to the farmers.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is from Capucao, Ozamis City. She is 32 years old, married, and has six children. Mary Grace is raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting bananas and cassava for sale. She has been in the business for 17 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

Mary Grace joined GDMPC in 2009 and is now requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MARIA AUXILIADORA, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de restaurante bar, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende lo que son distintos platos hechos de cerdo, la socia también vende lo que son cerveza y gaseosas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia sale adelante.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cervezas  para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank María Auxiliadora. She keeps her restaurant/bar business. She has been in this business for years and she does well thanks to her everyday commitment to her business. She sells different pork dishes, and also beer and sodas. She is a responsible and committed person, and in this way she progresses.

This member is requesting a loan to buy beers for her business.

She is grateful for the granted loan and promises to pay the established installments.

loans.use: to buy beers for her business.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is 34 years old, married, and a mother of three children. She sells used clothes in Malindi for a living and earns a monthly income of about 9,000 KES. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer.

Loice has applied for a loan of 30,000 KES to buy more stock of used clothing for sale during high season .She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children.

She intends to continue growing her business so that she may improve her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more stock of used clothing for sale.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is a 42 year old resident of Poblacion 1, Clarin. She provides for her four children's needs from the little amount of PHP 6,000  that she has gained monthly from her own piggery business for four years as an addition to the income gained from her husband.

 In 2008, Wilfreda became a member of GDMPC, and she applies for a loan of PHP 7,000 at GDMPC micro finance to buy feeding supplies. Wilfreda wants to expand to her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Jeanny

texts.en: Jeanny is 30 years old and from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is now married and has one child. Jeanny owns and operates a banana plantation and earns 7,000 a month. In 2010, Jeanny joined GDMPC to be able to use their financial services. She requested a loan of 9,000, which will be used to purchase farm chemicals. She expects to reap a good harvest and will invest her revenue in expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is 60 years old and married. She is from Sebasi, Clarin. Leonora has 4 grown children who help her take care of their bananas and coconuts. They have been growing bananas and coconuts for 20 years and earn 5,000 a month. Leonora joined GDMPC in 2008. She has requested a loan of 3,800 to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs

loans.name: Femi

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Femi from Kandeh town in the Southern area of Bo district, Sierra Leone. He is married with three children between the ages of 11 and 21 years old. Two of his children are currently attending school and one is in university. In 2005, Femi established his general store business. He was working security for a company and after 7 years of work, he was terminated from the job. He had no option but to start a business so he could have a permanent income to support his family. He works at the business every day, 12 hours per day. Sometimes he experiences financial constraints on how to expand his business.

Femi requires a loan in order to buy more stock like soap, toothpaste, bread and body cream. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to educate his children and increase his business. In the future, Femi plans to expand his business at a higher level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more stock like soap, toothpaste, bread and body cream.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is married with four children.  She is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines.  Emily manages a gardening production business to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years, and every month she earn 8,000 PHP from this work.  She has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer.

Emily has been a member of GDMPC since 2009.  In the future, Emily hopes to pay for her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her gardening business.

loans.name: Abdul     K

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Abdul from Kandeh town in the Southern area of Bo, Sierra Leone. He is a Father of one child aged five years. His child is in nursery school. In 2006, Abdul established his pharmacy store business. He began his business because he wanted to improve himself and his family. He works at the business 11 hours a day and 7 days per week. Abdul says his business is doing fine because he has no competition within the community. Drug sales help him to save the lives of his people in the community. 

Abdul requires a loan in order to buy more drugs like drip, injection, tablet, blood syrup, and malarial drugs. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him expand his business and buy a piece of land. In the future, Abdul plans to open a big clinic in the community and improve his status. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drugs like drip, injection, tablet, blood syrup, and malarial drugs.

loans.name: Haziel

texts.en: Haziel and her husband live in a rural community with their two children. They aim to become successful and financially stable so they can educate their children and give them a better life. Haziel owns and manages a small variety store in their community. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Haziel needs to increase her income to pay for necessities and continue financing the education of their children. She wishes to acquire more grocery items to sell but she does not have enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for an additional P20,000.00 to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, rice, load wallet (prepaid mobile phone credits), shampoos, diapers, oils and sugar for sale. She believes that her loan will make it possible to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, rice, load wallet, shampoos, diapers, oils and sugar to stock her store.

loans.name: Almel

texts.en:
This is Almel.  She previously accessed a 17,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase silkscreen, film and paint needed for her business.  Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy more silkscreen, film and paint needed for her business.  Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
 
Almel dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education, and hopes to expand her business through all her hard work.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy silkscreen, film and paint needed in her silkscreen printing business.

loans.name: Raem

texts.en: Raem is 44 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than ten years, earning approximately $10 per day. Her husband is a farmer who earns about $2 per day. Her daughter is a garment worker who earns about $3 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Raem is requesting a loan of $500 to raise capital for her business and purchase more vegetables to sell. By doing so, she would have a greater variety of vegetables for sale and earn more profit to financially support her family. In the future, she would like to use her profits to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell in her store

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
This is Lilia. She previously received an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase greater quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed for her general store. Her earnings were a big help to provide for her children’s education and her family's personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Lilia is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items she displays at her store the better, as this will result in greater profit. Lilia's business profits will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and help provide for her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lilia hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of having a good life. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for stock and supplies needed in her general store

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene, age 26, has two children and is married to a farmer.  To supplement her spouse's income, she raises hogs to fatten and breed for future sale to butchers in their village.  She has insufficient funds now and is requesting PHP 4,000 to buy hog feed and vaccines for sustainability.  Proper sustenance of the hogs will ensure good nutrition and an income increase upon disposal.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vaccines for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia, a retail store owner at Sampaguita, was very thankful for having a small business which gives her P300 each day as income in selling grocery items. She is 59 years old, a widower and has children who are living separately from her. She lives alone now and would like to keep generating income to sustain her needs. She is now asking for P8,000 to buy more grocery items such as soft drinks, sardines, eggs, breads and soap to sell. Additional revenue generated will be saved for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sardines, eggs, breads and soap to sell in her store

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en: Valeriana is a responsible mother of four. She had sent her eldest to college and that child is employed now. She was very happy and proud for her child's achievement. The rest of her children are still at school. She is sewing curtains, school and office uniforms, and table cloths to sell. This way she generates about P5,00 each month. It was just enough for their sustenance for meals and allowances. She aspires to further increase her sales. She is asking for this loan to achieve her goal. She is asking for P10,000 to buy threads, fabrics and machine oil use in the sewing business. Valeriana promises to pay back her loan in full. She also would like to keep extending good output and friendly services to her costumers leading to good income and success in her business.

loans.use: to buy threads, fabrics and machine oil use in the sewing business.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is skilled person. She poured out her skills and passion in sewing curtains, table cloths and uniforms as her source of income. She was separated from her spouse due to personal reasons and she carries the burden in supporting their needs. She would like to give the best education to her child. She is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy threads, fabrics and needles used in sewing business. She hopes to keep producing a good output to satisfy her customers and increase her income, too. 

Someday, she will be happy and proud to see her child marching on stage with a diploma.

loans.use: to buy threads, fabrics and needles used in sewing business

loans.name: Dahlia

texts.en:
Dahlia is helpful.  She is married to Romeo, and together they generate income to provide sustenance for the family, such as meals and school fees.  She runs a small store in front of her house and her spouse is a tricycle (motorcycle) operator.  Dahlia hopes to improve her sales because her spouse's income from his business is not stable.  So, she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to invest in buying more merchandise to sell.  She will buy sardines, coffee, sugar, eggs, soap and shampoo.

With hard work, faith in God and good income, Dahlia believes that her family will enjoy a fortunate life someday.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell in her store.

loans.name: Reydo

texts.es:
Reydo de 42 años convive con Ana, con quien tiene 3 hijos: Fermín de 12, Mariluz de 8 y Jackelyn de 7 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa rústica que Reydo construyó con ayuda de sus familiares y se ubica en un distrito agrícola. Reydo es un hombre noble y sociable. Se dedica a la agricultura desde que era niño. Manifiesta que ayudaba a sus padres en los cultivos de sus terrenos, desde entonces le agrado esa actividad. Por eso ahora, se encarga de cuidar sus sembríos de papas, maíz, arvejas y flores de gladiolos.
Él trabaja contento en el campo, al lado de su esposa. Además cuenta con animales de carga que le sirven mucho para su actividad. 
“Éste mes estoy recogiendo las flores de gladiolos, y los precios son buenos, por las fiestas religiosas”, cuenta. En sus planes está empezar 2 siembras, una de arvejas y otra de maíz, ya que las lluvias empezaron y quiere aprovecharlas al máximo. Reydo solicita de su apoyo para lograr sus objetivos. Éste es su crédito número 16 con MFP. Reydo es uno de los socios fundadores del banco comunal “Santa Cruz de Patay”, y se siente contento de tener socios responsables. Menciona que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales.
Con el dinero podrá 4 bolsas de semillas de arvejas (2000 soles), 2 bolsas de semillas de maíz con 1000 soles, y lo restante lo invertirá en la compra de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
Reydo, 42 years old, lives together with Ana, with whom he has three children: Fermín who is 12, Mariluz who is 8 and Jackelyn, who is 7. They all live in a rustic house that Reydo built with the help of his relatives, and it is located in an agriculture district. Reydo is a noble and sociable man.

He is into agriculture since he was a kid. He mentions that he helped his parents cultivating the fields, and since then he likes this line of work. This is why he now takes care of his potato, corn, pea and gladiolus flowers fields. He works happy in the countryside, next to his wife. He also has working animals, which are very useful for his work.

"This month I am picking gladiolus lowers and prices are good, because of the religious celebrations" he says. He plans to sow two crops: peas and corn, now that the rain has come and he wants to make the most out of it.

Reydo is requesting your support to meet his goals. This is his 16th credit with MFP. Reydo is one of the founder members of the communal bank "Santa Cruz de Patay" and he feels happy of having responsible members. He says that he will pay the monthly installments in time.

With the money he will be able [to buy] four bags of pea seeds (2000 PEN), two bags of corn seeds with 1000 PEN and the rest, he will invest it in buying organic fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy two bags of seeds and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en:
Khoeurn is 39 years old and is a widow who lives with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. For greater than seven years, she has been breeding pigs and she earns approximately 3 USD per day. Two of Khoeurn's children are garment workers who earn about 6 USD daily. 

Khoeurn is requesting a 600 USD loan to improve her family’s finances and purchase piglets to breed and resell when they gain weight. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her youngest child earn a college degree. Khoeurn  also hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed and resell

loans.name: Angelito

texts.en:
Angelito is 56 years old and is married with five children. He is from Poblacion 2, Clarin. To make a living, Angelito owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. He has been engaged in his business for four years and earns 19,000 PHP a month. Angelito joined GDMPC in 2009. 

Angelito is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan to repair an existing vehicle so that he can provide better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated with his loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle so that he can provide better service

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 46 years old and married with two children. She is from Panay Daku, Clarin. For the past two years, Eden has managed a transportation business and she earns 9,000 PHP a month. She joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services. 

Eden is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan to purchase spare vehicle parts and accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase spare vehicle parts and accessories

loans.name: Eternel 1 Group

texts.en:
Ajarn, age 35, is single with 2 children, ages 4 and 11 years old. Both of his children are currently attending school. Ajarn is representing the Eternel 1 group. He primarily sells phone credit by Congolese cell phone companies. He also sells other small electronics. He has been operating this business for 5 years. The common cell phone in the Congo does not run on a plan or contract. People must buy phone cards with "credit" that gives the phone minutes of call time. Ajarn plans to use the loan to buy more cards with phone credit on them from the Congolese cell phone companies. His business strategy is to offer friendly customer service and have a large stock of different priced cards at all times. 
This is Ajarn's first loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. His group and HOPE are confident that they will repay the loan. Ajarn wants to continue to operate his business in the future. He hopes his family will prosper and be happy.

loans.use: to pay for phone credit.

loans.name: Shielenn Pamela

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza y negocio de compra y venta de ropa,la socia vende panatalones,chomaps polos y zapstos y trae de lugares como Lima y Trujillo y lo vende en forma independiente,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio.La socia solicita el credito para comprar polos,chompas,pantalones y zapatos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues working selling beauty products and clothes.  She sells pants, sweaters, shirts and shoes that she brings from places like Lima and Trujillo and sells independently.  She works from 8am until 6pm and has been in business five years.  She’s requesting the loan to buy shirts, sweaters, pants and shoes.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy shirts, sweaters, pants and shoes.

loans.name: Erika Yazmin

texts.es:
La señora Erika es originaria de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, es madre soltera y tienen tres hijos bajos su responsabilidad, dos ya son adolecentes y una pequeña de dos años de edad. La señora Erika tiene un negocio de ventas de abarrotes en su domicilio para estar al pendiente de sus hijos.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para poder acondicionar el lugar del negocio y poder tener mas variedad de productos a la venta ya que es la tienda que hay en su localidad y sus clientes le están solicitando mas variedad de mercancía y pero como no tiene suficiente espacio para exhibir la mercancía y sus clientes puedan ver y consuman lo que tiene a la venta.
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio será para pagar el crédito y el resto para los gastos familiares y escolares de sus hijos, también cuenta con una pensión que recibe por sus hijos de su ex esposo.
texts.en:
Erika is from the city of Nuevo Laredo.  She’s a single mother with three children in her care.  Two of them are teenagers and she has a two-year-old daughter.  Erika has a business selling groceries at home so that she can watch her children.

She’s asking for the loan to stock the store and have more variety of products on sale because it’s the only store in her neighborhood and customers are asking for a wider variety of merchandise but she does not have enough room to display it so her customers can see what she has for sale.

She will use part of her profits from the store to repay the loan and the rest for family expenses and for her children’s schooling.  She also gets child support from her ex-husband.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Running a retail store allows Marivic to generate income for her family.  She has been selling grocery items for 10 years now.  She usually earns PHP 400 each day that goes towards their meals and allowances for her two children.  She is married to Carlito, a farmer. 

Now, Marivic is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy soap, shampoo, sardines, eggs, soft drinks and sugar to sell in her store.  This will help increase sales and income used for the education of her children.  This will lead to the betterment of the family's financial condition someday.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anjane Joyce

texts.en:
Anjane Joyce is 18 years old and still single. Due financial difficulties, she did not pursue her college studies. Despite this, Anjane is determined to someday continue in school. In the meantime, she will continue to operate her business and save for her future education. Anjane works buying and selling souvenirs and gift items in her village but she does not have enough capital to purchase additional stock. 

Anjane is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy soft brooms, baskets, and other souvenir items to sell. She believes that through "patience and hard work," she will improve her business and income and be able to continue her studies someday.

loans.use: to buy soft brooms, baskets, and other souvenirs to sell

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de manualidades,al socia ha trabajos como manteles,posavasos y tejidos con hilo,la socia vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante.La socia solicita el credito para comprar tela,hilos de colores y pinturas.

La socia esta feliz con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues dedicated to the business of crafts. The member has works such as tablecloths, coasters, and fabrics made of linen. The member sells as a street peddler from 8:00 am to 4:00pm. The member has six years in this business, and she wants to get ahead through this business.

The member is requesting the loan to buy fabric, color linen, and paint. The member is happy with the credit granted and undertakes to fulfill her payments.

loans.use: to buy fabric, color linen, and paint.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 35 años, convive con Héctor, con quien tiene 3 hijos: Jenifer de 16, Miguel de 10 y Rosalí de 2 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia, que construyeron con esfuerzo y se ubica en un anexo agrícola. Mercedes es una madre trabajadora y responsable. Su actividad es la agricultura. No es fácil su labor y más aún con una pequeña hija, pero Mercedes es admirable, y se esfuerza y trabaja en la tierra. Gracias a esa dedicación ahora cuenta con terrenos de cultivos propios. Por ello siembra papas y arvejas, en mayor cantidad, pero también cultiva maíz, habas y flores de gladiolos pero no es seguido. 
Además cuenta con 2 toros para el arado y 2 burros para la carga de sus cosechas. Ella y su esposo están muy contentos y felices, puesto que le agrada trabajar en la agricultura, ya que le genera dinero cada cosecha. Por ello está convencida de progresar mediante sus cultivos y, de ese modo ahorrar para adquirir más terrenos y evitar pagar el derecho de alquiler. Sus planes más próximos son sembrar arvejas y papas, para ello solicita otra vez de su apoyo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa cruz de patay” y este es el crédito número 11 con MFP, donde promete cumplir cada una de las cuotas, asimismo tiene  anhelos de realizar sus ahorros en su banco comunal. Ella comprará con los 3000 soles solicitados, 3 bolsas de semillas de arvejas con 1500 soles, y lo restante lo invertirá el bolsas de fertilizantes naturales como guano de corral y granja.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 35, lives with Héctor.  They have three children: Jenifer, 16, Miguel, 10, and Rosalí, 2. They all live in a house of their own that they built with much effort and is located in an agricultural annex.  Mercedes is a hardworking, responsible mother.  Her activity is agriculture.  It isn’t easy work even more so with a little girl but Mercedes is admirable and strives hard working her land.  Thanks to this dedication, she now owns farmland of her own.  She grows potatoes and peas in large amounts but also grows corn, lima beans and gladiolas but this isn’t all the time.

She also owns two bulls for plowing and two donkeys to carry the crops.  She and her husband are very happy and glad because they enjoy working in agriculture because it generates income with each harvest.  Because of this, she’s sure to make progress by means of her crops and to save up to buy more land and save on land lease costs.

Her immediate plan is to plant peas and potatoes and is once again requesting your help to do so.  She’s a member of the “Santa Cruz de Patay” communal bank and this is her 11th MFP loan.  She promises to make each of her payments and she also hopes to start saving in her communal bank. She will use 1,500 of the requested 3,000 soles to buy three bags of pea seeds and the rest to buy sacs of natural fertilizer like barnyard and farm guano.

loans.use: to buy three bags of pea seeds and sacks of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Epifaneo

texts.es:
Epifaneo de 66 años es viudo. Hace muchos años su esposa falleció y por ello no pudo tener hijos. Él vive en una casa propia, que construyó con mucho esfuerzo en un anexo agrícola. Epifaneo es un hombre de mucha fuerza. Su edad no es impedimento para dedicarse a la agricultura. Una actividad muy cansada para muchos, pero para éste hombre es más que una fuente de ingresos, ya que toda su vida la pasa en el campo. Sus principales cultivos constan de papas, arvejas, flores de gladiolos y habas. Pero manifiesta que le conviene sembrar arvejas y flores de gladiolos, por la rapidez en su crecimiento y por la poca inversión. Epifaneo mayormente trabaja solo. Por eso cuenta con caballos y burros que le ayudan para trasladar sus cosechas. En ocasiones, en el caso de las cosechas, tiene que recurrir a contratar personal.
Él espera continuar con su actividad, por que le agrada lo que hace, por eso esta vez iniciará una siembra de arvejas y habas, para ello solicita de su apoyo. Éste es su crédito número 13 con MFP. Agradece mucho el apoyo económico y educativo en todo este tiempo. Pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Cruz de Patay”, el grupo más antiguo y más unido de la provincia. Con el dinero podrá comprar semillas de arvejas y gladiolos con 2500 soles. Lo restante lo invertirá en la compra de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
Epifaneo, 66, is a widower.  His wife died many years ago and this is why he was unable to have children.  He lives in a house of his own that he built with much effort in an agricultural annex.  Epifaneo’s a man of much strength.  His age is no impediment to working in agriculture, a very tiring activity for many.  But for him, it’s more than a source of income since he’s spent his entire life in the fields.  His main crops are potatoes, peas, gladiola flowers and lima beans.  But he states that it’s to his advantage to plant peas and gladiola flowers because of their quick growth and low investment.  Epifaneo works alone for the most part so he has horses and donkeys to help him transport his crops.  Sometimes, like during harvesting, he has to hire staff.

He hopes to continue with his activity because he enjoys what he does which is why this time he will start a pea and lima bean crop and is asking for your help to do so.  This will be his 13th MFP loan.  He is very grateful for the economic and educational support all this time.  He’s a member of the “Santa Cruz de Patay” communal bank, the province’s oldest, most unified group.  He will use 2,500 soles of the loan to buy pea and gladiola seeds and will use the rest to buy organic manure.

loans.use: to buy pea and gladiola seeds and sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Eternel 2 Group

texts.en:
Yvelhick, age 27, is single and has one 6-year-old daughter. His daughter is attending school this year. He also cares for his mother. Yvelhick is representing the group Eternel 2. He sells mobile phones in the market and has been operating this business for 5 years. He will use the loan to buy more phones to increase his inventory. His business strategy is to barter with the clients and together decide on the best price for the phones. 
This is Yvelhick's first loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. HOPE and his group are confident he will repay the loan. He wants to continue to make larger profits and expand his business.

loans.use: to pay for mobile phones.

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie is from Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 33 years old. Ronie is married and has four children. To make a living, Ronie owns and operates a rice production business. Ronie has been engaged in his business for three years and earns 9,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Ronie joined GDMPC. Ronie is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure for his rice production business

loans.name: Joan Rose

texts.en:
Joan Rose is 27 years old and married with two children. She lives in Panta-on, Ozamis City. For the past five years, Joan Rose has raised pigs to earn a living. She earns 13,000 PHP each month. Joan Rose has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. 

Joan Rose is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase breeding livestock. In the future, she wants to build a house and to see her children finish school.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Net

texts.en:
Net is 30 years old and is married with two children. She lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. For the past year, Net has selling groceries and she earns approximately 2 USD each day. Her husband is a garment worker who earns about 2 USD daily. 

Net is requesting a 500 USD loan to purchase more groceries to sell in order to improve her family’s livelihood. Her loan will help her increase her inventory and help provide more income for the family. In the future, Net would like to expand her store and send her children to a good school. She also hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fruit for a fruit-selling business.

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
Clorinda de 46 años, convive con Alfonso con quien tiene 3 hijos de 14, 9 y 5 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia que construyeron con esfuerzo, en un anexo agrícola. Clorinda es una madre tierna y una esposa responsable. Se dedica a la agricultura desde los 20 años. Por eso confía en su desempeño como mujer de campo. Sus principales cultivos constan arvejas, habas, cebada, maíz y flores de gladiolos. “En mi zona hay buenos terrenos, por eso crece de todo”, dice.
Con el apoyo de su pareja, pueden cubrir todo el trabajo que requiere el campo; pero muchas veces no es suficiente, por eso contratan más personal.
Casi toda su producción la negocian en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. “Las arvejas, habas y maíz, se venden ahí y casi al instante, pero las flores de gladiolos las llevo para otra feria”, menciona sobre su trabajo.
Clorinda espera volver a sembrar arvejas y habas, aprovechando las lluvias que empiezan a caer en este mes, por ello requiere de su apoyo. Éste es su crédito número 11 con MFP. Se siente agradecida de recibir el apoyo económico y las charlas educativas, porque la impulsaron a ser más responsable. Pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Cruz de Patay”, un grupo sólido donde ella participa constantemente.
Con los 3000 soles que solicita piensa adquirir 3 bolsas de semillas de arvejas y 1 de habas. Los 1000 soles restantes los invertirá en la compra de abonos orgánicos y guano de corral.
texts.en:
Clorinda, 46, lives with Alfonso with whom she has three children who are 14, 9 and 5 years of age.  They all live in a house of their own that they built with much effort in an agricultural annex.  Clorinda is a tender mother and a responsible wife.  She’s worked in agriculture for 20 years which is why she trusts in her development as a woman of the fields.  Her main crops are peas, lima beans, barley, corn and gladiola flowers.  “My zone has rich soil; that’s why everything grows,” she says.

With support from her spouse they are able to do all the work needed in the field but sometimes it’s not enough and they have to hire more staff.

They sell almost all of their crops in the Tarma wholesale market.  “The peas, lima beans and corn sell there almost instantly but I take the gladiola flowers to a different street market,” she mentions about her work.

Clorinda expects to plant peas and lima beans again taking advantage of the rain that starts to fall this month which is why she needs your support.  This is her 11th MFP loan and she feels grateful to receive economic support and educational chats because they push her to be more responsible.  She’s a member of the “Santa Cruz de Patay” communal bank, a solid group she participates in constantly.  She will use the 3000 soles she’s requesting to buy three bags of pea seeds and one of lima bean seeds; she will use the remaining 1000 soles to buy organic manure and barnyard guano.

loans.use: to buy bags of pea seeds, a bag of lima bean seeds and sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Zusima

texts.en:
This is Zusima, resident of Payatas, Philippines.  She is married to Wilfredo, a maintenance worker, and the mother of eight children.  She and her husband manage their household while operating the business.  She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Zusima operates a phone and phone accessories business.  She offers different units of cell phones and some phone accessories, like batteries and chargers.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of photo supplies and cell phone accessories to expand her product inventory.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Zusima hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years and dreams of giving her children a good and quality education.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more phones and phone accessories for her re-sale business.

loans.name: Eternel 3 Group

texts.en:
Gratien, age 21, is single and has no children. He is representing the Eternel 3 group. He sells phone cards from Congolese cell phone companies. He has been operating this business for 2 years. The common cell phone in the Congo does not run on a plan or contract. People must buy phone cards with "credit" that gives the phone minutes of call time. He plans to use the loan to buy more cards with phone credit from the Congolese cell phone companies. His business strategy is to stay in a certain place all the time so his customers can easily find him.  
This is Gratien's first loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. His group and HOPE are confident that he will repay the loan.

loans.use: to pay for phone cards.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is 30 years old and married with a school-age child. With the support of her husband, she aims to uplift her family's living status so that they will be able to educate their child and give him a better life. Selina owns and manages a variety store in her village and her husband is a farmer. She has been operating her business for almost five years and usually earns 6,000 PHP in monthly profits that she uses to provide for her family's daily needs and to pay school fees. 

Selina is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy junk food, noodles, canned goods, biscuits, beverages, and soft drinks to sell. Her loan will increase her product offerings to satisfy customer demand. In the future, Selina is hoping that her business will continuously grow and she will continue to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy junk food, noodles, canned goods, biscuits, beverages, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny is 41 years old and is married with two children. She lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. For more than three years, Vanny has been a weaver, earning approximately 3 USD daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about 2 USD each day. 

Vanny is requesting an 1,100 USD loan to purchase more silk threads to use for weaving. Her loan will help her produce more silk cloth to sell and increase her income to support her family. In the future, Vanny would like to expand her weaving business and send her children to good schools. She also hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase silk threads to use for weaving

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Norma, está casada y tiene 4 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta, la socia se sigue dedicando a la   producción y venta  lácteos como leche, queso y yogurt y los comercializa en los mercados y ferias de su provincia. Norma necesita más leche para elaborar sus productos, por ello invertirá su préstamo solicitado en  comprar una vaca lechera.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Norma pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
Norma quiere proporcionarles una mejor vida y educación a sus hijos,  y por ellos se sacrifica, así que espera trabajar mucho y ahorrar para invertir en la educación de ellos.
texts.en:
Norma is married and has four children.  She lives in the Tambo Real district in the Anta province.  She continues producing and selling dairy products like milk, cheese, and yogurt.  She sells them at the markets and fairs in her province.

Norma needs more milk to make her products.  Therefore, she will use the requested loan to buy a dairy cow.

She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her to grow in her business activity, and she pledges to make her payments punctually.  

Norma belongs to the “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” communal bank in the Tambo Real district in the Anta province in Cusco, Peru.

Norma wants to give her children a better life and education.  It is for them that she sacrifices.  She hopes to work a lot and to save in order to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Emilia Elizabeth

texts.es: La socia es la señora Emilia, Ella continúa con su actividad comercial de venta de artesanías, principalmente de pinturas al oleo. Emilia en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar material como pinturas y marcos para sus obras de arte, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad artistica, la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Emilia pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Emilia continues with her commercial activity selling crafts, especially oil paintings.  On this occasion, Emilia is requesting the loan to buy supplies like paint and frames for her works of art.  She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her develop her artistic activity and she commits to make her installment payments punctually.  Emilia belongs to the “Kukuli” communal bank in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy paint and frames.

loans.name: Yoni

texts.es: La socia es la señora Yoni, ella continua dedicándose a la fabricació y venta de muebles de madera para el hogar, y los comercializa en una de las principales ferias de la ciudad, Yoni realiza este trabajo hace muchos años y esta actividad le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia y con la educación de su hijo. Yoni en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar materiales como pintura, laca, madera y planchas de MDF de madera prensada y algunos accesorios como tornillos y clavos, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a mantenerse en su actividad, la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Yoni pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Yoni continues to work making and selling home furniture.  She sells the furniture at one of the main markets in the city.  Yoni has been doing this work for many years and it has allowed her to improve her family's life and educate her son.  Yoni is asking for this loan to purchase materials such as paint, lacquer, wood, sheets of plywood, and some accessories such as nails and screws.  Yoni is very thankful to Kiva for helping her continue doing her work.  She promises to make her payments punctually.  

Yoni is a member of the Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II community bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: comprar pintura, madera, tornillos y clavos

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Hilario, él continúa con su actividad económica que es el alquiler de líneas telefónicas para quienes soliciten hacer llamadas, pero además de esta actividad, también está incursionando en la elaboración y venta de comida. Hilario está solicitando el préstamo para comprar  insumos  como verduras, carnes, arroz, fideos etc. para capitalizar su nueva actividad de venta de comida.
Hilario está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en su actividad económica. El pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Hilario still continues with his cell phone call business for the customers who ask him to make calls, but he is also starting in to the business of making and selling food.
Hilario asks for this loan to buy supplies like grains, meat, rice, pasta and others so he can put some capital in his new venture.
Hilario is very grateful to Kiva for the help they've given him with his business.
Hilario belongs to the communal bank "Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” from the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: comprar  insumos  como verduras, carnes, arroz, fideos etc.

loans.name: Carla Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal TODOS UNIDOS,la socia Carla Luisa continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de ropa ,la socia cuenta con un local donde vende su mercaderia a sus clientes que le solicitan ,la socia a la vez continua con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas,colonias,perfumes entre otros,la socia vende de forma independiente a sus amistades y clientes que le solicitan,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de perfumes y colonias para su negocio.
texts.en:
The partner is a member of the community bank “Todos unidos” (All United). The partner works in the sale of clothing. She counts on a store where she sells her merchandise to her customers who request her. At the same time she continues to work in the sale of beauty products such as creams, cologne, perfumes, and other things. 

She sells independently to her friends and clients that request her. She is a responsible person and hard working since this is the way that she gets her family ahead.

The partner is asking for a loan to purchase perfumes and cologne for her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes and cologne for her business

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Milagroso Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE HUANCA MILAGROSO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosana ella es conviviente y tiene 44 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia vende mantas,textiles,gorros entre otras artesanías, la socia distribuye a las diferentes tiendas donde vende artesanías, la socia vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a este negocio 10 años y le va muy bien y puede sacar adelante  a su hijo, el sueño de la socia es ampliar y tener un local donde pueda tener la artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar textiles, mantas y gorros al por mayor.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de vinos, negocio de venta de frutas y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These communal bank members belong to the "Señor de Huanca Milagrose" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is in the province and department of Cusco.

One bank member is Señora Rosana. She is 44 years old, lives with her partner, and has 1 son. She works in her business of selling handicrafts. She sells blankets, textiles, and caps, among other handicrafts. She distributes to the various stores where they sell handicrafts. She sells from 8 am to 6 pm. She has been working in this business for 10 years, and it is going very well for her, and she can raise her child. Her dream is to expand and have a shop where she can have handicrafts. She is applying for the loan to buy textiles, blankets, and caps wholesale. 

The picture of the bank member in the corner of the group photo was taken after the photo because she asked to be excused for work reasons.

The other bank members work in businesses of selling groceries, selling wine, selling fruit, and a restaurant.

The bank member thanks those who form part of her dream by this means, and she promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy textiles, blankets, and caps wholesale

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
This is Violeta, 56, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. With her children, she manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Violeta operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons, when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. She also has a variety store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 900 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Violeta hopes that her business will expand soon, and she dreams of helping those in need. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
This is Nilda. She previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase greater quantities and varieties of grocery items and other products needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 13,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nilda dreams of being able to give all her family a good future through her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Virgen De La Candelaria – San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LA CANDELARIA – SAN JERONIMO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fortunata ella es soltera y tiene 58 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia vende gorros,mantas,chalinas y guantes, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria en una de las  plazas de la  ciudad de Cusco, la socia también se dedica al negocio de venta de fruta, ella vende manzanas,naranjas,platanos y uvas, ella vende al por mayor llevando a lugares como Puerto Maldonado, la socia ya tiene en su negocio de venta de artesanía 7 años, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gorros, mantas, chalinas y guantes. 
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de crianza de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de librería y negocio de albañil.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These entrepreneurs belong to the communal bank “Virgen de la Candelaria – San Jeronimo”.  This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is in the province and department that are also named Cusco.

One member is Fortunata. She is a 58-year-old single woman and has six children.  She has a business selling hand-made clothing.  She sells hats, blankets, shawls and gloves.  She sells her merchandise in various squares in the city of Cusco.  She also makes income by selling fruit such as apples, oranges, bananas and grapes at wholesale, bringing these goods to places such as Puerto Maldonado.

She has had her clothing business for seven years.  She dreams of having her own store where she can sell her merchandise.  She is seeking this loan in order to buy hats, blankets, shawls and gloves.

The other members of the group have the following businesses:

- Raising animals
- Construction 
- Grocery store
- Book store

Fortunata thanks those who are helping to make her dream possible through this loan.  She promises to repay her loan according to the agreed-upon schedule.

loans.use: to buy hats, blankets, shawls and gloves.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD - CCACHIMAYO,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de ropa para mujeres, varones y niños como pantalones,camisas,polos,chompas,casacas entre otros, la socia lleva años en  este negocio el cual le va bien gracias el empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como casacas para niños.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en: The member belongs to the communal bank "Solidarity - Ccachimayo" and continues with her business of selling clothes for women, men, and children such as pants, shirts, polos, sweaters, and jackets. She has been doing this for a few years and it is going well thanks to the determination that she brings every day to her business. She is a hardworking and determined person and in this way the member gets her family ahead. She is asking for the credit to purchase merchandise such as jackets for children. She feels appreciative for the credit given and promises to comply with the established quotas.

loans.use: to purchase clothes like children's jackets

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 42 years old and is married to Reynaldo. The couple have two children.  Reynaldo works providing motorcycle transport and the couple works ceaselessly to earn income to provide for their family's needs. Magdalena also works selling vegetables. 

Magdalena is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy tires, gasoline, and crude oil for Reynaldo to use to expand his transport business. She hopes that her loan will ensure safe travel for their passengers and for her spouse as well. In the future, Magdalena would like to start raising pigs and continue to grow as a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy tires, gasoline, and crude oil for her husband's transportation business

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo is 34 years old. She is widowed and resides with her two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables and growing mushrooms for more than three years, earning approximately $5 daily. 

In order to stabilize her family’s living condition, Keo is requesting a loan of $1300 to purchase more vegetables to sell. By doing so, she would earn more income to financially support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda de 37 años convive con Juan Martín, con quien tiene 2 hijos: Cristian de 12 y Johnny de 6 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia que construyeron con esfuerzo y se ubica en un anexo agrícola. Nilda es una mujer de carácter bondadoso pero muy persistente. Se dedica a la agricultura desde los 20 años, el tiempo que lleva conviviendo con su pareja. Desde entonces trabaja la tierra produciendo: arvejas, habas, cebada, flores de gladiolos y maíz.  “Me conviene sembrar arvejas, habas y flores de gladiolos, porque en 4 meses ya estoy cosechando”, menciona.
Gracias a su constancia en sus labores ha logrado adquirir animales como toros, con los que ara la tierra. Además consiguió comprar un terreno y así se ahorra en el pago de arriendo.
Sus metas se centran en aumentar su producción y sus ventas, por ello está vez quiere sembrar en otras parcelas arrendadas. Ella solicita otro crédito para adquirir abonos orgánicos, porque ya cuenta con las semillas. Éste es su préstamo número 13 con MFP. Da su palabra de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales como en ocasiones anteriores. Pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Cruz de Patay”, y le agrada el trabajo en equipo. Con el dinero podrá adquirir 5 bolsas de abonos orgánicos y varias bolsas de guano de granja.
texts.en:
Nilda, 37, lives with Juan Martín with whom she has two children: Cristian, 12, and Johnny, 6. They all live together in the house they built with effort located in an agricultural annex.  Nilda is a woman with a kind but very persistent disposition.  She’s been working in agriculture for 20 years, the time she and her spouse have been together.  Since then she’s worked the land producing peas, lima beans, barley, gladiola flowers and corn.  “It’s advantageous for me to plant peas, lima beans and gladiola flowers because in just four months I can be harvesting them,” she mentions.  Thanks to her constancy at work she’s managed to acquire animals like bulls she uses to till the land.  She also managed to buy a piece of land so she now saves the leasing fees.

Her goals are centered on increasing production and sales which is why this time she wants to plant on other leased parcels.  She’s requesting another loan to buy organic manure because she already has the seeds.  This is her 13th MFP loan.  She gives her word that she’ll make her monthly installment payments punctually like she’s done before.  She’s a member of the “Santa Cruz de Patay” communal bank and she enjoys the teamwork.  With the money she will be able to buy five sacks of organic manure and several sacks of barnyard guano.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of organic manure and several sacks of fowl guano.

loans.name: Idalia
