Kouwavi plans to use her first loan to buy corn, rice, sugar and peppers. Her future plans include consolidating her business, as well as ensuring that her family is well-fed.

loans.use: To buy rice, corn, peppers and sugar.

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 30ans, moustapha est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants. Pour mieux se prendre en charge, il a commencé en 2006 par exercer comme activité la vente des couches bébé, des garnitures dans un marché reconnu dans la ville de Lomé. Par ce premier prêt qu’il sollicite auprès de WAGES, il va s’approvisionner en couches bébé et des garnitures. Il veut ouvrir une boutique afin de mieux vendre, et se marier plus tard.
texts.en: Moustapha is a young man of 30 years old. He is single and has no children. He began his business selling baby diapers and accessories in 2006 in order to better support himself. He runs his business in a well-known market in the city of Lomé. With his first loan from WAGES, he plans to purchase a supply of diapers and baby accessories. Moustapha hopes to open his own shop to more easily sell his goods. He would like to someday be able to marry.

loans.use: to purchase disposable diapers and baby accessories for resale.

loans.name: Mari

texts.es:
Mari tiene 39 años, convive con Miguel de 43 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 9 años. Ellos habitan una casa propia que construyeron con esmero y se ubica en un anexo rural. Mari es una mujer admirable. Desde los 17 años se dedica a la agricultura en terrenos que heredó de sus padres. En ellos produce papas, arvejas y maíz.
Menciona que la comercialización de sus productos es rentable, pero antes debe invertir en la compra de abonos, semillas, y en el pago de personal operario.
Su esposo la ayuda en el trabajo duro, pero ella no se queda a tras y también coge las herramientas para cultivar sus plantaciones.
“Antes era difícil trabajar porque no teníamos capital, porque si gasta mucho en las siembras”, dice.
Ahora gracias a los préstamos puede desenvolverse con tranquilidad en el campo.
En sus metas más cercanas está ampliar sus cultivos de papas y arvejas, por ello esta vez solicitó un crédito y espera de su ayuda para esta actividad. Éste es su segundo crédito  de MFP, se compromete una vez más en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas. Su banco comunal se llama “Santa Cruz de Tapo” y está contenta de tener compañeras responsables. Con el dinero comprará 10 bolsas de guano de corral para sus cultivos de papas y arvejas.
texts.en:
Mari is 39 years old. She lives with 43-year-old Miguel, with whom she has two children who are 12 and 19 years old. They live in their own house, which they build with great care; it is located in a small rural community. Mari is an admirable woman. She has farmed land inherited from her parents for 17 years, growing potatoes, peas, and corn.

She mentions that the sale of her produce is profitable, but first she must invest in the purchase of fertilizer and seed and pay wages to laborers.

Her husband helps her with the hard work, but Mari doesn't hang back; she, too, picks up the tools to cultivate her fields. 

"Before, the work was difficult because we didn't have capital, because we spend a lot in the planting season," she explains. Now, thanks to the loans, she can take care of business in the fields without worrying.

Among her short-term goals is to expand her plantings of potatoes and peas. That's why she requested the loan this time, and she awaits help for this endeavor. This is her second loan with MFP, and she is committed once again to making her payments on time. Her communal bank is called "Santa Cruz de Tapo" and she is happy to have responsible fellow members. With the money, she will buy ten bags of poultry guano for her potato and pea crops.

loans.use: to buy ten bags of poultry guano.

loans.name: Ablanvi

texts.fr: Ablanvi est mariée à un couturier et ils ont 02 enfants âgés de 15 et 10ans qui vont à l’école. Quant à madame ablanvi elle est âgée de 48ans, commerçante de profession, elle vend des chaussures dans un marché de la ville de Lomé. C’est pour augmenter son stock de marchandise qu’elle sollicite de WAGES un troisième prêt. Notons que les deux derniers prêts ont été soldés sans aucune contrainte. Elle voudrait réinvestir dans l’activité en développant plus son activité et assurer le bien être de la famille.
texts.en: Ablanvi is married to a fashion designer. They have two children, aged 10 and 15 years old, who are enrolled in school. Ablanvi is 48 years old, and a merchant by trade. She sells shoes at a market in the city of Lomé. In order to increase her supply of merchandise, she is seeking her third loan from WAGES. Her two prior loans were repaid in full and on time. She would like to use the money from this loan to reinvest in and expand her business. Her goal is to ensure the well being and prosperity of her family.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for resale.

loans.name: Belisario

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de tranporte el tiene una taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco,el socio trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las las 10:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio de socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es tener un carro nuevo,el socio ya tiene 4 ñaos en este negocio.El socio solicita el credito para mantenimiento de su carro para comprar llantas.

El socio se muestra muy satisfecho y agradecido por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member continues to make a living in transportation. He has a taxi that he travels through the main streets of Cusco. He works from 5:00am until 10:00pm and through this business he helps his children get ahead. He is requesting the loan to make maintenance on his car by buying tires. 

The member is very satisfied and thankful for the support provided through these means and is committed to fulfilling the payment of his loan according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Ama Gladys

texts.en:
Ama Gladys operates a chop bar (a place where a variety of African dish are sold) at Ayensudo near Elmina. In the picture above, she is pounding fufu. She cooks foods like banku, fufu, rice balls and others. 

She is married and has three children. She wants to expand her business, so a loan from Kiva will be invested in her cooking business for further expansion.

loans.use: to buy food items for her cooking business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 57 years old and married with three children.

Veronica grows vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Veronica has been farming vegetables for 15 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mariziel

texts.en:
Mariziel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

NWTF is relisting Mariziel's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nickson Amule

texts.en:
Nickson is a 41-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of 6 and 14. All of them go to school.

Nickson runs a general store and has been in business for five years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 3,000 sdg to purchase kejje, sweet potatoes, and other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Nickson would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Nickson says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like sweet potatoes, kejje, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Senia

texts.en:
This is Senia.  She previously obtained a PHP 20,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities of fish to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 27,000 loan to pay for fish needed in her business. The more fish, meat, and vegetables displayed at her stall,  the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Senia dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of theii work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre agricultor, casado vive en Sololá con su esposa. Tiene seis hijos tres que ya están casados, dos trabajan con el y un hombre que esta terminando su carrera académica como técnico en construcción,
El se dedica al cultivo agrícola, sembrando alverja, brócoli y maíz en el lugar de su vivienda ya que estos son los que mantienen mejores precios en el mercado de la región, realiza esta actividad desde que el tenia 30 años de edad
Por escaso recurso económico tuvo que trabajar y aprender la agricultura y no poder estudiar en alguna escuela de su comunidad, ahora el ve que sus cultivos están saliendo muy bien, necesita mas capital para seguir trabajando y cultivando más
El solicita un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para comprar semillas de alverja así también fertilizante orgánico para luego cultivarlo.
Comenta que entre sus sueños es seguir creciendo en la agricultura y tener mejor vivienda para sus hijos y esposa.
texts.en:
Miguel is a farmer; he’s married and lives in Sololá with his wife.  He has six children three of which are already married, two work with him and one son is finishing his academic studies as a construction technician.

He works in agriculture planting peas, broccoli and corn at home since these are the ones that have the best market price in his region; he’s been doing this work since the age of 30.

Due to scarce economic resources he had to work and learn agriculture and was unable to attend any local school.  Now that he sees his crops doing well, he needs more capital to continue working and growing more.

He’s requesting a Q 5,000.00 loan to buy pea seeds as well as organic fertilizer for the crop.  He comments that among his dreams is to continue growing in agriculture and to have a better house for his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Chuisuc De Pamaria Group

texts.es:
La señora Catarina esta casada tiene 38 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educacion primaria, tiene 9 hijos de los cuales 3 están estudiando, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa de toda clase, inicio este negocio por la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo, y hasta el momento lleva 20 años de experiencia, cuenta con al apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a ser jornalero.

Organiza un grupo y solicitan un préstamo que lo utilizaran para la compra de mercadería, camisas, playeras, pants, pantalones, trajes para bebés, entre otros. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio grande con local propio. Las demás integrantes se dedica al comercio y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Catarina is married and is 38 years old.  She completed three years of primary school.  She has nine children, three of whom are in school.  She earns a living selling all types of clothes.  She started this business because she needed to help her husband and now she has twenty years of experience.  She relies on the support of her husband who earns a living as a day laborer.  

She has organized a group and they are requesting a loan which will be used to buy merchandise - shirts, t-shirts, sweatpants, trousers, and baby clothes, among others.   In the future, she hopes to have a large business with her own shop.  

The other members of the group earn a living by raising and selling animals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando tiene 46 años convive con Marleny, con quien tiene 2 hijas: Judith de 21 y Marita de 17 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia que Orlando construyó con esmero y se ubica en un anexo agrícola. Orlando es un hombre carismático y trabajador. Su actividad económica es la agricultura, especialmente con el cultivo de papas y arvejas, pero además siembra habas y flores de gladiolos de manera esporádica.
Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que mientras mejor calidad tengan sus productos, mejores precios obtendrá por sus productos en el mercado mayorista de Tarma.
En los más de 30 años que lleva como agricultor, menciona que le gustan los días de cosechas, porque puede ver reflejado todo su esfuerzo en la calidad de sus frutos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras, para sembrar más, pero por ahora se esforzará en el cultivo de arvejas y papas, para ello solicita de su ayuda, para adquirir bolsas de fertilizantes. Éste es su crédito número 13 con MFP. Una vez más se compromete en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Fátima”, y es el presidente del grupo, se siente cómodo con el trabajo en equipo. Invertirá los 2000 soles en la compra de fertilizantes orgánicos como guano de corral y de isla, para sus próximos sembríos de papas y arvejas.
texts.en:
Orlando is 46 years old and lives with Marleny, with whom he has two daughters, 21-year-old Judith and 17-year-old Marita. They live in their own house that Orlando built with great care in a small agricultural community. Orlando is a charismatic and hardworking man. His livelihood is agriculture; he mainly grows potatoes and peas, but he also plants fava beans and gladiolus flowers from time to time. 

Every day, very early in the morning, he works in his fields, for he knows that the better the quality of his produce, the better the prices he will get for it in the wholesale market in Tarma.

In the more than thirty years that he has been a farmer, he says that he most likes the harvest days, because he can see his hard work reflected in the quality of his produce. With time, he wants to buy more land, so he can plant more, but for now, he will put his effort into his potato and pea crops. It is for those crops that he is requesting help so that he can buy bags of fertilizer. 

This is Orlando's thirteenth loan with MFP, and he once again promises to make his monthly payments on time. He belongs to the Virgin of Fatima communal bank. He is the president of the group, and he feels comfortable working as a team. He will invest the 2,000 soles (PEN) in the purchase of organic fertilizer like poultry guano and seabird guano for his next potato and pea plantings.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer like poultry guano and seabird guano.

loans.name: Vermira

texts.es: Vermira, tiene 38 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, es casada y vive con su esposo y sus hijos en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Ella tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la venta de productos alimenticios en su pulpería, donde vende granos básicos, refrescos, pan, pastillas, churros, dulces, azúcar, productos enlatados y otros. La pulpería la tiene en su casa y ya tiene una buena clientela. El préstamo que solicita es por 20,000 Lempiras y lo utilizara para surtir el negocio con productos comestibles de primera necesidad y poder mejorar los ingresos para ayudar a su familia. Su plan es que su negocio crezca y así tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Vermira is 38 years old.  She has three children and is married.  She lives with her husband and her children in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.  For ten years, she has been making a living selling food products from her small grocery store where she sells basic grains, soft drinks, bread, over-the-counter medicines, churros [fried dough pastry], candy, sugar, canned goods and other items.  The grocery store is located at her house and she already has a good clientele.  

The loan she is requesting is for 20,000 Lempiras and she will use it to supply her business with staple food products and to be able to improve her income in order to help her family.  Her plan is to grow her business and, thus, have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy food products such as bread, soft drinks, basic grains, sugar, rice, dairy products and other items to supply her business.

loans.name: Nilton Manuel

texts.es:
Nilton es un joven muy entusiasta, vive en al distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú. el distrito de Parcona se caracteriza por su clima cálido, así como también porque sus pobladores son personas muy amables y sobre todo hospitalarias.  Día a día Nilton trabaja muy duro para salir adelante y sobre todo para apoyar a sus padres ya que ellos son de condición humilde, pero cuando dispone de un tiempito libre a Nilton le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, pero lo que mas le gusta es comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Ceviche. 

Con mucha dedicación Nilton trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de carne de pollo en el mercado de su distrito, el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30m clientes en el día; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos de calidad.

Nilton está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado el podrá realizar el pintado de su local, así como también colocar un letrero luminoso y herramientas para su trabajo como cuchillos, afiladores, pinzas, entre otros, de esta manera el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y formar una familia”.
texts.en:
Nilton is an enthusiastic young man who lives in the district of Parcona, Ica, Perú.  Parcona is known for its warm climate, as well as for the fact that its inhabitants are friendly and very hospitable people.  Everyday, Nilton works very hard to try to get ahead and above all to help his parents, since they are poor.  But when he has a little free time, Nilton really likes to play football with his friends and neighbors.  What he likes most, though, is to eat one of his favorite foods, the very delicious ceviche (marinated raw fish).

Nilton is very dedicated to his small business selling chicken meat in his district's market.  He spends about 10 hours a day on his business and can take care of up to 30m clients a day; he thinks his business does so well because he is very friendly to his clients and because he offers them high-quality products.

Nilton would like to thank Kiva's donors, since because of your support, he will be able to paint his premises, as well as put up new glowing lettering and buy tools for his work, such as knives, knife sharpeners, tongs, and so on.  In this way, he will be able to improve his income and continue working towards making his biggest dream a reality:  "To have my own house and start a family."

loans.use: to paint his premises, buy lettering and tools, etc.

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Aun is 36 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $3 daily. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Aun is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase farmland for cultivating vegetables to sell. By doing so, she would earn additional income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for cultivating vegetables to sell

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
On the table seen above, Abigail displays pineapples and watermelons. She sells different kinds of fruits at Ayensudu near Elmina.  

Abigail is married and has three children. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy pineapples, oranges, bananas and other varieties of fruit to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy land.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, oranges, bananas and other varieties of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 38 years old, married and a mother of three children. She sells ladies' shoes and children's clothing in Malindi for a living where she earns a monthly income of about KES 11,000. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD. by a credit officer. The loan of KES 30,000 given to Khadija will purchase additional stock of ladies' shoes and children's clothing for sale. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children. 

She intends to continue growing her business and hopes that one day she will come to own her own well-established boutique.

loans.use: to buy more ladies' shoes and children's clothing for sale.

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es:
Nerida de 27 años convive desde hace 3 años con Juan Carlos, con quien tiene 2 hijos: Wilder y Andrea. Ellos habitan una casa propia que construyeron en un anexo agrícola. Nerida es una joven luchadora. Su actividad es la agricultura desde hace 5 años. Al lado de su pareja se dedica a las labores intensas del campo. Además tiene que atender a sus hijos y el hogar. “Si es cansado el trabajo, pero si no trabajamos no hay dinero”, menciona con inteligencia.
En terrenos de su propiedad siembra papas, arvejas y habas. Cuando el trabajo es extenuante debe contratar a jornaleros que limpien sus terrenos. Pero los fines de semana, ella coge las herramientas y se dirige a sus chacras para atenderlas. Asimismo se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como chanchos y cuyes que enseba para luego venderlos en su puesto de trabajo. 
Sus metas más cercanas son sembrar papas y arvejas, porque las temporadas de siembra inician desde setiembre y ella no quiere quedarse atrás. Éste es su crédito número 9 con MFP, por eso se compromete en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Cruz de Tapo”, donde sus socias son personas con los mismos intereses. Nerida, destinará los 2000 soles solicitados en la compra de guano de granja y de corral para sus cultivos de papas, además comprará semillas de arvejas y habas.
texts.en:
Nerida is 27 years old and has been living with Juan Carlos for three years, with who she has two children: Wilder and Andrea. They live in their own house, which they built in an annex farm. Nerida is a young fighter. Her activity is agriculture for five years. With her partner, she is dedicated to intensive farm work. Also, she has to take care of her children and her home. "The work is tiring, but if we don't work, there's no money", says wisely. 

In land she owns, she grows potatoes, peas, and beans. When the work is strenuous, she has to hire laborers to clean up the land. But on weekends, she takes the tools and heads to her farm to take care of it. Additionally, she is dedicated to raise small animals such as pigs and guinea pigs which she fattens up for sale in her job.

Her nearest goals are to plant potatoes and peas, because the planting season starts from September and she doesn't want to be left behind. This is her loan number 9 with MFP, so she agrees to pay the monthly payments on time. She belongs to the communal bank "Santa Cruz de Tapo", where its members are people with the same interests.

Nerida will invest the 2,000 soles requested in buying farm and poultry manure for her crops of potatoes, and also will buy peas and beans' seeds.

loans.use: to buy poltry manure.

loans.name: Silvon Baba

texts.en:
Silvon is a 45- year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has five children between six and 16. All of them go to school.
Silvon runs a general store, and has been in business for five years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2,000 sdg to purchase matooke, cabbage, eggs, and many other items. She has no other source of income.
In five years Silvon would like to expand her business.
Her major challenges include high prices in the market.
Silvon says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva .

loans.use: to buy more items like cabbage, matooke, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Srey Na

texts.en: Srey Na is 41 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are traditional musicians who earn about $6 daily. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and earns about $3 each day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Srey Na is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase farmland to grow rice. This purchase will help her generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand the business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more convenient for the family.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to grow rice.

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en:
Robinson is known to be a responsible and hardworking man. He is 52 years old, married and has four children. His wife, Julieta, is his partner in managing a talipapa (vegetable stall) and a small retail store selling grocery items to the people in their village. Sometimes, Robinson also extends credit on his merchandise but makes sure to collect them by the end of the week. He aspires to keep improving his service and sales. He is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy cases of soft drinks, sardines, eggs, milk, sugar, soap and shampoo to sell. It will help him diversify his business. 

Increasing his income will also provide a fortunate life for his family.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft drinks, sardines, eggs, milk, sugar, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary has been a baker in Ayensudu, near Elmina, for four years. She is a single parent with four children. She feeds, clothes and pays the school fees of her children with her income. Mary needs this loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar and oil for her bakery. With the new profit, Mary would like to give her children the best education.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar and oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is a fruit vender. She sells pineapples and watermelons in Ayensudo, near Elmina. She has been in this business for five years. She is a married to a farmer and has four childern. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Ekua will use her loan to purchase a variety of fruit to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba, who is married to a farmer and has three children, is a fishmonger who also sells kenkey in Ayensudo near Elmina.  She supports her husband in paying their children’s school fees with her income. Araba will use her loan to purchase more fish and maize to enable her to increase her sales. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish and maize to enable her to increase her sales.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu, 32, is a very hard-working woman who lives with her husband and one child. She has had a vegetable stand in her home for the last three months.

Saumu is applying to Yehu for a loan, with the desire to be able to invest in the business. She wants to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, kale, and other fresh fruits and vegetables to sell.

Saumu and her husband are very trustworthy people, and they have good references from their neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, kale, and other fresh fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is divorced and has five dependents. She sells different kinds of fruit (oranges, bananas, pineapples and others) in Ayensudu near Elmina in the Central Region of Ghana. She hopes to use the loan to buy more fruit to sell. Her profit will be reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: El señor modesto es un hombre digno de admiración trabaja desde los 15 años como albañil actualmente tiene 50 años de edad , en la actualidad el conoce a la perfección su trabajo se casó con María a sus  18 años tienen 10 hijos de los cuales 2 viven con él  en la zona de sacaba sus hijos son Gastón e Iban ambos se encuentran estudiando uno en la secundaria  y el otro en la Universidad Mayor de San Simón , el señor modesto  compro con los ahorros de su trabajo un terreno en el área periurbano de ocasión ya que su hermano,  necesita construir motivo por el cual es el presente crédito, ya que sus hijos viven en alquiler y gastan mucho dinero, su esposa además se encuentra delicada de salud ya que tiene diabetes no tienen seguro y gastan mucho dinero.
texts.en: Modesto is an admirable man who has been working since the age of 15 as a construction worker. He is now 50 years old and is an expert at his job. He married his wife, Maria, when they were 18 years old. They now have 10 children, two of whom--Gaston and Iban--live with him near Sacaba. They are both currently studying, one in high school and the other at the Universidad Mayor de San Simon. Modesto used his savings to buy a parcel of land in a suburban area. He is requesting this loan to help build additional rooms because his children are currently living in rental units and have many expenses. Furthermore, his wife also suffers from diabetes and, because they do not have insurance, their expenses are very high.

loans.use: to build rooms for his children.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is applying for his second loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Simon will use the loan to buy more blank CDs and DVDs to record and sell to his customers.

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to grow his business and open a big recording studio.

loans.use: to buy blank CDs and DVDs.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
This is Letecia, a 48-year-old resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jerlito and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Letecia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She buys supplies at wholesale and sells them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Letecia hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams to have a good life through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio de 21 años, es una joven soltera. Vive con sus padres en una casa propia ubicada en un anexo rural y agrícola. Rocio es una joven ejemplar. A sus cortos 17 años ya se dedicaba a la agricultura. En estos 4 años logró que sus padres le otorgaran sus parcelas propias como herencia. En dichos terrenos siembra papas y arvejas, pues son los productos que crecen con facilidad en su zona.
“Desde el 2009 ya cosecho mis propios productos y gracias a mi padre que me ayuda puedo llevar las papas hasta el mercado mayorista”, menciona Rocío, muy agradecida de su padre.
Desde entonces, ella se las ingenia para atender sus cultivos, porque además estudia por las mañanas. 
Ella tiene sus objetivos personales establecidos. Desea terminar de estudiar su carrera técnica de enfermera y ampliar sus cultivos, porque considera que la agricultura es la actividad familiar y no la piensa descuidar.
Rocío sembrará 10 sacos de semillas de papas y requiere de su ayuda para comprar abonos orgánicos. Éste es su primer préstamo con MFP. Se siente agradecida por la confianza, por ello dice que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales.
Rocío invertirá los 1500 soles en la compra de bolsas de abonos orgánicos para sus cultivos de papas.
texts.en:
Rocío is a young, single, 21-year-old woman. She lives with her parents in the home that they own, which is located in a small rural and agricultural community.

Rocío is an exemplary young woman. At only 17 years old, she was already working in agriculture. In the four years since, her parents have handed down their land to her as an early inheritance. On that land, she grows potatoes and peas, since those are the crops that grow easily in her area. 

"Since 2009, I've been harvesting my own produce and thank to my father, who helps me, I am able to take the potatoes to the wholesale market," Rocío, very grateful to her father, explains.

Since that time, she has found a way to take care of her crops, because she also goes to school in the mornings. Rocío has established her personal objectives: she wants to finish studying for her nursing degree and expand her crops, because she considers farming to be the family business and she is not planning to neglect it.

Rocío will plant ten sacks of potato seeds and needs help to buy organic fertilizer. This is her first loan with MFP. She feels grateful for their trust, and she says that's why she will be punctual in making her monthly payments. 

Rocío will invest the 1,500 soles (PEN) in the purchase of bags of organic fertilizer for her potato crop.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is 29 years old, married, and a mother of two children. For the last seven years, she has earned a living by selling clothes in Malindi. She earns a monthly income of KES 9,000.

Loice was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for her second loan of KES 30,000, which she will use to buy additional stock for her business such as dresses, blouses, trousers, shirts and so on to sell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as expand her business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her business such as dresses, blouses, trousers, shirts and so on to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 46 year old businesswoman. She is married to Joseph, who is a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been selling fruit for the past ten years, and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family. 

Janet is applying for her first loan cycle from KADET LTD, after being introduced to the organization by an existing customer. She will use the loan to buy more fruit to sell. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her goal is to supply fruit to nearby schools and hospitals.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La señora Victoria de 51 años es casada y vive en una casa que base de esfuerzos ella y su esposo compraron y han ido reparando poco a poco; ella es una persona muy emprendedora que no le gusta depender de su esposo piensa que  si ambos trabajar podrán tener una calidad de  vida mejor  que cuando solo uno trabaja, su esposo trabaja en una maquiladora de la localidad y ella se dedica a la venta de   tortas, hamburguesas, nachos, fritos con queso, tacos y refrescos de esta manera ella obtiene un ingreso y así contribuye con los gastos del hogar. Su casa necesita arreglos y solicita el apoyo para enjarre y pintura; agradece el apoyo que le puedan facilitar para concluir su proyecto.
texts.en: Victoria is 51 years old, she is married and she lives in a house she and her husband have succeeded in buying thanks to their efforts, little by little also making repairs. She is a very resourceful person who doesn’t like depending on her husband as she thinks that if both of them have a job instead of only one of them, they will be able to enjoy a better standard of living. Her husband works in maquiladora (foreign-owned assembly plants) of their community, while she sells cakes, hamburgers, fried cheese, tacos and soft drinks. She earns a living this way, thus contributing in paying for the household expenses. Her house needs to be repaired and she is requesting a loan to buy plaster and paint. She is grateful for the support she will receive to complete her project.

loans.use: To buy plaster and paint.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 32 years old. He is a very hard-working businessman, and is married to Naomi, who is a businesswoman. They are blessed with two children, aged 10 and 4 respectively. He has been running a barber shop as a primary business and a green grocer as a secondary business for the past three years. He earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

George is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced to the organization by a staff member. He will use the loan to buy a shaving machine and assorted vegetables for sale.

loans.use: to buy a shaving machine and assorted vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Mikhail

texts.ru:
Михаил живет в небольшом селе Веряця недалеко от Виноградово . Там у него есть свой продуктовый магазин. Так как село, в котором живет Михаил, – небольшой, магазинов там немного, а свежие и качественные продукты всегда пользуются спросом. Более того, один раз магазинчик Михаила пробовали обокрасть, и ему пришлось установить хорошую сигнализацию, чтобы подобный попытки не увенчались успехом. 
Так как свой магазин Михаил открыл не так давно – всего 1.5 года тому назад, он стремится развиваться, учится тому, как правильно организовывать торговлю и какие товары больше пользуются спросом. Поэтому Михаил обратился в КИВА за кредитом в размере 22 000 гривен, чтобы пополнить магазин качественными продуктами, а также открыть еще отдел с фруктами и овощами.
texts.en:
Mikhail lives in the small village of Veryatsya, not far from Vynohradiv. There he has his own grocery store.  Since the village where Mikhail lives is not very big, there are few grocery stores, and fresh fruits and vegetables are always in demand. On top of that, Mikhail's store was the target of an attempted robbery. He was forced to install a good alarm system to deter similar attempts. 

Because it hasn't been long since Mikhail opened his store--just a year and a half--he is trying to grow the business. He is learning how to correctly manage a business and which goods are most in demand. Therefore Mikhail is asking Kiva for a loan of 22,000 hryvnia to fill the store with quality groceries, as well as open a new fruit and vegetable section.

loans.use: fill his store with quality groceries, as well as open a new fruit and vegetable section

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.es:
Rodelia de 48 años, convive con su pareja con quien tiene 8 hijos cuyas edades oscilan entre los 28 y 8 años. Ella y su esposo viven con 5 de sus hijos en una casa que construyeron en un anexo rural. Rodelia es una mujer de carácter agradable y de gran fortaleza para el trabajo. Desde los 17 años se dedica a la agricultura, al lado de su esposo. La zona donde vive le proporciona buenas tierras para la producción de papas y arvejas. “Ahora que empezaron las lluvias, las cosechas serán mejores, pero el trabajo también se complicará por el frío”, menciona.
Cuida con mucho esmero y cuidado toda su producción, pues confiesa que su principal pasatiempo es limpiar la maleza que crece entre los sembríos. Siembra de papas en distintas variedades y menciona que, ahí radica sus buenas ventas. 
Toda su producción es trasladada hasta la ciudad de Tarma (a 1 hora y media de distancia), donde cuenta con compradores conocidos. Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital de trabajo, pero gracias al trabajo con MFP, lo ha sobrellevado.
Este mes inicia la campaña de siembras de papas, y como ella ya tiene las semillas solicita su apoyo para adquirir abonos. Éste es su crédito número 7 con MFP, pero esta vez con un crédito individual, por eso se responsabiliza en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. 
Con el dinero comprará como 20 bolsas de abonos orgánicos, entre guano de isla de la costa y guano de granja.
texts.en:
Rodelia is 48 years old, she lives together with her husband, and they have eight children ranging between the ages of 8 and 28. She and her husband live with five of their children in a home that they built in a rural district. Rodelia is a kind woman who is not afraid of hard work. Since the age of 17 she has worked as a farmer along with her husband. The area where they live has good land for the cultivation of potatoes and peas. "Now that the rains have come, the harvests will be better, but the work will be complicated by the cold weather," she notes.
She puts great care and dedication into her work, even to the point of confessing that her favorite pastime is clearing the weeds from between the crops. She grows a variety of potatoes, adding that this is at the root of her good sales. 
All of her crops are transported to the city of Tarma (an hour and a half away) where she has many regular customers. Her main difficulty has been a lack of working capital, but thanks to the work of MFP she has overcome this. 
This month marks the beginning of the potato planting season. As she already has the seeds, she is requesting your support in acquiring fertilizers. This is her seventh loan through MFP, but this time she is requesting an individual loan. For this reason she is committed to making her monthly payments on time. With the money she will purchase 20 bags of organic fertilizers, such as island guano, coastal guano, and manure.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Daniel Francisco

texts.es:
Daniel vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo en esta ciudad se desarrolla la agricultura, especialmente se cultiva el algodón, uva, esparrago, entre otros. Daniel es casado y junto a sus esposa tiene 3 hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad y por quienes se ha esforzado mucho para poder darles una vida digna y sobre todo sean personas de bien. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho leer y en algunas ocasiones le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Arroz chaufa. 

Día a día Daniel trabaja en un estudio jurídico, el labora alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes al día, el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo honesto con los clientes.

Daniel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá, realizar mejoras en su vivienda como tarrajeo, refacción de techos, entre otros; de esta manera el podrá  mejorar la calidad de vida de  su familia y seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Daniel lives in the city of Ica, a city known for having a warm and friendly atmosphere. The city is also home to agriculture, especially the cultivation of cotton, grapes, asparagus, and other crops. 

Daniel is married, and he and his wife have three adult children; he has worked very hard to be able to give a them decent life and, above all, to help them become good people. When he has free time, he really likes reading and, on occasion, he really likes to eat one of his favorite dishes, "arroz chaufa" [fried rice]. 

Day after day, Daniel works in a law office. He works around eight hours a day, and he can take care of up to ten clients a day. He believes that his work is going well because he is very responsible and, above all, honest with his clients. 

Daniel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have given, he will be able to make improvements to his house, like plastering, roof repairs, and more. In this way, he will be able to improve his family's quality of life and continue working to be able to make his biggest dream into a reality: finishing the construction of his house with quality materials.

loans.use: to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru:
Анна живет в Мелитополе. Она торгует женской одеждой на крупном местном рынке. Работает в сфере рыночной торговли уже 7 лет, пока только арендует торговое место. 
Анна планирует вложить сумму в 10 000 гривен в закупку товара для продажи в сезон, а именно хочет приобрести теплые трикотажные вещи и домашние халаты, которые всегда хорошо берут именно, когда наступают холода в Украине.
texts.en:
Anna lives in Melitopol. She sells women's clothes at the local fashion market. She has worked in trade at the markets for 7 years now. For the time being, she only rents her stall's space.

Anna plans to put the sum of 10,000 hryvnia towards the purchase of seasonal goods. Specifically, she wants to buy warm knitwear and house robes, which always sell well when cold weather arrives in Ukraine.

loans.use: to aquire warm knitwear and house robes

loans.name: Mireya Del Socorro

texts.es: Mireya, 55 años de edad, habitante de la comarca Los Encuentros, Teustepe, madre de 6 hijos todos ellos viven independiente, es comerciante y agricultora, no tiene educación escolar, pero ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de no tener estudios. Su esposo trabaja en las labores del campo sembrando frijoles. Ella está requiriendo el crédito para comprar productos de limpieza, aceite, enlatados, avenas, toallas sanitarias, papel higienico, gaseosas, jugos etc. Todos productos de mucha necesidad y alto consumo de los cuales carecen en su comunidad. Ella desea ir poco a poco surtiendo su pulpería con productos que necesiten sus cliente, al mismo tiempo que le permita crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Mireya is 55 years old, she lives in the rural area of Los Encuentros, Teustepe, and she has 6 children, all of whom live independently. She is a retailer and a farmer, she did not go to school but she has succeeded in getting ahead in life notwithstanding her lack of schooling. Her husband is a farmer and he works in the county planting beans. She is requesting a loan to buy cleaning products, oil, canned food, oats, sanitary towels, toilet paper, fizzy drinks and juices, as these greatly required and consumed products are lacking in her community. She wants to supply her general store little by little with products her customers might need in order to facilitate the growth of her shop.

loans.use: To buy cleaning products, oil, canned food, oats, sanitary towels, toilet paper, fizzy drinks and juices.

loans.name: Ray

texts.es:
Ray, de 42 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, además de alegre y sociable. Es conviviente con Delia quien es ama de casa y madre de sus 4 hijos Jack de 21, Pitter de 17, Clar de 10 y Jamilet de 7 años de edad a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.  Vive en compañía de su pareja y sus hijos, instalados cómodamente en su casa propia. Ray se dedica a la venta de repuestos para motos y mototaxis, brinda servicio de vulcanizado, cambio de aceite, lubricación, bajada de motor y otras funciones. Además compra y vende vehículos menores de segundo uso a los cuales arregla, repara y los deja en óptimas condiciones para que pueda ofrecerlos a buen precio. Para desarrollar esta actividad cuenta con un local propio acondicionado en su casa. Atiende diligentemente a todos los clientes que acuden a solicitar su servicio. Lleva en este negocio 6 años y trabaja con la ayuda de su familia. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene sus productos gracias al constante crecimiento del sector vehicular de motos y mototaxis en la ciudad donde vive. Le gusta su negocio porque siente que es el resultado de su esfuerzo y empeño que pudo concretar gracias al apoyo de su familia. Afortunadamente gracias a los buenos resultados que esta obteniendo sus ingresos económicos se han incrementado y su camino al progreso continúa, es por ello que desea complementar nuevas funciones dentro de su establecimiento y contar con todo el paquete de servicio vehicular porque siente que aún faltan algunas cosas. Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento ya que así se sentirá mas seguro de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de forma puntual, del mismo modo se siente muy tranquilo y respaldado por los integrantes de su banco comunal.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en su negocio en la compra de repuestos de motos, asimismo obtendrá un mototaxi de segundo uso valorizado en 850 nuevos soles al cual lo refaccionará y lo pondrá a la venta.
texts.en:
Ray, 42, is a hardworking, dedicated man as well as cheerful and sociable.  He lives with Delia who is a housewife and the mother of their four children: Jack, 21, Pitter, 17, Clar, 10, and Jamilet, 7, who he wants to provide a better quality of life for.  He lives with his spouse and children comfortably in their own house.

Ray works selling spare parts for motorcycles and mototaxis.  He provides tire repair services, oil change, lubrication, engine replacement and other functions.  He also buys and sells small, second-hand vehicles.  He repairs them and fixes them up leaving them in optimal condition so that he can sell them for a good price.  To carry out these activities, he has a shop set up at home.  He diligently takes care of all customers who come by requesting service.  He’s been in business six years and works with help from his family.  He considers his business to be quite profitable because of the high demand his products have thanks to the growth of motorcycle and mototaxi  vehicular traffic  in the city he lives in.  He likes his business because he feels it’s the result of his efforts and dedication that he was able to make reality with his family’s help.

Fortunately, thanks to the good results he’s been having his income has increased and his road towards progress continues.  This is why he wants to add new functions within his establishment and be able to offer a complete package of vehicular services because he feels he still lacks a few things.  

This is his 4th MFP loan and he is grateful to all those who make his access to this financing possible because he’ll feel more confident about being able to make progress in his work.  On the other hand, he commits to make his installment payments punctually.  Likewise, he feels very at ease and backed up by the members of his communal bank.

He will use the requested 1,500 new soles to invest in his business buying motorcycle spare parts; he will also buy a second-hand mototaxi valued at 850 new soles that he will repair and put up for sale.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts as well as a second-hand mototaxi.

loans.name: Carmen Natividad

texts.es: Carmen da a Gracias a Dios por que siempre le a gustado ser independiente ingreso a una escuela de belleza desde niña y empezó su negocio de peluquería tiene clientela fija con la Gracias de Dios va saliendo adelante. Hasta en su trabajo no ha presenta ninguna dificultad le va bien en su pequeño negocio de peluquería que tiene. Carmen es soltera, con el préstamo va a comprar maquinas, sillas arreglar su negocio. Le pide a Dios que le de vida para  poder seguir adelante y quiere mantener cerca a su familia.
texts.en: Carmen thanks God that she has also enjoyed being independent. She entered a beauty school when she was young and started her hair salon business. She has a regular clientele and, thank God, she's been getting ahead. She hasn't faced any difficulties in her work thus far; the small hair salon business she owns is doing well. Carmen is single and she'll use the loan to purchase equipment and chairs, and to spruce up her business. She asks God to allow her to live on so that she can get ahead, and she wishes to keep her family close.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and chairs, and to spruce up her business.

loans.name: Jorge Freddy

texts.es:
Jorge inicio con muy pocas ventas de animalitos, pero comenzo manejando una camioneta para mejorar la distribucion de a sus clientes, con un préstamo familiar compro cerdos pequeños de raza  para la cría, y hasta ahora sigue con el negocio de cría de cerdos. Su trabajo lo hace con su esposa le ayuda con la alimentación y vitaminas para los animalitos. Y cada 15 días vende un cerdo. Hasta ahora indica que no ha tenido ningún inconveniente en su negocio. Jorge tiene 2 hijos de (10 y 4años) la mayor esta en escuela particular. Con el préstamo va comprar cerdos y aves.
Unas de sus metas es poder poner otro negocio que siga la línea de los animales para tener ingresos para los estudios de su hijo.
texts.en: Jorge started out selling very few small animals, but then he began to use a pickup truck in order to improve the distribution to his customers. Using a loan he got from a relative, he bought small purebred pigs for raising, and he's still in the pig raising business to this day. He works with his wife; she helps him with feed and vitamins for the little animals. He sells a pig every 15 days. He reports that he hasn't faced any drawbacks in his business thus far. Jorge has two children aged 10 and 4; the older daughter goes to a private school. With this loan he'll purchase pigs and poultry. One of his goals is to be able to start another animal-related business so that he can earn enough to pay for his son's studies.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replant his coffee farms.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos es un hombre agricultor de 39 años de edad, quien vive en Sololá junto a su esposa y con sus 5 hijos dos hombres mayores de edad que lo ayudan en su trabajo. Dos mas que son menores de edad ellos estudian y una hija que tiene capacidades especiales que están cuidado todos. 
El se dedica al cultivo de maíz que lo comercializa en el mercado local y cebollines para luego venderlos en algunos restaurantes del departamento.
realiza esta actividad productiva desde que tenia 20 años ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar esto fue lo que aprendió de su padre cuando aun vivía con el. 
De este modo el ve la necesidad de tener mas capital para luego seguir expandiendo esta verdura en mas terreno así que el solicita un préstamo de Q 7,000.00 para la compra de semillas de cebolla, abono orgánico he insecticidas. 
Con sus ingresos y las ganancias que le dejen sus cultivos  el quiere comprar un terreno para seguir cultivando otro tipo de verduras y seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Marcos is a 39-year-old farmer who lives in Sololá with his wife and their 5 children: two of them are adult boys who help him with his activity, the other two boys are younger and go to school, while their daughter has special needs and they all care for her.
He plants corn and green onions, selling the corn in the local market and the green onions to some of the restaurants of his department.
He has been engaged in this activity from the age of 20, as he did not have the chance to study, and this activity is what he learnt from his father when he was still living with him.

He now needs to increase his capital to them keeping on extending these vegetables’ crops in some more land; therefore, he is requesting a loan of 7,000.00 GTQ to buy onion seeds, manure and insecticide.
With his earning and the income he will get from his crops he wants to buy some land to keep on planting this king of vegetables, thus keeping on increasing his earnings.

loans.use: To buy onion seeds, manure and insecticide.

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es: El Sr. Jose Gabriel es casado y tiene 3 hijos que aun dependen económicamente de él y que actualmente están estudiando, el trabaja como ingeniero en una maquiladora de la localidad y siempre se ha preocupado por brindarle a su familia un hogar lleno de amor y al mismo tiempo cubriendo todas las necesidades de su casa; el sueña en poder  tener un patrimonio seguro para cuando él su esposa lleguen a la vejez y poco a poco ha ido construyendo lo que ahora es su hogar, la casa donde él vive es una casa de interés social las cuales son muy pequeñas  y a base de esfuerzos en la ha ido ampliando para poder brindar a sus hijos su propio espacio. El tiene una necesidad en su hogar su techo se esta cayendo y el desea raparlo puesto que ya vienen las temporadas de lluvia y entra la humedad a su domicilio; agradece el apoyo que le puedan brindar.
texts.en: Jose Gabriel is married and he has 3 children who are still economically depending on him, as they are still studying. He is an engineer working for a maquiladora (foreign-owned assembly plants) of his community, and he has always been concerned about providing his family with a loving household, while paying for all the necessities of his house. He dreams of enjoying stable wealth when he and his wife will be old, and little by little he has been building what is now their home. They live in public housing, which are generally very small solutions; he has enlarged it with great efforts in order to give his children their own space. The roof of his house is about to collapse and he wants to have it repaired as the raining season is approaching and humidity invades his house. He is grateful fort the support he will receive.

loans.use: To have the roof of his house fixed.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia, de 30 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.  Es conviviente con Jorge Luis quien es padre de su hijo de 2 años, además ella tiene 4 hijos más de su anterior relación, vive junto a toda su familia en su casa propia que pudo obtener gracias a su trabajo. La actividad que realiza Silvia es la venta de chupetes y “curichis”, cuenta con una refrigeradora y recipientes de congelación donde coloca sus productos para venderlos en un colegio ubicado cerca a su casa en donde tiene su puesto fijo. Prepara los chupetes con frutas frescas regionales como guanábana, mango, “taperiba”, coco o banana. Se inició en esta actividad hace más de 5 años y hasta el momento lo realiza ella sola. Considera a su  negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tienen sus productos influenciado por el clima caluroso de la zona. Desde hace 3 meses complementa esta función con la venta de bebidas heladas como gaseosas y cervezas para lo cual compra semanalmente con una pequeña inversión por el momento. Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y las necesidades de sus hijos quienes son su principal motivación para seguir progresando, por tanto tiene planes de seguir adelante y ampliar la capacidad de productos disponibles. Este es el crédito numero 2 con MFP, por ello se siente agradecida con las personas que le brindan el financiamiento que necesita para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual y espera continuar trabajando con su banco comunal por el compañerismo y la solidaridad que muestran entre ellos cada uno de sus integrantes. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles comprará ingredientes que usa en la elaboración de los chupetes que pone a la venta y otra parte del dinero lo usará en la compra de bebidas gaseosas para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Silvia, 30, is a hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She lives with Jorge Luis who is the father of their two-year-old son.  She has four more children from a previous relationship.  She lives with her entire family in a house of her own that she was able to get thanks to her work.  

Silvia’s activity is selling ‘chupetes’ [frozen fruit treats] and ‘curichis.’ [Fruit pulp mixed with water and served in plastic bags].  She has a refrigerator and ice chests she packs with her items to sell in a school near her house she has a permanent stand at.  She prepares the chupetes with fresh, regional fruit like guanábana [soursop], mango, ‘taperiba,’ [yellow mombin] coconut or banana.  She started in this business more than five years ago and to date continues working alone.  She considers it to be quite profitable because demand for her products is high due to the hot climate in the zone.  Three months ago she started also selling cold beverages like soft-drinks and beer that she buys weekly making a small investment for now.  She likes her business because it produces income she can use to cover household expenses and her children’s needs; they are her main motivation to continue making progress.  She, therefore, has plans to continue forward and expanding her production capacity.

This is her second MFP loan and she’s grateful to the people who provide financing so she can make her plans reality.  On the other hand, she commits to make her installment payments punctually and hopes to continue working with her communal bank because of the team spirit and mutual support each and every member has.

She will use the requested 1,000 new soles to buy ingredients used to make the chupetes she sells and part of the money will be used to buy soft-drinks to continue working.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her frozen fruit treats and carbonated soft-drinks.

loans.name: Siprianus

texts.en:
Siprianus is a 50 year-old man and is married to Yuliana, a 40-year-old lady. They have five children: Anus, 20, a university student; Tika, 16, in the 2nd grade of Senior High School; Tari, 15, in the 1st grade of Senior High School, Gius, in the 4th grade of Elementary School; and Nicen, 4. 

Siprianus owns a kiosk that sells household items such as sugar, coffee, detergent, cigarettes, bath soap, mosquito coils, snacks and soft drinks. He has been running the business for more than 10 years, using his own capital. This business is really vital to Siprianus as it enables him to cover his family's living expenses and the children's school fees.

The increase of market prices and demand by customers for more stock led Siprianus to seek more money to buy various items. He requested a loan amounting to IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. Siprianus plans to spend the loan on petrol, cigarettes, more snacks and soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy petrol, cigarettes, more snacks and soft drinks.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab lives in Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and owns a green grocery stall, which she has been operating for one year. In this business, Zainab sells greens, fruits, and vegetables. 

Zainab learned about Milango through a friend with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuations and inflation, purchasing stock, and a seasonal business climate.

Zainab is applying for a loan of KES 21,050 to buy vegetables wholesale and tomatoes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business. Her plans for the future are to start other businesses and also open stalls in different areas.

loans.use: To buy vegetables wholesale and tomatoes.

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es: Carlos empezó  hace unos 7 años atrás cuando se quedo sin trabajo un amigo lo llevo a trabajar ebanista y aprendió le gusto y se puso su local propio de máquina de cortar madera y pintura. Su trabajo lo hace con 1 empleado y de lunes a viernes de 8:00am a 18:00pm. Unas de sus dificultades es la enfermedad. Con el préstamo va a comprar una cortadora, pintura y soplete. Unas de sus metas es tener un taller de ebanista
texts.en: About seven years ago when he became unemployed, a friend of Carlos took him to work as a cabinet maker and he learned.  He liked it and set up his own shop with a wood saw and paint.  He works with help from one employee from Monday through Friday from 8am until 6pm.  One of his difficulties is illness.  He will use the loan to buy a saw, paint and a blowtorch.  One of his goals is to own a cabinet-making shop.

loans.use: to buy a saw, paint and a blowtorch.

loans.name: Karen Pamela

texts.es:
Karen  tiene una  tienda pequeña en donde vende arroz, azúcar, atún y en base a las ventas realizadas ha empezado a comprar y a surtir su tienda, ella va a comprar directo al mercado  para obtener  la mercadería a bajo a precio. Su trabajo lo hace con su mama con el negocio de lunes a lunes de 6:00am a 21:00pm. 

Unas de sus dificultades en trabajo es la falta de crédito para comprar más productos. Con el préstamo va comprar legumbres, confitería y otros productos. Unas de sus metas tener una tienda grande y distribuir más cosas
texts.en:
Karen has a small store where she sells rice, sugar and tuna and based on her sales she’s started to buy more to stock her store.  She goes directly to the market to buy the merchandise at a low price.  She works with her mother in the store from Monday to Monday from 6am until 9pm.

One of the work difficulties she has is the lack of credit to buy more products.  With the loan she will buy vegetables, sweets and other products.  One of her goals is to have a large store and to sell more things.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Milton Cecilio

texts.es: Milton se dedicaba a la producción y filmación de eventos, después empezó a alquilar un local  donde actualmente es su estudio. En la actualidad tiene un estudio de fotografias, su trabajo lo realiza junto a su hermana de lunes a domingo.  No tiene ninguna dificultad en su trabajo hasta ahora le va bien. Milton está casado su esposa se dedica a la venta de compra y venta de omnilife. Con el préstamo va a comprar una computadora y copias. Unas  de sus aspiraciones desean tener una sucursal.
texts.en: Milton used to work producing and filming events and then rented a locale where his studio is presently located.  He currently has a photography studio.  He works with his sister Monday to Sunday.  He has no difficulties at work at present and does well to date.  Milton is married and his wife is an Omnilife merchant.  He will use his loan to buy a computer and copies.  One of his hopes is that they’d like to open a branch.

loans.use: to buy a computer and copies.

loans.name: Mwagowa

texts.en:
Mwagowa is an entrepreneur whose activity is a grocery store. He’s had the business for eight months.  It is located at home and it’s made progress thanks to help from his wife and his own efforts. He has already gained much experience that has taught him very important things.

The loan is to buy stock like flour, detergent, cooking fat, soft-drinks and other basic items. He’s managed to stay in business thanks to support he’s getting from Yehu and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy stock like flour, detergent, cooking fat, soft-drinks and other basic items.

loans.name: Phyllis

texts.en:
Phyllis is 32 years old and married, with three children. For the last seven years, she has earned a living by selling used clothes in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 8,000. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.  She is applying for her second loan of KES 26,000 to buy additional stock for her business, such as dresses, blouses, trousers, and shirts to sell to her customers. She will use profit to pay her children's school fees as well as expand her business. 

Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to  buy stock for her business, such as dresses, blouses, trousers, and shirts.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman lives in Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has four children. 

She owns a retail shop for selling juice, bottled water, sweets, etc., and the business has been operating for three years. Suleiman started the business through her personal savings and at that time operated a grocery stall. 

Suleiman learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group.  She joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation.

Suleiman is applying for a loan of KES 104,750  to buy retail stock like flour, sugar, salt, and bottled water. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help her pay the loan. Her future plan is to expand to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy retail stocks, like flour, sugar, salt, and bottled water.

loans.name: Joel Antonio

texts.es: Joel es un joven estudiante de 23 años de edad, que estudia y trabaja. Actualmente cursa el 6to ciclo de  la carrera de psicología en la universidad Peruana Unión. Decidió estudiar dicha carrera, porque vio que era su vocación. Para poder solventar sus gastos de la universidad ha tenido que trabajar la cual actualmente brinda servicio de taxi. Su pareja y su hija son su mayor motivación para seguir adelante. Su meta a futuro es de terminar satisfactoriamente su carrera, pues al culminar piensa  poner su propio consultorio.  El crédito que requiere lo destinara para el pago de su mensualidad de la universidad. Joel se siente feliz y agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por ayudar a personas como él.
texts.en: Joel, 23, is a young student who both works and studies.  He’s currently in the 6th cycle of psychology at Peruana Unión University.  He decided on this particular career because he realized it was his vocation.  To cover his university costs, he’s had to work and he’s currently a taxi driver.  His spouse and daughter are his greatest motivation to continue forward.  His future goal is to satisfactorily complete his career because he plans to open his own office when he graduates.  The loan he needs will be used to pay his monthly tuition at the university.  Joel is happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for helping people like him.

loans.use: Para el pago de pensiones de la Universidad.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is a hog raiser and vendor of vegetables and meat. She has been doing this kind of business for three years. Eugenia is married and blessed with eight children.   At this time she spends alot on six of her children who currently go to school.  Her main priority at this time is to gain greater income to be able to send her children into a higher level of education.

Eugenia would like to ask for a loan amounting to PHP10,000, allowing her to buy livestock feed and vitamins to ensure proper growth of her raised hogs. Eugenia wakes up early in the morning to feed her hogs and clean their pigpen to avoid any harmful diseases that will affect the growth of her hogs. She hopes to give her children a comfortable living and support them until they finish their studies. She is hoping for the continuous growth of her business and the financial support of lenders so she can help her husband in generating funds for their family.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed  and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Ernesa

texts.en:
This is Ernesa, She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 
  
Ernesa dreams to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jorge Gregorio

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre de 58 años de edad, quien vive en Sololá, conjuntamente con su esposa y sus 8 hijos 4 de ellos hombres la cual el mas grande estará cerrando su carrera académica al final del año y los otros tres pequeños estudian el nivel primario en la escuela.
También cuatro mujeres que ayudan a don Jorge en el campo  y en ocasiones trabajan de oficios domésticos en casas ajenas  aportando a la economía de la familia.
El  es un hombre trabajador y amable, comenta que el se dedica a cultivar papa, cebolla, frijol, ejote o dependiendo de la temporada del año, esto fue el trabajo que realizaban sus padres y el fue aprendiendo con el pasar del tiempo, cuenta que el estudio el nivel primario en una escuela nocturna trabajando en el día y estudiando de noche aportando a la economía de su familia y sus hermanos.
Ahora el trabaja con su esposa y sus hijos desde hace 30 años, de esta  manera ve que sus necesidad aumenta el solicita un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para comprar semillas de papa y cebolla así como el fertilizante orgánico que utilizan estas verduras para ser cultivadas. De esta manera tener mejores ingresos económicos para toda la familia.
Con todos sus ingresos y las ganancias que le generen en el futuro el sueña con tener un negocio como una tienda de consumo y darle mejores estudios académicos a sus demás hijos pequeños.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 58-year-old man living in Sololá with his wife and 8 children, four boys.  The oldest is about to complete his academic career at the end of the year and the other three younger ones attend elementary school.  He also has four daughters who help Jorge in the fields and sometimes work as domestic employees in the homes of third parties to contribute to family economy.

He’s a hardworking, kind man who comments that he works growing potatoes, onions, beans, green beans or according to the time of year.  This was the same work his parents did and he learned it as time went by.  He comments that he attended elementary school at night while working days and studying at night contributing to his family and his siblings’ economy.

He’s now been working with his wife and children for the last 30 years and noting now that his needs have increased he’s requesting a Q 5,000.00 loan to buy potato and onion seeds as well as organic fertilizer these vegetables need to grow.  In this way his family income will increase.  He hopes with his income and profits generated in the future to be able to have a business like a grocery store and to provide better education for his youngest children.

loans.use: to buy potato and onion seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina has offered vegetables and fruits for ten years. She earns about PHP3,000 monthly. She used this amount for her children's daily necessities, maintenance of her corn field and other household expenses. 

Avelina is 44 years of age, married, and blessed with four children.  Her eldest has finished her studies already, while her three other children are still studying.  Avelina plans to increase the kilograms of vegetables and fruit she offers.  She is requesting additional working capital in the amount of PHP6,000. She hopes she can educate her three children and give them comfortable living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and bananas to increase her profit

loans.name: Huda

texts.en: Huda is a 38 year-old married female from Madaba in Jordan. She has five children and has requested a 1000 JOD loan to buy clothes for retailing. From the income she has generated, she bought a piece of land and is looking forward to building a house. In the future, she would like to have her own shop and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Mario Ruben

texts.es:
Mario es un hombre de 32 años, separado de su esposa y tiene un hijo a quien brinda la respectiva ayuda económica; terminó la secundaria. Él vive en la ciudad de Quito, capital de la República del Ecuador y es la segunda ciudad más poblada del país con más de 2 millones de habitantes, entre nativos y migrantes de otras ciudades y países, ha sido el punto de encuentro de habitantes de todas las provincias, formando una cultura muy colorida, está embellecida con extensas calles, y edificios con diseños vanguardistas en donde se mueven empresas de renombre en todas las áreas. Tiene iglesias, museos y parques con estructuras que enamoran a sus turistas nacionales y extranjeros. En el centro-norte de la ciudad se encuentran centros de entretenimiento como restaurantes, galerías, discotecas para ser visitados. Mario vive específicamente en el barrio “La Armenia” ubicado en la parroquia de Conocoto, en el norte de la ciudad, sector conocido como el “Quito moderno” en donde están concentradas muchas empresas que son el centro económico del país. Los hogares de este sector en su mayoría son de carácter residencial, aunque en sectores apartados aún se puede divisar casas sin acabados de construcción adecuados.  
Mario tiene un negocio de cerrajería al cual se ha dedicado desde muy niño desde hace 20 años y que aprendió de sus padres a quienes siempre ayudó. Con 10 horas en el día el brinda este servicio que logró establecer a pesar de la falta de capital. Mario solicitó un préstamo en Fundación Alternativa para poder mejorar la estructura de su negocio, ya que el lugar establecido para atender el negocio está descubierto y el clima puede dañar los equipos y materiales que utiliza.
