Él espera que con este cambio pueda ganarse más fácilmente la confianza de sus clientes y así mejorar sus ingresos lo que le permitirá llevar una mejor calidad de vida tanto para él como para su hijo.
texts.en:
Mario is 32 years old, he is separated from his wife and he has one child he economically provides for. He has finished high school. He lives in Quito, the capital city of the Republic of Ecuador and also the second largest city of the country with more that 2 million citizens between natives and migrants for other cities and countries. Quito has been the meeting point of citizens coming from all provinces, thus creating a very colorful culture. It is embellished by wide streets and building decorated with Avant-guard designs hosting the offices of renowned companies of every line of business. There are churches, museums and parks whose structures enchant its national and international tourists. In the center-north of the city there are entertainment places such as restaurants, art galleries and discos worth a visit. Mario lives in “La Armenias”, a neighborhood located in the Conocoto parish, in the north of the city. Also known as “Modern Quito”, here it is where many companies constituting the economic core of the country have their main headquarters. This is a mainly residential sector, even if in some isolated areas some unfinished buildings can been seen.
Mario runs a locksmith’s shop, an activity he has been engaged in since he was a child, almost 20 years ago, and that he has learned from his parents whom he has always helped. He works here 10 hours a day, offering this service he has succeeded in establishing notwithstanding the lack of working capital. Mario has requested a loan to Fundación Alternativa in order to improve the structure of his shop, as the working area of his shop is not covered and the weather can damage the equipment and materials he uses. He hopes that thanks to this change he will succeed in more easily winning his customers’ trust, thus increasing his income and consequently succeeding in granting a better strand of living both to himself and to his child.

loans.use: To make improvements to his shop.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde es soltera, tiene cinco hijos de los cuales tres son independientes, viven en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones con paredes de adobe y el piso de cemento, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.

Clotilde trabaja como cocinera preparando comida para la venta por más de ocho horas al día en la puerta de su casa ya que no cuenta con un restaurante,  y con lo poco que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar ollas, sillas, mesas, platos, cubiertos, etc., para la implementación de su restaurante.

El sueño de Clotilde es mejorar sus ingresos y construir un restaurante más amplio para acoger más clientela.

Es la sexta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Clotilde is single and has five children three of which are independent.  She lives in her own, two-bedroom house with adobe walls and cement floor located in the city of La Paz’s Alto San Pedro zone.

Clotilde works more than 8 hours daily as a cook preparing food to sell at her doorstep because she does not have a restaurant and with the little she earns she must cover her family’s food and basic utility costs.  

She needs the loan to buy pots, tables, chairs, dishes, cutlery, etc. to set up a restaurant.  Clotilde’s dream is to improve her income and build a spacious restaurant to welcome more customers.  This is her sixth loan request to IMPRO and first to KIVA.

loans.use: to buy pots, chairs, tables, dishes, etc. to equip a restaurant.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 46 year-old a businesswoman.  She is married to Michael, a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been raising pigs for the past seven years, with a monthly income of KES.10,000.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  Jane will use the loan to buy pig feed.  With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 31 years old and a single mother of two. To earn a living, she does dairy farming.  She has been farming for three years and she has employed one person.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned  how to save her money.  
Joan hopes to grow her business in the future.  She has requested 50,000 KES to buy animal feeds and to vaccinate her cows.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds and to vaccinate her cows

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es casado y tiene un hijo; viven en la casa de sus padres, ocupando dos habitaciones con un acabado fino con piso de tablón de madera, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.

Daniel, trabaja como chofer por más de ocho horas al día, su esposa vende comida en el mismo domicilio y con lo poco que ganan, ambos aportan para cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar  llantas, batería y para el arreglo de caja de su movilidad ya que es su única fuente de trabajo para mantener a su familia.

El sueño de Daniel es mejorar sus ingresos y adquirir una casa en anticrético para dar más comodidad a su familia.

Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Daniel is married and has a son.  They live in his parents’ house occupying two bedrooms with quality finishing and hardwood floors; the house is located in the city of La Paz’s San Pedro zone.

Daniel works as a driver for more than 8 hours daily.  His wife sells food at home and with the little they earn are able to cover food and basic utility costs for their family.  He needs the loan to buy tires and a battery and to repair his car’s gear box since it’s his only source of employment to support his family.  

Daniel’s dream is to improve his income to buy a house under the ‘anticrético’ [transaction not whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] modality to provide more comfort for his family.  This is the second loan request to IMPRO and first to KIVA.

loans.use: to buy tires, a battery and to repair his taxi's gear box.

loans.name: Chirunga

texts.en:
Chirunga is 32 and lives with his life partner and children in his own home in one of the most populated towns in the coastal region of Kenya. He owns a motorcycle taxi with which he travels the town and the rural areas, transporting passengers to different places. 

Chirunga is a man who is dedicated to his work. For him, only those who fight succeed in winning. His motorcycle needs servicing and repairs in order for him to provide 100% service and not disappoint his clients. That is why he is requesting a loan from Yehu to buy spare parts and do general servicing to his motorcycle and not lose the customers he has. Chirunga hopes that in this way, he will always be able to give his family the support they need.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and do general servicing to his motorcycle

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 32 year-old a busines man.  He is married to Felistus, a businesswoman. They are blessed with two children. He has been selling fruits for the past ten years, with a monthly income of KES.20,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD., after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Stephen will use the loan to buy more pineapples. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more pineapples

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 46 year-old married female from Jarash in Jordan.  She has four children, and requested a 1100 JOD loan to pay for the raw materials she needs to make weaving works.

loans.use: to pay for buying the raw materials for weaving works

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 51 year-old mixed-crop farmer.  She is widowed and has one child. She has been in the farming business for the past five years, with a monthly income of KES.10,500, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her sixth loan with KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Mary will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.  With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her son. Her hopes and dreams are to export the farm produce. Mary has a very good history with KADET LTD.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 31 years old, married, and has two children.  To earn a living, she does poultry farming.  She has been farming for the past six years.  She also grows tea to earn extra income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business because she has been trained in business management skills.
Beth has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to add more chickens and chick's mash.

loans.use: To add more chickens and chick's mash

loans.name: Thol

texts.en: Thol is 60 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $2 daily. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $3 each day. In order to improve her family’s living condition, Thol is requesting a loan of $650 to purchase piglets to breed and resell whey they gain weight. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her piggery and build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed and resell when they gain weight

loans.name: Laila

texts.en: Laila is a 44 year old married woman who has 7 family members and is from Madaba Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to buy materials for making pastries to resell in the area. She would like to open a small bakery in the future to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy materials for making pastry

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en: Kwekwe, 32, is a hardworking woman who describes herself as an honest and kind person. She lives with her life partner in the town of Tiribe, which is located on the south coast of Kenya. Kwekwe has been selling mats at the market for over ten years – a business that has enabled her to educate her children and help her husband cover the household expenses. Demand for more products has risen but Kwekwe is financially challenged. This is why she is asking Kiva through Yehu for a 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan: half of it to add stock of mats for sale and the other half to pay school fees for her Form 3 son.

loans.use: to add stock of mats and pay school fees.

loans.name: Leakena

texts.en: Leakena is 27 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in weaving for more than three years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $3 each day. Leakena is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase silk thread to use for weaving. This purchase will help her improve her business and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Additionally, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase silk thread to use for weaving

loans.name: Ngome

texts.en:
Ngome is 31 years old, married, and has three children. His business is selling vegetables at a stall in his town, which he has done for three years. At the moment, he wants to maintain a profitable business so that he can sustain his family. Ngome has been very productive thanks to his responsibility and the support provided by Yehu.


He is requesting a loan in order to buy produce such as kales, cabbages, tomatoes, onions, bananas, potatoes, and other items.

loans.use: to buy produce such as kales, cabbages, tomatoes, onions, bananas, potatoes, and other items.

loans.name: Nazrana's Group

texts.en: Nazrana is 46 years old, and a hard-working and responsible housewife. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband, 2 sons and daughter. Her husband is an auto mechanic and has been running his own mechanic shop since 2000. Nazrana's son helps his father in the shop as well. Nazrana's husband wants to purchase some materials like spare parts, engine oil etc. For that his wife, Nazrana, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. With the profit she promises to pay back the loan amount and will invest some money in renovating her house. She dreams of a better future for her children and of her family's good health. Nazrana also hopes that her husband's business will grow more in the future, InshAllah.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her husband's mechanic shop.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: Yorn is 49 years old. She is married and resides with a daughter in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in weaving for more than five years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband (who joins her in the picture) is a taxi driver who earns about $5 each day. Her daughter is employed in a garment factory and earns $3 per day. Because their present taxi is old, Yorn is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a new taxi for her husband. This purchase will help her husband attract more customers and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her weaving business and build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase a new taxi for her husband so he can run a taxi service

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes has been running a green grocer business in an open air market for the past seven years. Her monthly income has increased and this has enabled her to provide the basic needs for her family. Her profit is KES. 15,000. She is applying for her sixth loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. 

Agnes will use the loan to buy assorted vegetables and fruit from farmers and then sell them to her customers who are mostly the residents of Thika town. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hope is to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy assorted vegetables and fruit from farmers

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en: Ismael was a fisherman before deciding to buy a motorcycle to start serving the community with transport services. Thanks to his fishing he was able to save capital for his current business. He has been in this business for the last five years. Ismael is married and lives together with his life companion and their two young children. The place where he operates his motorcycle taxi is not secure and he is always cautious as to who he transports, where, and at what times. His aim is to educate his children and prepare them to have a better future. With the requested loan, he will be able to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 50 years old and a dairy farmer.  He is married to Ann, a business lady. They are blessed with three children. 

Joseph has been in the dairy farming business for the past 12 years, with the monthly income of KES 15,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Joseph will use the loan to buy animal feeds. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for his dairy farm.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.es:
Merlita, de 38 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, segura de sí misma y muy trabajadora, Es conviviente con Jorge quien es el padre de sus dos hijos de 19 y 11 años de edad respectivamente.  Vive en compañía de su pareja y sus  hijos a los que adora y son el motivo principal para que ella busque mejorar su calidad de vida, habita su casa propia, la cual logró construir con su cónyuge gracias a mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Merlita es la venta de abarrotes en general, para lo cual cuenta con una pequeña bodega que logró acondicionar en su propia casa. Ofrece a la venta diversos productos de consumo diario como arroz, azúcar, pan, leche, huevos, aceite, verduras y otros. Se inició en esta actividad debido a la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos económicos y también por  que en su zona no había ninguna tienda que ofrezca este servicio. Lleva 2 años cumpliendo esta función y lo hace con la ayuda de sus hijos, complementa esta labor con otra faena relacionada con la carpintería, desarrolla este trabajo en el taller de otra persona y ha observado que es una actividad muy rentable por lo cual quiere dedicarse a este negocio completamente porque considera que ya tiene los conocimientos básicos para emprender esta nueva etapa.
Le gusta su actividad  porque puede estar en su casa el tiempo necesario para cumplir con las funciones que requiere la crianza de sus hijos sin descuidar sus actividades laborales, también le gusta el ingreso económico que le genera su trabajo con el cual poder apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar. En ese sentido, tiene planes de incrementar el stock de los productos en su tienda y diversificar su variedad para así tener más acogida entre sus clientes además desea comprar poco a poco algunas herramientas usadas para las labores de carpintería. Este es el crédito número 9 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de forma puntual, del mismo modo se siente muy tranquila y respaldada por los integrantes de su banco comunal.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará  cinceles, brochas, lijas, cinta métrica, lápiz de carpintería y algunas otras piezas usadas en su trabajo. Además comprará mayor variedad de abarrotes como conservas, leches en polvo, aceites, arroz, etc.
texts.en:
Merlita is 38 years old.  She is a hard-working, self-assured, entrepreneurial woman.  She lives with Jorge, who is the father of her two children, ages 19 and 11.  She lives with her husband and her children, whom she adores and who are the main reason she is working to improve her quality of life.  
She lives in her own home, which, with hard work, she managed to build with her husband.  

Merlita makes a living selling groceries.  She has a small store which she fashioned inside her own home.  She sells a variety of consumer goods such as rice, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, oil, vegetables, etc.  She started this business out of the need to generate her own income and also to fill a need in her neighborhood, where there was no store that offered this service.  She has been running this business for two years with the help of her children.  

She complements this work with carpentry.  She developed this skill in the workshop of an acquaintance and noticed that this field is very profitable, so she would like to dedicate herself to this career completely because she feels she already has the basic knowlege to take it to the next level.  She likes this work because  she can be in her house during the time necessary to care for her children without neglecting her work duties.  She also likes the income that her job generates because she can support her spouse with the household expenses.  She has plans to increase the stock and variety of products in her store so her can please her customers.  In addition, she would like to buy second-hand tools so she can work as a carpenter.  

This is loan number 9 with MFP.  She is very grateful to those who make access to this financing possible, since she feels more secure in advancing her career.  She also will complete her payment on time and she feels very comfortable and supported by the members of her communal bank.  With the amount requested (1500 nuevos soles), she will buy chisels, brushes, sandpaper, a tape measure, a carpenter's pencil and other items used in her job.  She will also buy a greater variety of groceries such as preserves, powdered milk, oils, rice, etc.

loans.use: to buy chisels, brushes, sandpaper, measuring tape, pencils, as well as preserves, powdered milk, oils, and rice for her store.

loans.name: Giovanni Dario

texts.es: Giovanni de 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa, ambos son personas muy llenas de sueños e ilusiones por lo que su prioridad es encontrar estabilidad económica aceptable. Giovanni se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino y cerdos, así mismo para obtener ganancias extras trabaja como jornalero para otras personas sembrando granos básicos. Giovanni solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar alimentos especiales para cerdos, así mismo vitaminas para estos y para las vacas, para Giovanni el bienestar de su ganado es muy importante ya que de esto dependen sus ganancias, razón principal por la que solicita este préstamo y así mantener la calidad de sus productos, lo cual sea de mucho beneficio para su hogar.
texts.en:
Giovanni is 25 years old and lives with his wife. Both of them have many dreams and aspirations, so their priority is to have an acceptable level of financial stability.

Giovanni raises cattle and pigs. At the same time, he earns extra income by working side jobs as a farm laborer for other people who grow basic grains. He is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can buy special feed for his pigs. In addition, he will buy vitamins for both the pigs and the cows. The welfare of his livestock is very important to Giovanni since his income is dependent on them.

The main reason he is requesting this loan is so that he can maintain the quality of his animals, which will result in great benefit for his household.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
For cultural reasons Hanan prefers that her photo not be on the Internet.  Thus the above photo is of her husband. 

Hanan is a 42-year-old married woman who supports five family members.  She is from Ashrafia, Amman Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of JD 500 to pay for home improvements.  She wants to do maintenance and repainting to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay laborers to clear her land.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a 46-year-old married man, the father of three children.

He has owned a general store since 2007, with 14 years of experience in this field. His store is well known in the region, because of his good quality products and special prices.

He sells home appliances and groceries.   Moustafa is a loyal borrower from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, for seven consecutive cycles. He says that all of his previous loans were invested in increasing his business capital through adding new requested products, to please his customers as much as he can to acquire their loyalty.

Today Moustafa is applying for a loan to pay his children's tuition fees, in addition to buying diesel oil for the winter season for heating.  It's too cold where he lives and works, and he has to be ready.

Moustafa is planning to add plastic products  and bicycle sales soon.

loans.use: To pay his children's tuition fees and buy diesel oil for the winter season

loans.name: Santa Inés Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama  “Santa Inés” están en el  Cuarto Ciclo  con   20  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas y cuentan que gracias a su comité están saliendo adelante y se ayudan las unas a las otras.
Antonia es la presidenta y cuenta que siempre trata de incentivar a sus compañeras a que sigan con sus sueños, ya que por medio del trabajo se pueden hacer reales. Antonia vende todo tipo de prendas y es gracias a su trabajo que puede ayudar a su familia y a la vez ella poder sentirse útil, y aportar con su familia.
Antonia pide el préstamo para la compra de prendas de verano, ya que se acerca el calor y quiere tener una buena variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group “Santa Inés” lives in Cuarto Ciclo  and has 20  members.  The group stands out in the neighborhood due to the solidarity and sense of responsibility among its members and the fact that they look out for one another as they move forward.

Antonia is the president and she tells us that she always tries to give incentives to her members to continue reaching for their dreams, since through hard work they can make them a reality.  Antonia sells all types of clothing and is grateful for her job because she can help her family and at the same time feel useful to them.  Antonia is asking for this loan in order to buy summer clothing, as it is starting to get hot and she wants to have a nice variety of clothing to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy summer clothes for resale.

loans.name: Perla Del Norte Group

texts.es:
El comité Perla del Norte se encuentra con doce integrantes  en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad a la cual se dedican,  las inspira las ganas de seguir luchando por sus familias, el trabajo en equipo y utilizando todos sus recursos disponibles hace que sus luchas su mayor fortaleza.
Una de estas mujeres es Julia, quien comenta que se dedica a la venta de comestibles, gracias a la buena comida que hace ya se hizo de buena clientela que siempre compra de ella sus comidas, y de esa forma está saliendo adelante. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando, y el día de mañana poder tener un gran copetín donde poder a la vez dar trabajo a las demás personas.
Solicita este préstamo para comprar insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus alimentos, como ser verduras, condimentos, carnes, etc. El grupo está contento por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The committee of “Perla del Norte” is made up of 12 members, all whom have small businesses.  They are inspired by a desire to keep working for their families’ sake.  Their working as a team and using all the resources at their disposal makes their efforts very effective.

Julia is one of the women.  She says that she sells food and has many customers thanks to the good food she makes.  She gets ahead this way.  Her goal is to continue to work and create a large business so that she can create jobs for others.

She is asking for this loan to buy ingredients such as vegetables, condiments, meats, etc.  This group is counting on the opportunity it has.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah is 41 years old. A mixed crop farmer, he is married to Leah, a business lady. They are blessed with three children. He has been in the farming business for the past four years with a monthly income of 10,500 Kenyan shillings which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his third loan term with KADET Ltd after repaying the previous loans successfully. Jeremiah will use this loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to export his farm produce.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Orville

texts.en: Orville is 60 years old, married and has a 16-year-old child. He has been farming for over ten years. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business because he has been trained on business management skills. He hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future. Orville has requested a loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings to add chicks.

loans.use: to add chicks

loans.name: Kadide

texts.en: Kadide is a divorced woman who has operated a vegetable stall selling in her neighborhood for the last nine months. She is a dedicated woman despite the various adversities she is passing through. Kadide is currently financially challenged because she has no other support. After being introduced to Yehu by a colleague, she decided to visit Yehu offices with the aim of securing loans to boost her business. With this loan, she plans to add stock of various fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to add stock of various fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Nova

texts.en:
Nova, 28 years old, is one of several TLM clients who were funded by Kiva lenders in February, 2011. She received a loan of 5,000,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) that was spent on more beauty salon products and equipment. With the additional products and equipment, Nova was able to improve the services provided to her customers and generate more income from the business. She was able to help her parents meet their daily needs and cover her siblings' educational costs. In June, 2011, Nova was able to fully repay the loan. She also utilized some of the profit from her salon business to initiate a kiosk business.

Nova is now planning to improve her services by providing more wedding gowns to lease out as well as adding more stock to her kiosk business, e.g., mobile phone recharges, cigarettes, snacks, beverages, candy, etc. To do so, she is requesting a loan of 10,000,000 IDR from TLM.

loans.use: by providing more wedding gowns to lease out as well as adding more stock for her kiosk business

loans.name: Otniel

texts.en:
Otniel is a 43-year-old man who is married to Margarita, a 33-year-old lady. They have four children: Fernike, 12, attending first grade of junior high school; Kevin, 9, attending fourth grade of elementary school; Britania, 6, attending first grade of elementary school; and Susan, 4.

Besides working as a teacher, Otniel also spends his time after work cultivating land in order to generate more income for his family. He plants tomatoes, chili and onion. His wife assists him in cultivating the plants and sells them at the market. Otniel is sure that the more vegetables he plants, then the more income that he could generate. Unfortunately, he has very limited capital to do so. This situation led him to request a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 7,500,000. Otniel would like to spend the loan on various vegetable seeds and fertilizer. Otniel really hopes that he could improve the business through this loan assistance.

loans.use: to buy various vegetable seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Dy's Group

texts.en:
Dy, age 52, is the widowed mother of four children. To make a living, she has farmed rice on two hectares of farmland for ten years and supplements this income by selling various kinds of fruit. Her business earns her approximately 60,000 riels (KHR) per day and she manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Lacking water supply to support her paddy is still her main challenge. 

This is the first microloan for Dy’s group with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She is now leading her group of two to ask for a loan with VisionFund of 200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. Dy hopes this loan will enable her farmland to become more productive and profitable, so she can sell her crop for a good price in order to make good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap is 37 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) is a construction worker who earns about $4 each day. One of her children is also a construction worker who earns about $4 per day. 

Sopheap is requesting a loan of $800 to pay for an electricity connection, which will give her access to electricity. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree. She hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay for an electricity connection

loans.name: Kanga

texts.en: Kanga is an enterprising woman who makes a living selling dumplings. She is a very hard-working and responsible married woman. At present, she has acquired experience in her business because it is her means of work. She has a great variety of clients that come to ask for her products.  Kanga asks for this loan to buy ingredients like wheat flour, baking powder, and cooking oil.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is applying for her second loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully.  She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her farm.   

With the anticipated profit from the business, Jane will educate her children. She hopes to start farming in large scale and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es: Mercedes del Socorro de  45 anos de edad, casada  con dos hijos en las edades comprendidas de 24, 26 anos de edad independiente económicamente. Originaria de la localidad de Chinandega. Ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general nueva y usada, material reciclado como ropa calzado. Cuenta con una experiencia de 15 anos en la cual ha demostrado ser buena paga en tiempo y forma. El negocio lo distribuye de forma ambulante  a clientes fijos y eventuales. La rutina diaria de Mercedes es de 10 horas diarias desde la 8: 00 am hasta 6: pm. El negocio lo inicio como una forma de sobrevivir ya que en ese momento el esposo y ella estaban sin trabajo. En la actualidad el negocio ha sido rentable porque le ayuda a solventar muchos gastos del hogar además la carga familiar es mas leve porque sus hijos trabajan. Agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos  recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Mercedes del Socorro is 45 years old, married and has two children who are 24 and 26 years old and economically independent. She is from the city of Chinandega. 

She sells merchandise, generally new and used, and recycled material like clothes and shoes. She has an experience of 15 years in which she proved to be a good payer in a timely manner. She distributes the merchandise as a street peddler to permanent and temporary clients. Mercedes’ daily routine is 10 hours a day, from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.

She started the business as a way to survive because at that moment her husband and her didn’t have a job. Today, the business is profitable because it helps to cover many of the household expenses. Also, the family burden is lighter because their children work. 

She is grateful for the help provided by Kiva lenders to people with limited resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a decent way to work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to buy new and used merchandise, recycled material like clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa produce kenkey for sale at Eguafo.  In the photo she is mixing the dough she uses in preparing the kenkey. 

Adjoa is married and has 5 children.  She is responsible for caring for her children.  She has been selling kenkey since 15 years. She will use her loan to buy  bags of maize for the preparation of the kenkey to sell.  She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy maize to make kenkey for sale

loans.name: Samai

texts.en:
Shown in the picture, Samai is a 62-year-old married woman residing in a rural area in theThmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Her family is a big family which in total has eleven members. Samai has nine children, two (daughters) of whom are dependent on her and still of school-age. 

To support the family, Samai and husband plant vegetables such as cauliflower and garlic.  Having been in the current business for thirty years, Samai earns around 53,000 KHR per day, but the daily expenses for the family is quite big so there’s approximately 16,000 KHR left for her savings. Samai has been with VisionFund for four cycles already, with which she succeeded in securing food needed in her family. 

Samai is in need of money to purchase seeds and fertilizers in order to smoothly operate her field of business. Thus, she is applying for a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR. She highly believes that this fifth loan will help her, even better than the four previous ones, to receive good yields so that she can gain more income to improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Edith Marlene

texts.es: Edith, tiene 45 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos, es madre soltera y vive en una aldea del municipio de Trinidad, Santa Bárbara junto a sus hijos y dos nietos. Ella realiza su propia actividad económica para la manutención de su familia. hace 11 años estableció una pulpería donde vende productos de consumo diario como azúcar, arroz, manteca, jabón, leche, quesos, condimentos, churros, productos de limpieza, etc. el préstamo solicitado es el segundo ciclo y es por 10,000 Lempiras, con el cual va surtir de productos alimenticios, mejorando así sus ventas y sus ingresos. Su meta es crecer con el negocio para poder ayudar a sus hijos con el estudio y tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Edith is 45 years old and has five children. She is a single mother and lives in a neighborhood in the town of Trinidad, Santa Bárbara, with her children and two grandchildren.

Edith has her own business by which she is able to support her family. Eleven years ago, she established a grocery store where she sells everyday consumer products such as sugar, rice, lard, soap, milk, cheese, condiments, chips, cleaning products, and other items.

This is her second loan and she is requesting 10,000 HNL so that she can restock her store with food products. This will improve her sales and her earnings. Her goals are to grow her business so that she can help her children with their studies and to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cleaning products, milk, basic grains, medicines, flour, condiments, and other consumer products.

loans.name: Mudassar's Group

texts.en:
Mudassar is a 41-year-old woman who is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, 3 daughters and 2 sons. Her husband has a private job and one son works in a mobile shop.

Mudassar is a very hardworking and independent woman. By stitching clothes, she helps her husband meet the family needs and her children's education expenses. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past four years, and her clients always appreciate her work.

Mudassar, as a member of this eight-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a good quality tailoring machine so that she can work more efficiently. With the profit amount she will open her new tailoring shop in a market so that she can increase her customers. She wants to open a new mobile shop for her son in future as well.

Best wishes to Brac and Kiva from her.

Note: In the picture Mudassar holding a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married and has two young children. She has a small grocery store located in her house. She started her business to have a way to meet the household expenses when her husband was out of work. Now it's going well thanks to her entrepreneurship, hard work and tenacity, and also thanks to the support that Yehu has given her via the loans.

On this occasion Samu is asking for a loan to buy products like detergents, flour, rice, sugar, beans, bread, milk, eggs and other things. This way she is sure to increase her monthly income.

loans.use: buy home products to resell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 50 years old, married and blessed with three children.  She has been farming for 13 years.  She does livestock farming, rearing poultry, dairy cows and pigs.  She has improved her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained on business management skills.

Margaret hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future.  She has requested for 20,000 KES to buy chicks and chicks mash.

loans.use: buy chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: El Poder Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL PODER”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ivonne Milagros ella es casada y tiene 38 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como lápiz labiales,perfumes y cremas,la socia vende en forma independiente lelvando a los diferentes lugares como instituciones, a sus amigas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,ella es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora,el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar donde pueda vender regalos y productos de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas y lápiz labiales. 
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de internet, negocio de publicidad, negocio de venta de ropa y negocio de venta de medicamentos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
They are members of the “EL PODER” communal bank, located in the Cusco district, province, and department.

Ivonne Milagros is 38 years old, married, and has three children.  She sells beauty products, such as lipsticks, perfumes, and creams.  She sells on her own, travelling to different places, such as installations; to her friends.  She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm and wants to get her children ahead through this business.  She’s been doing this for five years and things are going well for her.  She is very hardworking and enterprising.  Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell gifts and beauty products.  She is asking for this loan to buy beauty products such as perfumes, creams, and lipsticks.  The other members have other businesses such as internet service, publicity, clothing sales, and medication sales.

She appreciates those who form part of her dream this way and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Sokheang's Group

texts.en:
Sokheang is aged 42 years and married. She has one dependent child. Her family lives in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. For her children's sake, she grows rice and corn with husband's help. To add more income, her husband works for others for a fee to support the household.  Sokheang has been with this business for twenty years. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. Drought is the main challenge for her paddy field. 

Sokheang’s group consists of two members who have been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle.  Sokheang fully repaid her previous loan which has helped her to better support her family with sufficient food. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan. Sokheang, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy insecticides for protecting her corn field. She hopes this loan will enable her to get a high crop yield so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy insecticides for her rice paddy

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy beads and thread for her embroidery business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 29 years old and single. To earn a living, he has a bicycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money. He has also improved his business because he has been trained on business management skills. Peter hopes to become more financially stable in the future. He has requested 90,000 KES to buy a motorbike and helmet.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike and helmet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice in bulk

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is a devoted mother. She is 59 years old now but still earning income for her family. She has two children. She is running a talipapa (vegetable stall) next to her house. She usually acquires PHP 3,500 each month and would like to offer more vegetables to meet all her customers' demands. She is asking for PHP 7,000 to invest in buying bananas, cabbages, eggplant and beans to sell. Corazon's main concern is not only to generate a good income, but also to extend good products with friendly service to her customers. This way, Corazon will increase profits too.

loans.use: to buy bananas, cabbages, eggplant and beans to sell

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en: Marlene is a responsible wife of Benigno. She is 48 years old and has six children. Two of her children are attending school and have a need for daily allowances and matriculation fees. The family's source of income comes from the small bakery, which they have operated for 10 years now. Marlene also pays for a baker who helps them make cookies and breads to sell. Now, she would like to increase their production but has insufficient funds. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy flour, sugar, margarine and soft drinks for the bakery. In the future, Marlene would like to sell continuously, thus developing her business so they can save funds for the education and emergency expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, margarine and soft drinks for the bakery

loans.name: Bora

texts.en:
Bora is an entrepreneur who has created his own work to help his family progress and give his children the best. He has been an active client of Yehu. He is originally from the town of Tiribe, and has been married for over ten years. He and his wife have two children together.

Bora began a small store in his home fifteen years ago. His wife worked at the store while he was out on official business, and now his entire family is working there.

With this loan, Bora will buy bulk merchandise, including soft drinks, flour, cooking fat, beans, and rice. Purchasing these items will improve the store's inventory.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, flour, cooking fat, beans, and rice.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: El señor Humberto tiene 32 años de edad estado civil soltero actualmente vive conjuntamente con sus padres, pero económicamente es independiente, se dedica a la actividad agrícola en terreno de 2 Has que es herencia de sus padres produce papa, papaliza, haba, con rotación de cultivos tiene mucha experiencia en el rubro, la comunidad de 1er toncoli está a 51 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, Humberto nos comenta que necesita dinero de urgencia para comprar semilla de papa, abono orgánico que su terreno está preparado ya para la siembra de esta campaña agrícola así garantizar la seguridad alimentaria, el ahorro que tenía gastos en la construcción de su vivienda, Humberto es una persona emprendedor y su sueño era tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Humberto is 32 years old, single and currently lives with his parents, but economically he is independent.  He earns a living farming two hectares of land, which is his inheritance from his parents.  He produces potatoes, olluco [a type of tuber] and broad beans, with crop rotation.  He has a lot of experience in this field.  The community of First Toncoli is 51 km from the city of Cochabamba. 

Humberto comments that he urgently needs money to buy potato seed and organic fertilizer as his land is already prepared for planting for this season.  This will ensure that they have enough to eat.  

The savings he had was spent on the construction of his house.  Humberto is an entrepreneurial person and his dream is to have his own home.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and potato seed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy decorations for his business.

loans.name: Chert's Group

texts.en:
Chert is a resident of a rural village in the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She is a 33-year-old mother of one dependent son. To support her family, she has farmed rice on a four-hectare area of farmland, and raising cows in a local area. She has engaged in this business for 11 years. The current business earns her around 30,000KHR per day and she manages to save about 10,000KHR each day. Low crop yield from drought is the main challenge for her paddy field.

Chert's group composes of two female members, and she has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles already. The past loan, which she fully paid back, has relieved her family’s financial burden. Now she and her group member are seeking a loan with VisionFund. As a group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland, and use a portion of it to pay for gasoline fees to pump the water. She expects that this loan will enable her family to generate more income from her paddy field business so to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Bom's Group

texts.en:
Bom is 48 years old and married with four children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She lives in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.  

To support the family, she has been involved in rice farming on three hectares of farmland for 20 years and cassava planting on one hectare of farmland. The current business earns her about KHR 45,000 per day, and she manages to save about KHR 20,000 each day after daily expenses. 

Bom has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle and completely repaid the loan, while the other is just with VisionFund this cycle. She has smartly used the first loan to better support her current business. 

Now she and her group member are applying for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the leader, Bom will use her portion to buy fertilizer and insecticides for her farmland. 

She hopes this loan will enable her crop yield to become more productive so she can sell it for a good price and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Tency

texts.es:
Tency inicio su negcoio hace varios años a raíz de que su ex-suegra le enseñara como preparar el producto el coco y como necesitaban un sustento para su familia decidieron poner un negocio el cual lo realiza con sus hijos. Prepara el coco rayado y lo pone a cocinar con los espacios, y sale a vender cocada con sus hijos. Unas de sus grandes dificultades por lo general es el capital para poder producir más y entregar a tiempo el producto. Tency está separada hace varios años sus hijos todos son mayores de edad. Con el prestamo qiere comprar cocos para hacer mas dulces para la venta. 
Unas de sus metas es que con la Bendición de Dios es poder seguir adelante con sub familia y continuar con el negocio e ir creciendo.
texts.en:
Tency started this business several years ago because her ex-mother-in-law showed her how to prepare her product, coconut, and because they needed a way to support the family, so they decided to set up a business.  She runs it with her children’s help.

She prepares the grated coconut, cooks it with spices, and goes out to sell coconut candy with her children.  Her greatest difficulties is not having capital and delivering the product on time.  Tency has been separated for several years and all her children are fully grown.  She will use the money from this loan to buy coconuts to make candy for sale.  One of her goals, with God’s blessing, is to move ahead with her family and for her business to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy coconuts.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Kong, age 44, is a farmer living in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has seven children, three of whom are still in school and dependent on her. She has been involved in farming rice on a two-hectare of farmland for ten years, and has been supplementing her income by raising pigs.

Kong took out a loan previously from VisionFund, and has fully paid back the loan. The past loan enabled her to support her family, helping her purchase food. She can currently earn about KHR 50,000 per day, and manages to save about KHR 30,000 daily after setting aside funds for future daily expenses. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Kong will use her portion of the loan to buy more piglets to raise. She hopes this loan will help her to fatten her pigs. This will increase her income, allowing her to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama  is married and has eight children.  Ama sells palm oil and kenkey at Eguafo, for the past 10 years now. Her husband is a carpenter. Ama uses her income to assist her husband in the upkeep of their home. 

Ama will use the loan to purchase bags of maize to produce her kenkey for sale. With the new profits, Ama plans to expand her business

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize to produce her kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe has all the reasons to rejoice because of the continual support she is receiving from both Yehu and Kiva. With the previous loan, she was able to add stocks of potatoes. 

She is taking out a new loan in the amount of KES 10,000 to expand on her existing business. She will buy sacks of sweet potatoes. This is the foodstuff most liked by many people in her neighborhood.  

She likes seeing her business flourish all the time.

loans.use: To buy sacks of sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch, 54, lives in a rural village of Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is married and has six children; only three of whom are dependent on her and help the family’s business. To support the family, she has been rice farming on seven hectares of farmland and complements the income by growing sesame. Engaging in this business for 14 years, she is able to earn about 50,000KHR per day and save about 20,000KHR. Drought is the main challenge for her paddy business.

Touch has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle already and she completely repaid the loan. She has used the past loan wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. She is now requesting a new loan with VisionFund. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy gasoline for pumping water. She hopes this loan will enable her to get a high crop yield to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy beauty items for her beauty parlor business.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Ra is a 36-year-old farmer who lives in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has three dependent children, one of whom is still in school while the remaining two help the family’s business. 

To make a living, she has been farming rice for 16 years and growing cassava. She is able to earn about KHR 25,000 per day and manages to save about KHR 5,000 each day after daily expenses. The low price of cassava production is the main challenge for her business. 

Ra received the first loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, a cycle ago, while the other member of her group is in the first cycle with VisionFund. Ra fully paid back the past loan, which has improved her living condition. 

Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan of KHR 600,000 each. Ra will use her portion to buy fertilizer and cassava seeds for her cassava business. She hopes to get a high crop yield so as to sell it for a high price to make a better living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and cassava seeds for her cassava business.

loans.name: Cesia Raquel

texts.es: Cesia de 35 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora con muchos deseos de salir adelante, ella vive junto a sus padres y su pequeño hijo de 5 años de edad, por quien lucha día tras día para darle lo mejor. Cesia se dedica a la elaboración de tamales los cuales comercializa en su casa de habitación, esta actividad la realiza cada fin de semana, así mismo trabaja en la siembra de maíz y maicillo, lo que realiza con la ayuda de su padre. Cesia solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para pagar un transporte que lleve los granos básicos de su parcela hasta su casa donde comercializará sus productos, así mismo desea invertir en la compra de maíz y maicillo para aumentar la cantidad de siembra. Con esto Cesia podrá mejorar la estabilidad de su hogar y brindará un mejor futuro a su hija.
texts.en:
Cesia, age 35, is a hardworking woman who has plenty of drive to succeed. She lives with her parents and her five-year-old child for whom she strives each day to provide the best.

Cesia prepares tamales and sells them from her home on the weekends. At the same time, she grows corn and sorghum with the help of her father. Cesia is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she will have the necessary funds to pay for the transport of basic grains from her parcel of land to her house where she sells them. At the same time, she will buy corn and sorghum so that she can increase her level of planting. Through these efforts, Cesia can improve her household stability and provide a better future for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy corn and sorghum for planting and to pay the cost of transporting the harvested grains to her house.

loans.name: Ana Lidia

texts.es: Ana Lidia tiene 48 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos, es madre soltera y vive en una Colonia periférica de San Pedro Sula. Doña Ana Lidia tiene 5 años de haber establecido su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz, ya tiene buena clientela en su colonia. Ella ha solicitado un préstamo a  ODEF por 10,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar insumos para elaborar tortillas como es la harina de maíz y leña para cocinarlas y también va comprar cemento para hacerle piso nuevo a la cocina donde hace las tortillas, pues solucionará el problema que tiene cada vez que llueve se hace lodo y le incomoda trabajar. Ella espera que su negocio crezca y con las ganancias invertirá en la compra de mercadería para obtener otros ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana Lidia is 48 years old and has five children. She is a single mother who lives in a neighborhood on the outskirts of San Pedro Sula. Ana Lidia established her own business making and selling corn tortillas five years ago and now has a good customer base in her neighborhood. 

She has requested a loan from ODEF for 10,000 lempiras with which she will purchase supplies to make tortillas such as corn flour and firewood to cook them. She will also buy cement to put a new floor in the kitchen where she makes her tortillas. This will solve the problem she encounters every time it rains and floor becomes muddy and makes it hard to work. 

She hopes that her business will grow and with her profits she will invest in the purchase of merchandise to obtain more income.

loans.use: to buy corn flour and firewood to make tortillas and to put in a new floor in the kitchen where she makes tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to restock her inventory with food products and to pay the remodeling costs for her store.

loans.name: Reina Esmeralda

texts.es: Reina de 52 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres y su pequeño hijo que se dedica a estudiar. Reina es muy trabajadora y siempre está buscando nuevas opciones para obtener más ganancias y vivir mejor. Ella posee un puesto en el mercado municipal de donde reside en donde vende carne de cerdo, así mismo se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando maíz y frijoles,  un trabajo muy pesado pero que al final brinda grandes beneficios. Reina solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar más carne para comercializar, también para comprar semillas de maíz y frijoles para sembrar. Ella es una mujer muy alegre y responsable que pese a algunas circunstancias trata de ver la vida de forma positiva.
texts.en:
Reina, age 52, lives with her parents and her young son who is in school. She is a very hard worker and is always looking for new opportunities to earn more and live better.

Reina has a stand at the municipal market where she sells pork. She also engages in farming, growing corn and beans. This type of work is very hard, but it results in great benefits in the end. Reina is requesting a loan so that she can buy more meat to sell. She will also buy corn and bean seeds for planting.

Reina is a cheerful and responsible woman. Despite some of the circumstances she has faced, she tries to view life from a positive perspective.

loans.use: to buy seeds (corn and beans) for planting and meat to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité “Kuña Guapa” lleva ese nombre que en guaraní significa mujer trabajadora, ya que todas ellas se esfuerzan y luchan por salir adelante, están en el Tercer ciclo  con  21  integrantes con sus respectivas actividades productivas.
Ramona es peluquera, y comenta que cuando inicio su negocio le fue un poco difícil, pero que luego fue adquiriendo experiencia y gracias a eso, sumado a su buen trabajo se hizo de muy buena clientela, y gracias a esto está saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia. Su meta es poder tener el día de mañana una gran peluquería y seguir ayudando así a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder surtir su negocio con los productos que más necesita para su peluquería, como ser tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, agua oxigenada y demás químicos, etc.
texts.en:
This committee is named “Kuña Guapa”, which means “Working Woman” in the Guaraní language. All of the members strive and struggle to get ahead. They are in their third cycle with 21 members who stay productive by engaging in their respective business activities.

Ramona is a hairdresser. She says that starting her business was a little bit difficult, but later on as she acquired experience, she was able to acquire a good number of clients because of her excellent work. Thanks to her efforts, Ramona has been able to move forward and help her family. Her goal someday is to have a large salon so that she can continue helping her family.

She is requesting a loan so that she can restock her business with products that she needs most for styling hair such as dyes, shampoo, rinses, oxygenated water, chemicals, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoo, rinses, oxygenated water, chemicals, and other supplies.

loans.name: Phoung's Group

texts.en:
Aged 42 years old, Phoung is married with four children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. Her family lives in a rural area of the Pursat province’s Kror Kor district of Cambodia. The main sources of the family’s income are from rice farming and pig raising in the local area while her husband is a taxi driver. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. 

Phoung’s group consists of two members who are first-time borrowers with VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her crop yield to become more productive and profitable so as to sell it for a good price in order to make good living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, a 25-year-old married father of one, earns a living tailoring in an environment conducive to business. Engaged in this enterprise for six years and employing two people to assist him, he also runs a motorcycle transport business to supplement his income. 

Since becoming a client of Faulu Kenya, Joseph has learned how to manage his ventures because he has received training in business management techniques. Now requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy a tailoring machine and fabrics, he dreams of expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine and fabrics.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is single. She has received schooling through junior high school. Maame sells second-hand cloths at Eguafo near Elmina, which she has done for three years. Maame uses her income to take care of herself. Maame will use the loan to purchase more second-hand clothes for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to further her education.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Aleida

texts.es: Aleida, de 34 años, es una mujer alegre, dinámica y emprendedora, esta casada y tiene dos hijos de 11 y 8 años, vive junto a ellos y a su suegro en su casa propia motivo por el cual se esfuerza junto a su esposo día a día para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Aleida consiste en la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos por catálogo entre accesorios y artículos del hogar, tiene un local en la casa de su madre, tiene instalado algunas vitrinas y mostradores en los que exhibe los productos que pone a la venta, comparte dicho local junto a su hermana que se dedica a otro negocio. Lleva realizando esta actividad desde hace 7 y desde que se inició lo ha hecho sola pues considera que así se siente más cómoda. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene disponibilidad para muchas otras actividades además disfruta de tener contacto directo con la gente ya que es una persona muy sociable. Le agrada innovar y ofrecer productos de calidad que se encuentran a la moda según la temporada, es por eso que siempre tiene clientes, espera mas adelante poder poner una boutique propia bien implementada. Este es el préstamo número 5 con MFP, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas mensuales de manera puntual y continuar trabajando con mucha responsabilidad junto a los miembros de su banco comunal. Con el monto solicitado 3500 soles, comprará ropas, zapatos y algunos accesorios para su venta en su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Aleida is a happy, dynamic, and hardworking 34-year-old woman. She is married and has two children who are 11 and 8 years old. She lives with them and her father-in-law in their own home. This is why she and her husband work day to day to give them a better quality of life. 

Aleida's work consists of selling clothing, shoes, and other products through a catalog as well as accessories and household items. She has a storefront at her mother's house and has installed some glass cases and display counters where she shows the products that she has for sale. She shares the storefront with her sister who has a different business. She has had this business for seven years and has been at it alone since she started because she she feels that it is more comfortable that way. The thing she likes about her work is that she has free time for a lot of other activities in addition to the fact that she enjoys having direct contact with people as she is a very sociable person. She enjoys innovating and offering quality products that are in style seasonally. That is why she always has customers. In the future she hopes to be able to start her own, well-appointed boutique.

This is her fifth loan with MFP and she is very grateful for the opportunity offered her through this loan and the financial backing that she needs to get ahead. She is committed to making her monthly payments on time and continuing to work very responsibly together with the members of her communal bank. With the 3,500 PEN she has requested she will buy clothing, shoes, and some accessories to sell in her small business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and some accessories for resale in her small business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 63-year-old married man. He has 7 children whose ages range from 25 years to 37 years. Peter describes himself as a focused man. He operates a grocery store where he sells vegetables and fruits. He has been involved in this business for 10 years, and his store is located within a viable market. His primary customers are local residents. Peter describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for buying vegetables and fruits. He will use the requested KES 20,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits for resale. His goal is to improve his business within 5 years, and in the future, he hopes to buy a kerosene pump so he can start a business selling fuel and kerosene. This loan will be his first SMEP DTM loan.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for resale

loans.name: Roster Kenyi

texts.en:
Roster is a 40-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has five children between the ages of 3 and 14. Four of the children go to school. Roster runs a general store and has been in business for four years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 3,000 SDG to purchase dried fish, sugar, and many other items. In addition to this business, he has no other source of income.

In five years, Roster would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high transportation costs. Roster says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like dried fish, steel wire, sugar etc

loans.name: Chokwe

texts.en:
Chokwe lives in Mariakani, Kenya. He plies the trade of selling branded polythene bags. It is the busiest market in Kenya and has many clients who come to purchase goods. He sells bags to the customers who use them to carry the items they've bought.

Chokwe is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stock of polythene bags. From the additional income, Chokwe hopes to open another business to be run by his wife.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of polythene bags.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline, 30 years old, is married. She has a one-year-old child. Caroline describes herself to be a serious and intelligent woman. She operates a chemist where she sells medicine. Her business is located within a fast growing market and her primary customers are patients from the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient clean water for her patients. She will use the Kes 5,000 loan to buy a water purifier which she will use in her business and with her five family members. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy a water purifier

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty  lives in Kampala and is widowed with six children, only three of them go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling cold drinks and has been in this business for 15 years. She sells to all categories of people, but on retail. She works 5 days out of every week. 

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of soda, boxes of mineral water and passion fruit and oranges for making juice. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to buy a bigger freezer for cooling varieties of juices. 

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda, boxes of mineral water, passion fruit and oranges to make juice

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert used the previous loan to buy fish to sell. He is a 47-year-old married man with six children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after the family, and his dream is to have a sustainable income-generating activity to support his family. 

Robert is a fish vendor and has been in this business for 11 years now. His major challenge is the high license fees, and his dream is to buy a refrigerating van. With the income earned he has been able to pay school fees for his children and set up a business for his wife. Robert intends to use the loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Saul

texts.en: Saul is a 30-year-old married man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has had his retail shop for over two years, which he got from agriculture after selling his cassava, beans and groundnuts from his garden. His main problems are customers not paying on time and inadequate capital. His personal goals are educating his children to a higher level and building a permanent home for them. His business goal is hiring employees to help expand his business. The purpose of the loan is to buy sugar, rice, cassava, flour, soap and books to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, cassava, flour, soap and books to sell

loans.name: Chanda's Group

texts.en:
Chanda is a resident who lives in a rural area of the Prey Chhor District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a 38-year-old mother of five children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She is a rice farmer and supplements the family’s income by raising pigs to make a living. Having been in this business for sixteen years, she is able to earn about KHR 20,000 per day and manages to save about KHR 6,000 each day after offsetting daily expenses. Low crop yield resulting from drought and insects are the main challenges for her rice-paddy.

Chanda’s group consists of two female members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle already. She has wisely and successfully used the first loan to relieve financial family’s burden and support her children’s education. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. Chanda, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy pig feed for her pig business. She hopes this will enable her to fatten her pig to sell it for a good price and improve her living condition.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for her pig business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Bou's Group

texts.en:
Bou is a villager from a rural area of the Kror Kor District of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is 47-year-old mother of seven children, four of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She is a rice farmer who plants rice on 1.5 hectares of farmland. The current business earns her about KHR 28,000 per day and manages her to save about KHR 8,000 each day after daily expenses. Low crop yield resulting from insects is the main challenge for her rice-paddy business.

Bou’s group consists of two members, who are first-time borrowers with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000 each. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees in transplanting rice seedling. Bou hopes her crop yield will become more productive to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Modesto Ramon

texts.es:
Modesto es originario de la comarca Wiscoyol pero actualmente tiene 3 años de vivir en Teustepe es ingeniero agrónomo, se dedica a cultivar cebolla y tomate. Actividad que inicio a la edad de 20 años la cual lo hacía con el papa ya fallecido, hoy en día la realiza  las siembras con ayuda de un hermano, ha logrado comprado sus tierras e implementos agrícolas ya que cuando inicio lo hacía en tierras que alquilaba. La venta de la cebolla lo hace en la misma comunidad.  Su esposa tiene una sencilla tienda donde vender ropa y calzado en Boaco lo cual le ayuda al sustento del hogar. 
Modesto dice que quiere sembrar cebolla para exportación a otros países. Solicita este crédito para comprar un abono, semilla, fertilizantes para el cultivo de la cebolla, él dice que el crédito le será de ayuda ya que podrá comprar el abono y los insumos que necesita ya que en este momento no tiene dinero suficiente para darle un buen mantenimiento al  cultivo. Tiene la expectativa que con la ganancia que saque de la producción de cebolla comprara un pedazo de tierra más para ampliar más el cultivo.
texts.en:
Modesto is originally from the region of Wiscoyol, but he has been living the past three years in Teustepe. He is a farmer who grows onions and tomatoes. Modesto started farming at the age of 20 with his father, who has since passed away. Today he grows his crops with the help of his brother. Modesto was able to purchase land and farming equipment, but when he started out, he would farm on plots of rented land. The onions he produces are sold in the same community. His wife has a nice store in Boaco where she sells clothing and shoes. This helps with sustaining their household.

Modesto says he that he wants to plant onions for export to other countries. He is requesting a loan in order to buy compost, seeds, and fertilizers for his onion crop. Modesto says that the loan will be helpful in buying the supplies that he needs since he does not have enough money at the moment to maintain a good crop. Using the profits that he earns from his onion production, he expects to buy another piece of land so that he can expand his cultivation.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, and fertilizers for his onion crop.

loans.name: Sambou's Group

texts.en:
Sambou is a 33-year-old married mother of four dependent children, some of whom are still in school and some help the family’s business. She is residing in a rural area of the Kror Kor District of Pursat Province, Cambodia. The main source of family’s income is from raising pigs while her husband supplements the income by working for others for a fee. Engaging in this business for several years, they are able to earn about KHR 17,000 per day and manage to save about KHR 7,000 each day after deducting daily expenses. 

Sambou’s group consists of two female members who live in the same village and she is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. She and her group member are applying for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pig feed for her pig business. She hopes this loan will enable her to fatten her pig healthfully to increase more income in order to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for her pig business.

loans.name: Aunty

texts.en: Aunty extracts palm oil for sale in Eguafo. She is married and has three children; her husband is a farmer. Aunty has been selling palm oil for 12 years. She is responsible for assisting her husband to educate their children. Her loan will be used to buy palm fruit and palm kennel to extract for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy palm fruit and palm kennel to extract for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy materials for making baskets.

loans.name: Cecilia Yolanda

texts.es: Cecilia tiene 59 años es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos ya son mayores de edad e independiente.
