Cecilia empezó con el negocio de ventas de ropa pero a veces los clientes no le cancelan a la fecha acordada entonces opto por empezar otro negocio decidió incursionar en las ventas de productos químicos. En la actualidad Cecilia trabaja con una hija vendiendo producto de puerta a puerta se dividen los sectores y caminan mucho para vender su producto solo así pueden obtener resultados positivos en sus ventas de productos quimicos. Con el prestamo quiere comprar productos quimicos para tener una produccion mayor y una mayores ventas. su meta es adecuar un local en casa para exhibir sus productos y no tener que caminar tanto.
texts.en: Cecilia is 59 years old and a single mother.  She has four children who are adults and live independently.  Cecilia started out with a clothing business but sometimes her customers wouldn't pay on time so she decided to start another business selling chemical products.  Cecilia currently works with one of her daughters selling products door to door.  They divide up the neighborhoods and walk a lot to sell their goods.  This is the only way they can obtain positive results in selling their chemical products.  Cecilia would like to use her loan to buy chemical products so that she can increase her production and make more sales.  Her goal is to create a space in her home where she can display her products and therefore not have to walk so much.

loans.use: to buy chemical products

loans.name: Carina Nataly

texts.es: Carina escogió esta actividad venta incienso  por tener salidas al momento de venderlo en las ferias. Su trabajo lo hace sola  en las ferias a veces acompañada de su prima el horario es de 7:00am hasta que se acabe la venta. Unas de sus dificultades  son los ladrones ya que en su sector sufre de robos a diarios. Con el prestamo va a comprar inciensos para vender a mas volumen. Unas de sus aspiraciones es tener una microempresa establecida.
texts.en: Carina's business is selling joss sticks which she goes out to sell in the street markets.  She works alone in the markets but is sometimes accompanied by her cousin.  She works from 7.00am until she runs out of products to sell.  One of the difficulties she faces is thieves because there are daily robberies in her neighborhood.  She will use her loan to buy more joss sticks so that she can sell in greater volumes.  One of her goals is to have an established micro-business.

loans.use: to buy joss sticks

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia, de 41 años, es una mujer muy amable, alegre y trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien es madre de dos hijos de 19 y 15 años, quienes dependen de ellos para su educación y alimentación, vive en la casa de su madre junto a su pareja y sus dos hijos en donde lucha día a día por salir adelante. Alicia trabaja vendiendo carnes rojas. Principalmente ofrece a la venta carne de cerdo y eventualmente carne de res. Consigue diariamente todo su producto del centro de abastecimiento de carnes certificadas para el consumo humano. Tiene su puesto de ventas ubicado en uno de los principales mercados de la ciudad hasta donde traslada las carnes que ha solicitado previamente con un día de anticipación. La demanda por este tipo de carnes es alta lo cual le permite tener siempre buenas ventas diarias aunque algunas veces no consiga vender todo lo que ofrece al culminar el día. Antes de emprender este negocio se dedicaba a vender pescado fresco, sin embargo optó por cambiar de actividad debido a la rentabilidad que observó en el trabajo que ahora tiene y desde entonces han pasado 9 años trabajando sola y todo marcha bien para ella. 
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es el compañerismo que existe entre los comerciantes que trabajan en el mismo rubro que ella, todos se apoyan mutuamente buscando conseguir nuevos clientes. Las ganancias que obtiene por sus ventas le ayudan a solventar los gastos de su hogar y además le permite ahorrar para algunos imprevistos, sin embargo ahora su meta es establecer una tienda de abarrotes en su casa para que atiendan sus hijos y puedan colaborar con ella para generar los recursos económicos. Este es el préstamo número 14 con MFP, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas mensuales de manera puntual y continuar trabajando con mucha responsabilidad junto a los miembros de su banco comunal. 
Con el monto solicitado 4000 soles, mejorará la infraestructura de su puesto de ventas y comprará mayor cantidad de carnes, asimismo comprará algunos abarrotes de primera necesidad para establecer poco a poco su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Alicia, 41, is a very kind, cheerful, hard-working woman who lives with her common-law husband and two children, 19 and 15, who are dependent on them for their education and food.  They live in her mother's house where they work hard every day to get ahead.  Alicia sells red meats, mainly pork and sometimes beef.  Every day she buys all her products at the wholesale market which sells certified meat for human consumption.

Her stall is located in one of the main markets of the city and that is where she takes all the meat ordered the day before.  The demand for this type of meat is high, which means sales are always good.  Sometimes, though, she does not sell everything by the end of the day.  Before setting up this business she sold fresh fish.  She decided to change because she noticed that the business she is in now is more profitable.  For nine years she has been working alone and things are going well.

What she enjoys about her work is the fellowship that exists among the merchants in her same line of business.  They all help each mutually to attract new customers.  The earnings from her sales help cover household expenses and allow her to save for any unexpected expense.  But, now her goal is to open a grocery store in her home for her children to run and help her out by generating extra income.  

This is her 14th loan through MFP and she is very grateful for the loan opportunity and financial backing she needs to get ahead.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time and continue working responsibly with the other members of her communal bank.

The 4,000 PEN will be used to improve her stall's infrastructure and to buy more meat.  She will also buy essential groceries to start setting up her grocery store little by little.

loans.use: To buy wholesale meat and essential groceries.

loans.name: Bonheur Group

texts.fr: La cliente Zuena, membre de l’association de crédit « Bonheur », est un entrepreneur très ambitieux, âgée d’environ 43 ans, non mariée, mère de 3 jeunes enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle installe ses marchandises dans des petits marchés, à son domicile et parfois sur le long de la rue donnant axer aux avenues. Elle commença son business par la vente de poissons (Mikeke) à provenance d’Uvira, et cela, avec son fonds propre reçu de son petit  ami. Alors, plus tard elle bénéficia un fond additionnel de crédit de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 2 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 4 cycles en profitant du programme de microcrédit de l’IMF Hekima. L’insécurité dans l’intérieur de la province constitue une menace pour le développement de ses activités. Ce nouveau prêt doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 50 kg de riz, 50 kg de sucres, poissons, savons, etc., et le reste d’argent sera affecté dans la scolarité des enfants. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir, acheter une maison, une voiture. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions dédiées de pauvres femmes pour leur émancipation économique et financière. Il sied se signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Zuena, a member of the credit group "Bonheur", is a very ambitious entrepreneur. She is around 43 years old, not married and the mother of 3 young children who are all studying. She sells groceries. She displays her merchandise at the small markets, at her home and sometimes on the side of the road leading to the avenues. She started her business with her own funds, received from her boyfriend, and sold fish (Mikeke) coming from Uvira. Later on, she benefited from extra funding in the form of loans from MFI Hekima. She has been in this business for 2 years.

Zuena has just completed 4 loans cycles with the Hekima microfunding program. The insecurity in the province's interior is threatening the development of her business. This new loan should allow her to buy items like 50 kg of rice, 50 kg of sugar, fish and soap, and the rest of the money will be spent on her children's education. She would also like to see her children grow up, and buy a house and a car.

The customer thanks Hekima for its actions helping impoverished women achieve economic and financial emancipation.

Some customers in the picture are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy 50 kg rice, 50 kg sugar, fish, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Mirtha Gladys

texts.es:
Mirtha es una mujer de 52 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su pareja, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos no pudo estudiar la carrera de Enfermería que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su Madre, Mirtha puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y útiles escolares, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien porque cuenta con buenos clientes que siempre gustan de sus servicios.
Mirtha se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, fideos, atún, etc., útiles escolares y un andamio; de esta manera Mirtha tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y acondicionado, con ello espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que poco a poco pueda terminar de construir su vivienda y así en un futuro no muy lejano desea poder iniciar otro negocio.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a 52-year-old woman who lives in the city of Pisco with her partner.  She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to do well in life.  Unfortunately, owing to a lack of financial means and the need to work in order to cover her expenses, Mirtha was unable to study to become a nurse, though she would have loved to have done so.  In her free time, she enjoys taking part in sports and she sometimes cooks a delicious 'duck with rice' to share with her family.

With a lot of determination and commitment, and with the support of her mother, Mirtha set up a small business selling groceries and school supplies.  Every day she starts her work early in the morning.  She can work approximately 12 hours a day and believes that she is doing well in her business because she has good customers who like her services.

Mirtha is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, milk, noodles, tuna, etc.  She will also buy school supplies and a shelving unit.  This will allow Mirtha to keep her business better stocked and equipped.  She hopes, as a result, to increase her sales and her income.  This will be very helpful to her as she will gradually be able to finish building her house and, in the not-too-distant future, she would like to be able to start another business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, milk, noodles, tuna, etc.  She will also buy school supplies and shelving

loans.name: Patricia Angelica

texts.es: Patricia Angélica de  33 años de edad, madre soltera con  3 hijos  menores de edad en edades comprendidas de 9, 8,4, años, Patricia es originaria del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente. Ella tiene por actividad económica  la venta de ropa de segunda mano, y cosméticos, desde hace  6 años el negocio consiste en vender ropa de niño, camisas, pantalones, short, faldas, todo de segunda mano. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, el cual lo inicio como una necesidad de tener un medio de trabajo para sacar a sus hijos adelante como madre  soltera su responsabilidad económica es mayor. Patricia Angélica ya ha trabajado con fundación lo cual ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar paca de ropa de mejor calidad para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y obtener mejores ingresos. Patricia Angélica agradece la ayuda que le brindan  los inversionistas kiva a las personas de escasos recursos y  países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno en piaseis con tanta carencias económica como es Nicaragua.
texts.en: Patricia Angélica is a 33-year-old single mother of three young children, ages 9, 8 and 4. She is originally from the department of Chinandega, which is located in the western zone. She makes a living selling cosmetics and second-hand clothing. For the past six years her business has consisted of selling children's clothing, shirts, pants, shorts and skirts, all used.  She runs the business out of her home and started it as a means to make headway for her children. As a single mother, her financial responsibility is great. Patricia Angélica has already worked with the foundation and has demonstrated the responsibility of making her payments on time. She is requesting this loan to have working capital to purchase high-quality used clothing in order to provide a better service to her customers and have better revenue. Patricia Angélica is grateful for the help provided by Kiva lenders to people of scant resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they have access to dignified work.

loans.use: to purchase high-quality used clothing.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es: Martha tiene 40 años es divorciada y tiene 1 hijo que estudia en un colegio fiscal. Martha empezó su negocio a raíz de que se divorcio ya que no tenia ninguna fuente de ingreso entonces decidió vender ropa y productos Avon. Su trabajo lo hace sola, desde la mañana hasta la tarde trabaja todos los días ella, visita amigas familiares conocidos para ofrecer sus productos. Martha dice que se esfuerza día a día porque tiene una gran responsabilidad que cumplir con su hijo y con su casa. Con el prestamo quiere comprar ropa y articulos de hogar para vender. La meta de Martha es seguir creciendo en su negocio y darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Martha is 40 years old.  She is divorced and has one child who attends a state school.  Martha started her business because when she divorced she didn't have any source of income.  She decided to start selling clothing and Avon products.  She works alone from morning until evening.  She works every day visiting friends, family members and acquaintances, to sell them her products.  Martha says that she works hard every day because she has a great responsibility to fulfill toward her son and her home.  Martha would like to use her loan to buy clothing and household goods to sell.  Her goal is to continue growing in her business and to give her family the best.

loans.use: to buy clothing and household goods

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es: El banco comunal San José esta conformado por 9 integrantes, todas son mujeres entre las edades comprendidas de 30 a 60 anos,  con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad, ella corresponden al municipio del Sauce, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona norte de país. El Sauce se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de leche, cuajada, crema,  por su siembra de maíz, crianza de cerdos. Todas son mujeres trabajadoras, responsable. Maribel es la coordinadora del banco comunal ella se encarga de la responsabilidad de cada uno de los integrantes en cuanto a  los pagos en tiempo y forma. Maribel tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosa de horno, un alimento típico de nuestro país elaborado a base de maíz, cuajada, canela. La rutina de Maribel es levantarse a las 4: am para elaborar las cosa de horno y posteriormente salir a venderla de forma ambulante hasta las  4: 00 pm con una pana sobre su casa bajo el intenso sol del día  a día. El banco comunal San José agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un  medio digno de vida.
texts.en:
The San José community bank has nine members who are all women aged between 30 and 60.  They have 15 children in their care and live in the town of El Sauce, in the north of the country.  El Sauce is known for its milk, curds and cream production, for its corn growing and for its pig raising.  All the members of this group are hard-working and responsible people.

Maribel is the coordinator of the community bank.  She is responsible for ensuring that every member makes her payments on time and in full.  Maribel's business is selling 'cosa de horno' which is a traditional cake made from corn, curds and cinnamon.  Maribel's routine involves getting up at 4.00am to make her 'cosa de horno'.  She then goes out to make her sales as an itinerant street vendor.  She works until 4.00pm, carrying her products in a basket on her head under the intense daily sun.  The San José community bank are grateful for the help that Kiva investors provide to people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua.  It enables them to make a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy corn and curds for making 'cosa de horno'

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es: Hola a todos, desde Perú. Les presento al grupo “Sarita Colonia”, el cual está conformado  por 7 integrantes, que se esfuerzan día a día por salir adelante. Uno de los integrantes es el Sr. Rigoberto  presidente del grupo, de 54 años de edad, casado y con 2 hijos. El Sr. Rigoberto brinda el servicio de alquiler de cabinas de internet que es su única fuente de ingresos para su hogar, por otro lado sus hijos lo apoyan en su negocio y aportan con gastos del hogar. Con el préstamo otorgado hará mantenimiento respectivo a sus computadoras y comprara repuestos para ello, el Sr. Rigoberto desea en un futuro ampliar su negocio y está convencido de alcanzar sus metas. El Sr. Rigoberto y todos los integrantes se encuentran agradecidos por el préstamo brindado y por la confianza puesta en ellos.
texts.en: Greetings from Peru. Allow us to present the "Sarita Colonia" group, which consists of seven members who work hard every day to make headway. One of the members is Rigoberto, the group president. He is 54, married and has two children. He runs an internet cafe, which is the only source of income for his household, although his children support him with the business and help with the bills. With the loan, he will perform maintenance on his computers and purchase parts for them. In the future, Rigoberto hopes to expand his business, and he is convinced he will reach his goal. Rigoberto and all his fellow members are grateful for the loan and for the trust put in them.

loans.use: perform computer maintenance.

loans.name: Pc2 Thieo Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe a était crée depuis le 27/12/2010 et regroupe des femmes issus du même village partageant les mêmes valeurs sociale et s'activant toutes dans le commerce .Adama est née le 31/12/1971 elle est mariée et mère de 5 garçons . Son ainé a 20 ans;elle fait du commerce de lait caillé; elle achète le lait chez les bergers du village et transforme ça en lait caillé quelle met en pot de 1000f qu'elle vent en ville.Avec ses bénéfices, elle renforce ses épargne dans le BV pour pouvoir a la longue avoir son autonomie financière.Elle est a l’extrême droite de la photo et habillé en Wax orange noir.
texts.en:
This group was created on the 27th of December, 2010, and groups together women who come from the same village and share the same social values, and who all work in retail.

Adama was born on the 31st of December 1971, is married and is the mother of 5 boys. Her eldest son is 20 years old. She sells curds; she buys the milk from the shepherds of the village and makes it into curds which she then puts into pots, worth 1000 francs each, and sells in town. She uses her profits to build up her savings in the banc villageois so that she can eventually achieve financial autonomy. She is on the far right of the picture, dressed in orange and black wax print fabric.

loans.use: to buy 2 cases of smoked fish (42 000 francs) and 20 litres of milk (10 000 francs).

loans.name: Marta Daisy

texts.es:
Marta Daisy
2012-280
800.000

 Doña Marta es una mujer de 59 años de edad, muy trabajadora y responsable, es el tercer crédito que solicita a la fundación el cual será para crecimiento de su actividad,  invirtiendo en productos de  catálogo y la confección de ropa de cama, gracias a cursos que llevó en el INA, sus hijas y nieta le ayudan en la venta y pretende mejorar la calidad de los productos que confecciona, con el equipo solicitado. De una excelente conducta de pago y gran dedicación al trabajo que realiza. Tiene un trabajo adicional cuidando 2 niños, demostrando así sus deseos de trabajar y mejorar su calidad de vida. Vive con su hija y nieta y su esposo está en este momento en Aserri, donde vive la familia de él. 

Fundación Mujer ha sido la institución que apoyo a Doña Marta Inicio con un préstamo de C 250.000 para sus ventas, luego se traslada a vivir a Aserri y junto a su esposo emprende el trabajo con 40 gallinas ponedoras pequeñas, ambos cancelados de acuerdo al plan de pagos; por problemas de salud de su esposo deben abandonar la actividad avícola y ahora de regreso en San Rafael  de Alajuela ha retomado su trabajo anterior y desea aprovechar sus conocimientos en costura para elaborar sobrecamas y colchas.  

 	Marta  tiene capacidad de asumir la deuda, ha demostrado una excelente conducta de pago en los créditos anteriores, además va a diversificar su oferta de productos y cuenta con una clientela que le compra sus productos y además su nieta e hija le ayudan a vender en sus respectivos trabajos.

 	Tiene su clientela establecida, ofrece catálogos de moda;  renueva su mercadería en las fechas respectivas. Ha sacado cursos de costura en el INA y desea explotar su conocimiento elaborando ropa de cama y colchas, para lo que requiere dos máquinas para dar un mejor acabado a su mercadería, ya que en este momento cuenta con una máquina prestada, de su nieta. Este es su tercer crédito,  además cuida dos niños en las mañanas y las tardes y fines de semana las dedica a su negocio, por lo que trabajar desde su casa es la mejor opción que tiene para generar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Marta Daisy
2012-280
800.000

Marta, 59, is a very responsible, hard-working woman who is requesting a third loan through the foundation to expand her business.  She will invest in catalogue products and supplies to make bed linens, thanks to a course she took at INA.  Her daughter and granddaughter will help with sales and she plans to improve the quality of the products she sews, with the sewing machines she will buy.  She has an excellent credit record and is very dedicated to the work she does.  She also works as a baby-sitter for two children, demonstrating her desire to work and improve her quality of life.  She lives with her daughter, granddaughter and husband in Aserri, where her husband's family lives.

Fundación Mujer is the institution that supported Marta with an initial loan of 250,000 CRC for sales.  She then moved to Aserri and, together with her husband, started a business with 40 small egg-laying hens   The loan for this has been paid off.  Due to health issues her husband had to quit the chicken business and return to San Rafael de Alajuela in his previous job.  She wants to take advantage of her sewing experience to make bedspreads and other bed linens.

Marta has the capacity to take on the debt and has demonstrated excellent payment conduct with previous loans.  And, she will diversify her products for the fixed customer base she already has.  Her granddaughter and daughter will also help out with sales.
 	
To her fixed clientele she shows fashion catalogues, and renews her merchandise when necessary.  She has studied courses at INA and wants to use her expertise making bed linens and bedspreads.  She needs two sewing machines to give her products a better finish.  For now she is using a machine she borrowed from her granddaughter.  This is her third loan.  She also takes care of children in the morning and afternoon.  On weekends she dedicates time to her business and works from home, since this is the best option for earning an income for her family.

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines, supplies to make bed linens and curtains, and to buy catalogue products.

loans.name: Evelio

texts.es: Evelio de 26 años es hijo de familia actualmente vive con sus padres, trabaja en una maquiladora  de la localidad desde hace casi ocho años. El tiene una meta a largo plazo que es formar su propia familia y lograr una estabilidad económica que le permita brindarla a su familia lo mejor. También tiene una meta a corto plazo que es el brindar a sus papas un lugar digno donde pasar sus últimos días y su prioridad en este momento es Enjarrar y pintar su casa por fuera; solicita el apoyo para poder realizar su proyecto y de esta manera poder brindar a sus padres un hogar cálido. Agradece el apoyo dado para la realización de su proyecto.
texts.en: Evelio is 26 years old and currently lives with his parents.  He has been working at a cross-border assembly plant in his town for almost eight years.  His long-term goal is to form his own family and to achieve financial stability which will allow him to provide his family with the best.  His short-term goal is to provide his mom and dad with a decent place to spend their final days and his priority right now is to plaster and paint the outside of their house.  He is requesting support so that he can carry out this project and thereby provide his parents with a warm home.  He is grateful for the support given to him to carry out this project.

loans.use: to buy plaster and paint

loans.name: Mizeituni Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mamisa, leader de l’association de crédit « MIzeituni », est un entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 39 ans, mère de 6 jeunes enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est vendeuse de sorgho. Son mari est Infirmier vétérinaire. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché communal de Nyabushongo. Elle commença son business par la vente de semoule avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Alors, plus tard elle bénéficia un fond additionnel de crédit de 50$ de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 4 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 8 cycles en profitant du programme de microcrédit de l’IMF Hekima. L’insécurité dans l’intérieur de la province constitue une menace pour le développement de ses activités. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 2 sacs de sorgho et le reste d’argent sera affecté dans la scolarité des enfants. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et acheter une maison. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions dédiées de pauvres femmes pour leur émancipation économique et financière. Il sied se signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Mamisa, the leader of the "Mizeituni"  group, is a dynamic entrepreneur. She is 39 years old and the mother of 6 young children who are all studying. She sells sorghum. Her husband is a veterinary nurse. Mamisa displays her merchandise at the communal market of Nyabushongo. She started her business selling semolina with her own funds, received from her husband. Later on, she benefited from additional funds in the form of a $50 loan from MFI Hekima. She has been in this line of work for 4 years. She has just completed 8 loan cycles with the MFI Hekima microfunding program. The insecurity in the province's interior is threatening the development of her business. This new loan should allow her to buy 2 bags of sorghum and the rest of the money will be spent on her children's education. She would also like to see her children grow up and buy a house.

The customer thanks Hekima for its actions helping impoverished women achieve economic and financial emancipation.

Some customers in the picture are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of sorghum.

loans.name: Cruz De Motupe Group

texts.es:
Santos Marlene, tiene 36 años, es soltera. Ella se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la venta de productos farmaceuticos, en un local ambientado en su domicilio. Inició su negocio con poca mercadería, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha mejorado su negocio y ha logrado colocarse como una de las primeras farmacias de la zona.
Santos Marlene, es socia del grupo "Cruz de Motupe", formado por siete socios, ellos vivene en una zona de condición humilde por lo que para salir adelante ellos deben esforzarse y trabajar mucho.
En la fotografía la ubicamos en la parte central con polo rosado y su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Santos Marlene, 36, is single and has been in business selling pharmaceutical products out of her home for four years.  She started up with only a small amount of merchandise; but with much effort and dedication has improved her business and become one of the leading pharmacies in the area.

Santos Marlene is a member of the "Cruz de Motupe" Group, comprised of seven members.  They live in a humble environment and must work very hard to get ahead.

In the photograph, she is the one in pink, standing with her young daughter.

loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical products to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, de 36 años, es una hombre muy trabajador y responsable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 7 y 2 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y su madre, el se dedica a trabajar para poder brindar el alimento y la educación para sus hijos además de querer darle una mejor calidad de vida a toda su familia. El trabajo de Carlos consiste en el transporte de pasajeros dentro de la ciudad, se levanta muy temprano para salir en busca de sus eventuales clientes que deseen trasladarse de algún lugar hasta otro punto específico de la ciudad. Lleva realizando este trabajo por más de 10 años y este trabajo le dio la oportunidad de crecer junto a su familia poco a poco pero con muchas ilusiones puestas para el futuro. Complementa su labor con la venta de bebidas alcohólicas, gaseosas y gelatinas en su casa, del mismo modo tiene cuartos que ha construido en un espacio de su terreno los cuales pone en alquiler a precios muy cómodos de manera mensual. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene disponibilidad para trasladar a su hijo a su centro educativo, del mismo modo puede movilizar a su familia y realizar otras funciones laborales, espera que mas adelante sus negocios progresen aun mas ya que desea desarrollar otro trabajo que es la crianza de pollos, aunque para ello necesita ahorrar un poco más. Este es el préstamo número 1 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este crédito para continuar con el logro de sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos los integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará alguna cajas de bebidas y con el monto restante refaccionará algunas piezas de su mototaxi y renovará algunas ventanas de los cuartos que alquila.
texts.en: Carlos is 36 years old and is a very hardworking and responsible man. He is married and has two children, ages 7 and 2. He lives in his own home with his wife and her mother. He dedicates himself to his work so he can feed and educate his children, not to mention that he wants to give his whole family a better quality of life. Carlos' work consists of transporting passengers within the city. He gets up very early to go out in search of would-be customers who want to go from one place to another in the city. He has done this job for more than 10 years, and it has given him the opportunity to grow little by little along with his family, but he has bigger dreams for the future. In addition to this work, he also sells alcoholic beverages, soft drinks and gelatins from his home. In the same vein, he built rooms on some space on his land that he can rent by the month at very good prices. What he likes most about his job is that he can take his children to school, transport his family and carry out other work responsibilities. He hopes that his businesses progress even more in the future, since he wants to develop another one raising chickens, although he needs to save a bit more money first. This will be his first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he is grateful for those who made this possible so he can continue toward achieving his goals. He also promises to make his payments on time. He enjoys being part of his community bank because all of the members are responsible people who stand by each other. With the loan, he plans to purchase some cases of beer and soft drinks, and use the remainder to refurbish some parts in his motortaxi and to renovate some of the windows in the rooms he rents.

loans.use: to refurbish his motortaxi and purchase cases of beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: María Gloria

texts.es:
La señora María Gloria esta solicitando el préstamo para realizar un división en su vivienda y que le esta haciendo falta un cuarto. Ya que tiene dos hijos adolecentes una niña de 13 años y un niño de 11 años quienes ya necesitan su propio espacio en la casa.
La señora María Gloria es empleado de una tienda de discos como cajera y su esposo Abel trabaja con una compañía de trasportes como jefe de tráfico, son los ingresos que tiene para darles lo mejor a sus hijos y los estudios necesarios para un futuro triunfador.
Con el sueldo que recibe la señora María Gloria será para pagar el crédito, con el sueldo del trabajo del señor Abel será para los gastos familiares y escolares.
Solicitan el crédito para comprar el material necesario y realizar la mejora y que el señor Abel se encargara de la realizar la división de los cuartos.
Desean que sus hijos tengan ya su propio espacio y privacidad en su casa, mejor el patrimonio.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Gloria requests the loan to build a division in her house. It is lacking a room, because she has two teenage children, a 13-year-old girl and an 11-year-old boy, who need now their own space at home.

Mrs. María Gloria is an employee at a records store, she works as a cashier. Her husband Abel works in a transports company as transit chief. These are the income sources she has to give their children the best and the necessary studies to triumph in the future.

With the salary that Mrs. María Gloria receives she will be able to pay for the loan and the salary of Mr. Abel's work will be for the family and school-related expenses. They request the loan in order to buy the needed materials and make the improvement. Mr. Abel will be in charge of building the division of the rooms. 

They wish for their children to have their own space now and privacy at home, and to improve their personal assets.

loans.use: to build a division in a room.

loans.name: La Cruz De Yerbateros Group

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú, Les presento al grupo “La Cruz de Yerbateros”, el cual está conformado  por 10 integrantes, que en su mayoría se dedican al comercio minorista y así pueden lograr un sustento económico  para sus familias. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Isabel de 43 años de edad y madre soltera de 3 hijos. La Sra. Isabel se dedica diariamente al alquiler de moto taxi, por otro lado se dedica también a la venta de artículos para el hogar de forma ambulatoria, ambas actividades le generan ganancias para poder cubrir sus gastos y los estudios de sus hijos. Con el préstamo otorgado, realizara el mantenimiento de sus motos y además la ayudara a cubrir algunos gastos esenciales del hogar. En el futuro le gustaría tener una ampliación de su negocio de servicio de moto taxis y la culminación de los estudios de sus  hijos. Al igual que la Sra. Isabel todos los integrantes se encuentran muy agradecidos por el préstamo brindado y por la confianza depositada en ellos.
texts.en:
Greetings from Perú.  This is the "La Cruz de Yerbateros" Group, which is comprised of ten members, most of whom are retail merchants earning an income to support their families.  One of the members is Isabel, 43, who is a single mother of three.  Isabel has a motorcycle-taxi rental business and also works as a street vendor of household products.  Both businesses generate enough income to cover expenses and pay for her children's education.

The loan will be used to pay for maintenance of her motorcycles and help cover essential household expenses.  In the future she would like to expand her taxi business and help her children finish their education.  Just like Isabel, all the members are very grateful for the loan and the confidence shown in them.

loans.use: To pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan es un joven de 21 años de edad de profesión mecánico automotriz, soltero, quien actualmente vive con sus papas  en Sololá. Trabajador con bastantes metas  y sueños que cumplir en el futuro.
Gracias al apoyo de sus padres, el logro llevar sus estudios académicos primarios y segundarios la cual le permitió graduarse de Mecánico Automotriz en un colegio cercano a su vivienda, el ahora lleva tres años de ejercer este trabajo con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación tomando en cuenta el apoyo y el esfuerzo que le dieron sus padres cuando el estudiaba  así mismo el apoyo que el daba ayudando en la agricultura,
El se da cuenta que su necesidad esta aumentando cada día por que muchas personas lo buscan para solucionarles el problema a sus vehículos.
De este manera el solicita un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 y obtener mas herramientas para su taller de mecánica solucionando diversas fallas mecánicas de un automóvil teniendo así mas clientes y mejores ganancias, ya que el no cuenta con varias herramientas que son de mucha utilidad en su trabajo.
Su mayor meta es tener su propio terreno donde ubicar su taller de mecánica automotriz y ampliar la misma.
texts.en:
Juan is a 21 year old young man who is a automobile mechanic. He is single and lives with his parents in Sololá. He is hardworking and has many goals and dreams to fullfill in the future. 

Thanks to his parents' support, he was able to go to primary and secondary school which allowed him to graduate as an Automobile Mechanic from a school near his house. He now has practiced this profession for three years with much hard work and dedication. He is thankful for the support and hardwork his parents have done for him when he was studying. He also helped by working in agricuture.

He knows his rneeds are growing every day because a lot of people seek him out to solve the problems they have with their vehicles. He is asking for a loan of Q. 5,000.00 to get more tools for his vehicle repair shop to solve different automobile problems and thus have more customers and more income. Right now he doesn't have a lot of tools that are very useful in his work. 

His biggest goal is to have his own plot of land where he can set up his vehicle repair shop and expand it.

loans.use: to buy tools to expand his vehicle repair shop

loans.name: Rosa Sabina

texts.es: Rosa tiene ya trabajando hace 2 años vendiendo ropa y le gusta esta actividad que está ejerciendo. Su trabajo lo hace sola y no tiene horario. Unas de sus dificultades es la enfermedad que se le pueda presentar ya que esto le impediría seguir vendiendo su ropa. Rosa es separada tiene 3 hijos pero ya están adultos pero estudian en escuela fiscal, con el préstamo va comprar short, licras y blusas. Unas de sus aspiraciones es tener su propia boutique y local propio.
texts.en:
Rosa has been working for two years selling clothing and she enjoys what she does.  She works alone and has no fixed schedule.  One of the difficulties she is up against is any possible illness that could keep her from being able to work.  

Rosa is divorced and has three adult children who study at the fiscal school.  She will use the loan to buy shorts, lycra items and blouses.  One of her goals is to open her own boutique.

loans.use: To buy shorts, lycra items and blouses.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Reina tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a vender pupusas y panes, antes trabajaba como empleada domestica. Pero se separo de su esposo y empezó a trabajar en otra cosa que le generara ingresos para el sustento de sus hijos y pasar más tiempo ya que son mujeres e iban entrando a la adolescencia y necesitan su orientación. Por lo que, pensó en trabajar lo propio, se le vino la idea de vender pupusas y panes ya que enfrente de su casa esta una cancha de fútbol y sus hijas también podían ayudarle. 

Para comprar la mercadería debe caminar a pie veinticinco minutos hasta llegar al lugar donde aborda un autobús, por que en ese lugar no hay transporte, ella va a comprar todos los viernes los insumos que necesita, al realizar sus compras ella debe pagar una mototaxi para trasladar los insumos gastando alrededor de $10 en transporte cada viernes.
	
El préstamo que esta solicitando es para fabricar un portón, ya que tiene problemas con unos animales que andan en la calle y entran a su patio y se comen la ropa que deja lavada en su casa, además que entran unos perros a la cocina y le votan la comida. La señora ya no soporta esta problemática, por lo que solicita el préstamo para elaborar el portón. Lo que más desea es poseer una casa digna para ella y su familia muy diferente en la que vivió en su niñez, ya que procede de una familia humilde pero luchadora; agradece a la Fundación de antemano por la ayuda que brinda a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Reina is 53 years old. She is married and has two children. For 8 years she has sold pupusas and panes. Before she worked as a housemaid. She separated from her husband and started to work doing something else to generate income to support her children and spend more time with them since the girls were entering into adolesence and they needed her guidance. That's why she planned on working for her self, and had the idea of selling pupusas and bread, since in front of her house there was a soccer field, and her daughters could help her out.

To buy the merchandise she has to walk for twenty-five minutes to get to where she takes the bus, because there is no transportation where she lives. On Fridays she buys all of the ingredients she needs. Once she's made her purchases, she pays for a taxi to take them back, which costs around $10 every Friday.
	
The loan she is asking for is to make a gate. since she has problems with some animals that are wandering the streets and get into her yard. They eat the clothes she has washed and left outside. Also, some dogs get into the kitchen and spill her food. She can't stand this problem anymore and is asking for a loan to make a gate. What she wants the most is to have a home that is worthy of her and her family, very different from the one she lived in as a child. She is from a humble family of fighters. She is thankful to the Foundation for the help it has given to its clients.

loans.use: to make a gate.

loans.name: Yolanda Isabel

texts.es:
Yolanda es una mujer de 32 años, tiene aprobada la educación secundaria, es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos de 14, 3 y un año de edad. Ellos viven en el Cantón de Salcedo ubicado en la parte Oriente de Cotopaxi una de las provincias más importantes de la Sierra ecuatoriana. En Salcedo existen varios atractivos turísticos como lagunas y balnearios que ofrecen deportes extremos para sus turistas aventureros, sin embargo la principal actividad que desarrollan en este pueblo es la agricultura y en menor cuantía la ganadería. Los productos agrícolas más comercializados son granos como arveja, fréjol, lenteja, haba y también varias frutas y verduras. La producción de leche y sus derivados abastece la distribución interna y el excedente se envía a la Región Costa en productos ya procesados. La crianza de animales es también muy favorable por el  clima agradable del que se goza en el Cantón. A pesar de estas actividades productivas, hay índices muy preocupantes de analfabetismo y de pobreza por necesidades básicas insatisfechas como por ejemplo el servicio de alcantarillado que solo lo tienen el 25% de los hogares. 
Yolanda se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos como cerdos, cuyes paralelamente con la actividad de agricultura. Trabaja 8 horas en el día y ya tiene una experiencia de 15 años en el negocio. Con la experiencia adquirida hasta hoy, ella se siente capacitada para incrementar el negocio por lo que solicitó un préstamo para comprar más animales y de esta forma incrementar sus ingresos con los cuales espera poder retomar sus estudios y dar un estilo de vida de calidad a sus hijos. Ella está muy agradecida con Fundación Alternativa por el apoyo que brindan al sector rural y además por la capacitación y asesoría que le brindan para administrar sus recursos de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a 32 year old woman. She finished secondary school and is divorced with three children, aged 14, 3 and 1. They live in the Salcedo canton, located in the eastern part of Cotopaxi, one of the most important provinces of the Ecuadorian sierra. In Salcedo there are various tourist attractions such as lakes and beaches that offer extreme sports for adventurous tourists. Nonetheless, the main activity in this town is farming and to a lesser extent, livestock. The farming products that are sold the most are grains, such as peas, beans, lentils, lima beans and various fruits and vegetables. Milk and milk products are sold locally and what is left over is sent to the coast as processed products. Raising animals is also very favorable because of the pleasant climate enjoyed in the canton. Despite these productive activities, there are worrisome levels of illiteracy and poverty and a lack of basic necessitites such as sewer services, which only 25% of homes have.
 
Yolanda raises domestic animals such as pigs and guinea pigs. She also is a farmer. She works 8 hours a day and has 15 years experience in the business. With the experience she has acquired so far, she feels capable of growing her business and that is why she has asked for a loan to buy more animals and invrease her income. She hopes to be able to go back to school and give her children a higher quality of life. She is very grateful to the Fundación Alternativa for the support it has offered the rural sector and also for the training and consulting it offers to manage resources in a better way.

loans.use: to buy animals and increase her sales.

loans.name: Na's Group

texts.en:
Na is 36 years of age, married, and blessed with two children. He and his family are residents in a rural area of Moung Russey district located in Battambang province, Cambodia. He is the breadwinner in the family. He earns his income via farming rice on six-hectares of farmland, earning around 16,000 KHR per day. Na has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles already and successfully repaid the loan. The help that he has already received from VisionFund in the form of previous loans has been crucial for him to make the living standard of his family better. 

Now he is leading his fellow group member who is a first-time borrower with Kiva’s partner VisionFund to take out a loan in the amount of 2,400,000 KHR in total. Na will use his new requested loan portion, which is 1,400,000 KHR to purchase fertilizer. After receiving his loan portion, he is willing to use it wisely and efficiently in order to boost his income so that he can smoothly repay the loan and set aside some money to build a comfortable and warm house for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua produces kenkey for sale at Eguafo. Kenkey is boiled balls of fermented cooked maize meal and raw maize dough wrapped in cornhusks. 

Efua is married and has five children. She is responsible for caring for them. 

She has been selling kenkey for 15 years.  She will use her loan to buy bags of maize for the production of kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize for the production of kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Yousra

texts.en: Yousra is a 48-year-old widow from Al Russiefeh, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for home improvements. She would like to do maintenance on her home and to repaint her home. She hopes in the future to provide her family with a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa is married and has five children. She sells palm oil and palm kernel oil for sale at Eguafo near Elmina, which she has done for 10 years. Her husband is a farmer. Adjoa uses her income to  assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  

Adjoa will use the loan to purchase palm fruit and palm kernels to extract oil for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase palm fruit and palm kernels to extract oil for sale.

loans.name: Sun's Group

texts.en:
A 58-year-old resident in a rural area of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia, Sun is married and blessed with five children. He meets his family’s needs by farming rice on one hectare of farmland and by planting pineapples. Having been in the current business for 14 years, he is able to earn about 20,000KHR per day. 

A first-time borrower, Sun is leading a group to request a loan of 2,200,000KHR in total. The loan portion of Sun, 1,000,000KHR, will be spent on buying fertilizers to apply in his rice and pineapple farmland. Via the help of this loan, Sun hopes that his current business will provide him with a better quality and higher crop yields.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to apply to his rice and pineapple farmland

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
Khorn is 49 years old and lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is married and has four children, one daughter of whom is dependent on her and still in school. The main source of the family’s income comes from rice farming, which she has done for six years. To earn more income for the family, Khorn also raises pigs and her husband works for others as a paid worker. 

The challenge for her main business, which is rice farming, is the lack of sufficient water. Thus, she is now leading a group of two female members to request a loan of 1,000,000KHR each. This will be their first time raising funds from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. As a group leader, Khorn plans on using some of her loan to buy fertilizers, pay labor fees, and fatten her pigs by buying pig feed. She will spend the other part on gasoline. After receiving the loan, Khorn will use it wisely to benefit her business so that she can have higher crop yields as well as a higher income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 29-year-old married woman from Al Russfifeh in Amman - Jordan. She has three children. She has requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses. In the future, she would like to request another loan to improve the living conditions of her family.

Since Maha is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Khi's Group

texts.en:
Khi, 36 years old, lives in a rural area of the district of Dambae located in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is married and has four children, three daughters and one son, all of whom are students and still dependent on her. 

Khi makes her living through agriculture. She plants cassava and farms rice. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. She is leading a group of three to request a loan in the amount of 6,610,000 KHR in total. This is the first-cycle loan for Khi with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. 

With her loan portion, which is 2,000,000 KHR, Khi will buy fertilizers and pesticides as well as pay to cultivate her land. She hopes that her business will provide her with greater yields so she can earn more profit in order to support her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay to cultivate the land.

loans.name: Shahmim

texts.en:
Shahmim is 38 years old and the mother of four children. She is in her first loan cycle with the Kashf Foundation. For many years, Shahmim has been running a milk-selling business. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. 

With the passage of time, her sales increased as did her income. Now Shahmim has two buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, Shahmim is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

While talking to the Kashf officer, Shahmim shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: To purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Sarwari

texts.en:
Ms. Sarwari, age 28, is a milk vendor. She has been engaged in her business for the past five years. She is married and is shown holding her son in the photo shown above. 

She has worked in association with Kashf Foundation for the past two years and has demonstrated excellent repayment behavior. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation to increase her earning capacity. Her husband works in a small shoe-making factory and earns a very low income, so she is working hard to contribute to the family income. 

Ms. Sarwari has requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to be utilized for the purchase of another milking buffalo. In this way, she will be able to increase her sales by targeting more customers. She wishes to utilize part of her profits on improving her family's well-being and standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase of another milking buffalo

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Fatima prefers that her photo not appear on the internet; thus the above photo is of her son. 

Fatima is a 46-year-old married woman who has five family members from Madaba, Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 JOD to pay for her to buy new furniture for her household. In the future, she would like to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for her household.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, age 24, stopped her education in the tenth grade. She is married with one child who is only 3 weeks old. Her
husband is a taylor, and they all live in Gardnesville.  

For the past 10 years, Evelyn has been managing her provision shop, where she sells bread, soft drinks, sardines, biscuits, milk, candy, mayonnaise and many other items. Because of the location of her shop, she makes a profit when she sells items. She uses the profit to improve the business and help her husband with the family's expenses. 

Evelyn has requested this loan to purchase more bread, soft drinks, sardines, biscuits, candy and milk to increase her sales. She plans to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bread, soft drinks, sardines, biscuits, candy and milk to increase her sales.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati has been a fish vendor for several years. Her length of experience has allowed her to come to understand the likes and dislikes of her customers, and she operates her business well. She has two children, whom she loves to care for.

She is requesting another loan so as to invest further capital into her current business. Her primary business goal is to meet the demand of her customers. With this loan, she will be able to add a stock of fish to offer for sale.

loans.use: to add a stock of fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Olga

texts.pt:
Divorciada e mãe de 3 filhos que já não frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante e dona do próprio negócio de venda de roupas diversas. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar mercadorias (lençóis, capulanas, blusas, mantas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja investir numa mercearia, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais para garantir o pagamento do desembolso efectuado.
texts.en:
Olga is divorced and the mother of 3 children who are no longer in School, lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else. She's a trader and owns her own business buying and selling various clothes. With this loan she intends to buy merchandise (sheets, traditional Mozambican cloths, blouses, blankets and others) to increase the quantity of her stock. In future she wishes to invest in a grocery store and to this end, she vomits to duly paying off this loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.
Her challenge is to work more in order to guarantee the return on her investment.

loans.use: buy merchandise (sheets, traditional Mozambican cloths, blouses, blankets and others)

loans.name: Arminda

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 4 filhos todos frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha como assistente técnica num posto Administrativo. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, blocos, areia, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua outra obra no bairro de Magoanine. 
No futuro deseja concluir esta nova casa e mobilar, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é concluir a casa para poder alugar e aumentar a sua renda mensal.
texts.en:
Arminda is married and the mother of 4 children who all attend School, lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else. She works as a technical assistant in an Administrative post. With this loan she intends to buy construction material (cement, blocks, sand, stone and others) in order to continue building her home and for another construction in the Magoanine neighbourhood.

In future she wishes to complete this new house and furnish it and to this end, she commits to duly paying off this loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku. Her challenge is to complete her house so that she can rent it out and increase her monthly income.

loans.use: buy construction material (cement, blocks, sand, stone and others) in order to continue building her home and for another construction in the Magoanine neighbourhood.

loans.name: Firdos

texts.en:
Ms. Firdos, age 43, operates a hand embroidery business. She has a great deal of experience with this work and is highly skilled in its techniques. She earns enough to lead a decent life, but her husband is employed as a salesperson in a garment shop and earns insufficient wages to meet household expenditures alone. For this reason, the income from her business is essential in order for them to adequately provide for the family.

Due to an increase in demand from her customers, she is involving her sisters to assist her in her work. To help her continue operations of her business, she has requested a loan of Rs 15,000 to buy reels of thread and more frames from the market at lower rates, which will allow her to meet with the increasing demand. 

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of her revenue to build a separate room for her children. She is confident that this loan will be beneficial to herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread and more frames from the market in order to meet the increasing demand for her work

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba runs a business cooking and selling kenkey, a traditional dish of boiled maize dough, at the Eguafo market. She uses her income to help her husband, who is a farmer, in paying their children's school fees. She and her husband have five dependents. Ava has operated her business for the past seven years.

Aba will use her loan funds to purchase bags of maize for making kenkey. With the new profits, Aba plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for making kenkey

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, age 35, lives at Gardnersville with her friend and three children. Her children are between the ages of 2 and 13, and are in school. Mary has a table in the market where she has been selling lappers (traditional country cloth) and ladies' slippers for the past five years. She received money from her aunt to start in this business.

Because of the durability of her lappers and slippers, she makes a profit when she sells, and with the profit she buys more goods for her business and helps her husband with the educational expenses of her children. 

She has requested a loan to purchase more lappers and ladies' slippers for the business. Her plan for the future is to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more lappers (traditional country cloth) and ladies' slippers for the business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 8 filhos, 5 dos quais ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha como polícia de protecção e quadro do Ministério do interior. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (barrotes, chapas, cimento, blocos, areia e outros) para ampliar a sua casa.
No futuro deseja terminar a obra da sua casa e mobilar para oferecer mais conforto a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é liquidar o empréstimo o mais rápido possível para pedir mais.
texts.en:
Francisco is married and the father of 8 children, 5 of whom attend School, lives in his own house with his family and doesn't support anyone else. He works as a protection policeman and is a permanent employee of the Ministry of the Interior. With this loan he intends to buy construction materials (beams, metal sheets, cement, blocks, sand and others) to expand his house.

In future he wishes to complete the construction of his house and furnish it to provide more comfort to his family and to this end he commits to duly paying off his loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku. His challenge is to pay back his loan as quickly as possible and request another.

loans.use: buy construction materials (beams, metal sheets, cement, blocks, sand and others) to expand his house

loans.name: Som's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural area of Kror Kor district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Som is 22 years old and married with one daughter, who is still dependent on her. Som earns her living through farming rice on two-hectares of farmland and her husband complements the income by raising pigs and farming rice also. Som is leading a group of four female members to request a loan in the amount of 2,400,000 KHR in total. 

For the group leader, Som, this will be the first loan cycle with VisionFund. With her first loan portion, which is 1,000,000 KHR, Som plans on buying fertilizers for her farmland and feed for pigs. Via the help of this loan, she highly hopes that the living standard of her family will be much better and her business will provide a good quality and higher crop yields so that she can sell for more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and feeds for pigs.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa cooks banku (a local dish made of corn dough) for sale. She serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce at Eguafo near Elmina.  She is married with four children.  Adjoa has been into this business for four years now.  She uses her income to support the husband in the general up keep of her family. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to mount a stall for the sale of her cooked banku and fish.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her banku for sale.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte sells children's and ladies' clothes at Putubiw near Cape Coast.  

She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer.  

Charlotte has been selling children's and ladies' clothes for six years. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying their children's school fees. 

Her loan will be used to buy children's and ladies' wear to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy children's and ladies' wear to sell.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is a is a petty trader. She sells soft drinks, toffies, ice creams, cocoa drinks, ice water, powdered milk, sugar, milk, gari and other groceries.

Faustina is married and has three children. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay accommodation bills.  

Faustina will use her loan to purchase more groceries for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes sells gari, a staple food made from cassava. She has been selling gari for seven years now. 

She is married to a farmer and has five dependents. She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of her children.  

Agnes needs this loan to purchase bags of gari to sell. With the new profit, Agnes plan to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of gari to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is a fish monger and a petty trader. She sells vegetables like gardeneggs (eggplant), peppers, tomatoes, onions and other food items at Putubiw.  She has been in this business for some time now and she wishes to buy other food items requested by her customers, and so a loan from Kiva will be used to buy a variety of vegetables and also fish to smoke and sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables and also fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 51-year-old active, married woman. She is the mother of five children. She lives in a large conventional family with her husband, her children and other relatives. Her husband is employed in a small general store as a salesperson.

She has been in the business of making red chili powder for about 18 years at her home. She buys red chilies in bulk from the near city and makes them into powder to sell in her community. Chili powder is very commonly used in food for taste. She is happy doing it for the sake of her family.

Nusrat needs to earn more to cover everyday expenditures of her family. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for five years. She has excellent repayment behavior. To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of PKR 25,000. She will be using the loan to buy a large quantity of red chilies. She expects an increase in her business income as she expands her business. She intends to use the earned profits to provide good and quality education to her children.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of red chilies.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 35 years old, married and has two children. 

To earn a living, he supplies bread and milk to retail shops. He has employed one person in the business. He has been running the business for six years.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become financially stable because his business has improved. This has enabled him to provide for his family in a better way.

John has requested for a loan of 40,000 KES to buy a motorbike for transporting his supplies.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transporting goods.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama cooks banku (a corn dough staple) for sale. She serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce at Putubiw near Cape Coast.  

She is married to a farmer and has six children.  

Ama has been in this business for two years. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. 

Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish that she uses in preparing her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish that she uses in preparing her banku  for sale.

loans.name: Arwa

texts.en:
For cultural reasons, Arwa prefers that her photo not appear on the Internet. Thus the above photo is of her husband. Arwa, 22, is a married woman who has 3 family members, in Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to do home maintenance and to buy some household items. She hopes to improve her family's standard of living.
Since Arwa is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Salha

texts.en:
Salha is a 49-year-old married woman who has four family members from Irbid, Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to do maintenance of the home and to buy new furniture. She hopes in the future to improve her family's social economic status.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is still running her confectionery production at her own apartment. Thanks to her business income she provides for herself and for her son. Also, she was able to pay her son’s tuition fees. Now her son is serving in the army and Lilit manages her business by herself. 

With her first Kiva loan, Lilit was able to buy a new oven and a large lot of sugar and flour for her production. Now she is asking for a 450.000 AMD loan to buy walnuts, flour and sugar supplies for her confectionery production. 

In the future, Lilit intends to develop her business and to relocate her business from her apartment to the workshop.

loans.use: to buy walnuts, flour and sugar supplies for her confectionery production.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua runs a business frying and selling doughnuts. She offers her goods for sale at a nearby school at Putubiw near Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana. She serves the doughnuts with locally made drinks such as ginger drink and millet drink. She is married.  

Her loan will be used to purchase flour, sugar, oil, and other ingredients to enable her to increase her sales. The new profit realized will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, oil, and other ingredients for making and selling fried doughnuts

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa operates a business cooking rice and fish stew, which she offers for sale at Putubiw near Cape Coast. In the photo, Adwowa is showing the raw rice she uses. She has been engaged in this business for 24 years and uses her income to help her husband to support the family. They have four children.

Adwowa intends to use her loan to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook and offer for sale. With her new profits, Adwowa plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook and offer for sale

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Ghada prefers that her photo is not on the internet. The above photo is of her husband.

Ghada is a 36 year old married female from Madaba, in Jordan. She has 4 children and has requested a 600 JOD loan to pay for buying milk in order to produce cheese. She has expanded her project and has become well known in the nearby community. She would like to expand her project and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for buying milk to produce cheese.

loans.name: Elmer Antonio

texts.es:
Elmer, continúa en su taller de reparación, está solicitando un préstamo por qué necesita reparar el techo del negocio, ya que en este tiempo de invierno algunas de sus herramientas se humedece, también quiere comprar algunas materiales necesarios para realizar su trabajo a los clientes (pintura de varios colores), hoy en dia tambien remodela vehiculos, a parte de las estructuras metalicas.

El manifiesta que el préstamo le ha servido para poder continuar realizando una buena labor, que hasta el momento le ha permitido prestar buenos servicios a los clientes, en su hogar todos los miembros se mantiene y han logrado salir adelante a través del trabajo diario.
texts.en:
Elmer continues with his repair shop.  He is requesting a loan because he needs to repair the roof of his business.  During this winter season some of his tools become damp.  He also wants to buy some materials he needs to do the work for his customers (various colors of paint).  He now also does body work on vehicles.

He says that the loan has helped him be able to continue doing good work.  So far it has allowed him to provide good service to his customers.

He supports all of the members of his household, and they have managed to get ahead through his daily work.

loans.use: to repair the roof and to buy paint.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is 51 years old. She is a very dedicated and hard-working woman, as well as a cheerful and dynamic one. She lives with her husband and 27-year-old daughter. They own the house they live in. The family has a grocery store. Lia's business consists of selling soft drinks and sweets of various flavors and brands. Suppliers deliver to her store, and she buys the merchandise from them at wholesale prices before retailing it. She has been in this business for 10 years and is very well-known in the area. 

Lia has requested a loan to better stock her store. This money will help her to expand her store and earn more profit. The other part of the credit will be used for house renovation. The existing house is old and damaged. Lia will purchase building materials and repair the house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 50 years old, married and has five children. He does farming to earn a living. He also owns a barber shop for more income generation. Through Faulu Kenya, he has managed to access loans easily and this has enabled him to educate his children.

John hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future for more income generation. He has requested for a loan of 100,000 KES to buy dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana, age 67, is a teacher and a farmer in the district of Akhmeta in East Georgia. She lives with her son, her daughter-in-law, and a granddaughter, who is a student. 

The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they have a small dairy farm of four milk cows, whose milk is used for dairy production. Liana produces cheese to sell to local cheese retailers. In addition, they grow maize on a family-owned land. The harvested production is used to support the family needs. Liana and her daughter-in-law are also teachers at the local school, where they earn monthly salaries.

Liana works hard, but the family still does not produce enough income to build savings and improve the living conditions of the family.

She has requested this loan in order to repair a cattle-shed. With the loan funds, she will purchase construction materials for building the shed. The existing one is too small and does not allow Liana to plan future expansion of the family’s farming activities. 

In the future, she intends to develop an animal husbandry business so that she can produce and sell more cheese. This will increase the family income and Liana will be able to finance the education of her granddaughter. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to repair and enlarge a cattle-shed

loans.name: Nkonge

texts.en:
Nkonge is 35 years old. She has been farming since 2004. She has employed two people to assist her on her farm. She does mixed farming, rearing dairy cows and growing kale, maize and potatoes. 

Through her previous loans from Faulu Kenya, she has managed to expand her farm. Nkonge hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future.  

She has requested 100,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy a dairy cow and seedlings.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and seedlings.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 53 years old and is widowed with four children. He and his family live in Tiribe, which is located in the coastal region of Kenya. James makes a living working as a carpenter and works on various types of furniture. He has been operating his business for 29 years and has already demonstrated that he can successfully make prompt loan repayments.

James works very hard to provide for his family. He plans to use the support from this loan to invest in his business and hopefully offer higher quality work and services to his clients. He is grateful to lenders for their support. He plans to purchase timber to make furniture that his customers have ordered.

loans.use: to purchase timber to make furniture.

loans.name: Queen Group

texts.en:
This is a group of two women whose ages are 47 and 57 years. Their economic activities include the sale of provisions, soft drinks, cooked food (rice and stew, yam and stew), and also local dishes like banku (cooked maize paste) and soup fufu (cooked and pounded cassava and plantain).

Grace, the leader of this group, is 49 and married to Williams, a 50-year-old security guard. They have two children, 23 and 13. She operates a restaurant where she sells cooked yam, plantain, rice, fish, and meat of all kinds. She sells from Monday to Sunday and from morning to evening. She supports her husband in taking care of their home.
 
This is her fourth loan and she needs an amount of 1,200 GHS to enable her to buy more items to sell.

As a group, they need a total amount of 2,200 GHS to meet their customers' demands.

loans.use: To buy yam, rice, fish, meat, maize paste, cassava and plantain to cook food and sell to customers.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is 22 years old, a vigorous, unmarried woman. 

She has been in the business of hand-embroidery for the past five years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. 

Her father is employed in a small factory, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. Noreen’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand.
